7787044,HOTEL,Faena Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1d/78/a4/13/exterior-view.jpg,[],5,$$$$,"$729 - $1,426",hotel,4.5,0.0,,13055348800,"3201 Collins Ave Faena District, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4023",reservations-miamibeach@faena.com,[],179,[],25.807375,-80.12364,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d7787044-Reviews-Faena_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.faena.com/miami-beach,#5 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2123,"Faena is over-rated. 

It would be a 3 star review if it were a 4 star $500 a night type place. But given the price point (we paid $1600/night for our room) and 5 star rating, I am giving it 2. There are much better options for the price point and 5 star category in this location, in my experience (have stayed in miami beach multiple times). 

To start with the positive: The services is really good/attentive, the grounds (not rooms) and restaurants are cool/flashy/sceney, and the pool/grounds are solid (not the best in miami). It is popular for the restaurants and cool designs on the grounds and well trained staff. However overall I think there are much better luxury options in miami beach / south beach for an actual stay, if you care more about quality of rooms/actual property, location, and pool. 

Issues: 1) the rooms are not that nice. We booked a junior king suite partial ocean view room for $1600/night. The room felt like 4 star vegas with no view. Low ceilings, bones and finishing quality mediocre, cool design touches but overall not 5 star room bones. 2) the hotel is right next to another taller / bigger building that is pretty close, so 95% of the view was blocked/looking directly at that building. We were on the north side which is where half the rooms of the type we booked are, maybe the other side is better. We didnt feel like we were on the beach despite the price and description of the room, you could not see ocean unless standing at an extreme angle to the window. We asked for an upgrade because we thought the description was misleading; we were told this was normal / how the rooms were, and would have to pay significantly more to upgrade. 3) location: it isnt that close to nice restaurants other than the ones at the hotel, which are good, but there isnt much to do around the actual hotel. Options are stay on the grounds or get a 20 minute uber. Not walkable. 

Overall I would go here for dinner / drinks and stay somewhere else. One hotel (better all around, most similar from a luxury standpoint but better luxury IMO), Standard (better vibe, better pool, not as luxury, but cooler, and better location), and fountainebleau (better resort-like if that is what you want, faena is kind of resort like) are all better options in my experience. All have better views/pool, and the One and Standard are notably better locations (especially the standard; One is closer / more walkable. The FB is even further/worse location but if you dont want to leave it is better than Faena).  I think Faena gets the strong reviews more from the service (which is great and which does make people want to reciprocate with a good review) and the restaurants (they are cool but you dont need to stay here to eat here). And the unique designs/art. But actual rooms, views, location all mediocre, pool etc. fine but not standout. ",Overrated. There are better luxury options on miami beach / south beach

7787044,HOTEL,Faena Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1d/78/a4/13/exterior-view.jpg,[],5,$$$$,"$729 - $1,426",hotel,4.5,0.0,,13055348800,"3201 Collins Ave Faena District, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4023",reservations-miamibeach@faena.com,[],179,[],25.807375,-80.12364,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d7787044-Reviews-Faena_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.faena.com/miami-beach,#5 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2123,"This is a very good hotel.   But after the superlative reviews and at a rather breathtaking price, I honestly was expecting something perfect.  

The pluses: the staff, the staff, the staff.  Kind and genuinely wanting to be helpful.  Also the spa - exquisite and great treatment.   The decor is as special as you would expect from the pictures you have seen.  

The minuses: my room (415) was billed as an ocean view junior suite.  However, the ocean view from such a low floor isn’t much - and the room, right on top of the spa, looks much more directly onto an events/dining area - sitting on the balcony didn’t feel private or restful at all.  While some junior suites have desk areas, this one did not - a shame as I had to work.  I asked about moving but they were undersndably fully booked.  Of course no Virtuoso upgrade available. Also, there was a crib in my room ( not requested by me) when I checked in. I asked before dinner and after dinner to have it removed. After I got tired of waiting for someone to come to get it I just moved it into the hallway myself. Not a big deal but not perfect service either.  These things aren’t tragedies but at more than 2700/night w fees and taxes ….. you do want better. 

Minor quibbles with the room had to do with electricity: the outlet for the coffee maker was broken and although engineering was called, it wasn’t fixed. And the light switches could drive you crazy trying to get the lights to actually turn off.  Japanese toilet is a great touch though.

Food and beverage; dinner at Los Fuegos and breakfast were great service.   Nothing that memorable food wise but nothing was bad either.   The steak at Los Fuegos was good but the appetizer was bland - same w breakfast dishes.  The pool and beach food service is great but the food not that exciting. Go to the pool early if you want an umbrella. By 11:30 AM you could still get a lounger, but nothing shaded.

I will probably come back because of the service. I think I will book a lower room category that is less expensive , so I am less disappointed!",Very good  but not perfect

Hotel is right on the beach and is how you would expect a  ‘cool’ Miami Beach hotel to be. “in” crowd, Art Deco type building, swanky interior (which may or may not be your taste).

Staff was friendly, beach nice, room spacious and clean. Food was very nice throughout the hotel.

Also would like to point out that they have a nice outdoor bar area for pre dinner drinks and an a busy indoor bar for later boasting live music - really a great plus.

Minor cons: 
- some of the room features & furnitures soemwhat dated (eg scratches, dents, spots) even though room was very clean.
- valet can be soemwhat disorganized so plan in advance if you need your car urgently

All in all a good experience, would not mind staying here again but also might check out another place next time round.",“Cool” Miami Beach Hotel

7787044,HOTEL,Faena Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1d/78/a4/13/exterior-view.jpg,[],5,$$$$,"$729 - $1,426",hotel,4.5,0.0,,13055348800,"3201 Collins Ave Faena District, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4023",reservations-miamibeach@faena.com,[],179,[],25.807375,-80.12364,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d7787044-Reviews-Faena_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.faena.com/miami-beach,#5 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2123,"Maybe it was because of the four day Presidents weekend. Maybe it was because there was a massive boat show in town. Either way, we got suckered into paying $2,500/night for three nights at the Faena, so we we expected opulence.  What we got was a ripoff at a $400/night hotel. 
The location is excellent, right on a private beach. That’s the only positive of this review. Here’s the abundant negatives:
* it was a windy day at the beach, so we asked for a canopy. We were told they were all reserved. There were only six of them. For an entire hotel. So we instead sat on the windy beach and enjoyed a $20 pina colada in a pre-packaged coconut.
* so we went to the pool. You can’t just sit down, they find you a seat. But we were told all the lounges were reserved, even the empty ones that go with the cabanas, and the cabanas were all reserved. Come back in an hour, we were told.
* our room, which was exceedingly average, smelled like mildew. They sent housekeeping with some sprays. The room was also quite dark, and the lights didn’t go up any higher.
* as for Miami Beach, it’s nice. There’s a long walkway that I went on for a mile or so, seeing where it led. Turns out it didn’t lead anywhere. There’s not much to do here other than beach and restaurants. 
* there’s some fun art, including gold wooly mammoth bones. But the glass case is cracked, and, like the rest of this hotel, the display seems old and neglected.
And that, dear reader, all happened within 24 hours. Because after the pool fiasco, we up and left the Faena for greener pastures — the reliable Four Seasons in the Brickell section of Miami, which was wonderful (see my review of that wonderful hotel for details). The Faena was nice enough to cancel our second and third nights, and we paid less than half at a way better hotel. Do yourself a favor. Skip this aging monolith.",BEWARE: Do not overpay!

111904,HOTEL,The Kent Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/26/f8/ee/17/the-kent-hotel.jpg,[],8,$$$,$166 - $279,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17867887268,"1131 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4604",sales@thekenthotel.com,[],60,[],25.78242,-80.13116,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d111904-Reviews-The_Kent_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.thekenthotel.com,#8 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1400,"I approached the hotel with trepidation – it looked a little worn on the outside.  Once I reached the door, complete with a doorman opening the door for me, things changed.  The interior of the building, lobby to rooms, is luxurious.  The finishings are thoughtful and classy.  Location is great, right at the heart of everything I wanted to see/do, and less than two blocks from the transit stop to get me to and from the airport.  Internet was acceptable and the TV was massive.  There were a number of pillow choices and the plugs were high on the wall – so you were less likely to forget your charging cord.  I also loved the room safe, which was large enough for both my camera and laptop.  This is not typical.  I had only one picky thing with the room – there is no shelf in the bathroom.  I’m a girl.  I really need a shelf for “stuff”.  I did appreciate the box of Kleenex near the bed.  This is one of those nice things often overlooked these days.  I had two major issues, however, not specifically related to the room condition.  One was about the reservation.  I specifically asked for a “quiet” room and hotel staff responded that this was fine.  I was given the room right next to reception.  Not quiet!  That being said, this is an old-construction building with thick walls and a Miami air conditioner chugging along with lots of white noise, so I muddled through with my earplugs.  (I was also really, really tired, which helped with the falling asleep).  My other concern isn’t so much with the Kent Hotel, but the practice of adding a surprise “resort fee”.  I had made the reservation a good bit in advance.  Why was I never told that there would be a little something extra?  And for what?  The hotel is nice, but there is no pool, no gym, no reserved seats/umbrellas on the beach, no free breakfast, and, unlike the last hotel where I ~~didn’t~~ have to pay a resort fee, no free kayaks or inner tubes to use.  The staff, who were very friendly, clearly felt bad about this and were quite apologetic.  The receptionist offered up a beach towel if I wanted one (I didn’t, but she looked so sorry …)  She said that the resort fee was a state tax.  Sorry Kent, and all the other hotels.  This sounds more like a “you” problem rather than a “me” problem.  At the very least, let us know about these fees ahead of time instead of playing gotcha.  And please, don’t charge me extra money at the last minute to use a towel.  Which I didn’t even use.  Bottom line.  Would I book here again?  Maybe.  I paid a deeply discounted rate due to reward points.  If I had to pay full price, no.  If I could pay the same rate I actually paid, then yes, probably.",A Mixed Bag

23093311,HOTEL,The Goodtime Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/db/09/6e/strawberry-moon-pool.jpg,[],6,$$$,$182 - $345,hotel,4.5,3.5,This property is classified according to Giata.,17862446634,"601 Washington Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139",info@thegoodtimehotel.com,[],266,[],25.776352,-80.13388,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d23093311-Reviews-The_Goodtime_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.thegoodtimehotel.com/,#6 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1038,"Great Hotel décor and service was excellent, the lady at check in (i didn't catch her name)  was very very helpful and informative.

Once at the pool we lay on some Beds(as in double beds) very comfortable and found the Pool area very stylish, pretty and tasteful. 
However at 11.45am we were asked did we wish to stay on these beds as they were chargeable(which we didn't  realise) starting at $500 then $400 then $300 !!! OR move over to the seats behind which are free???? I am well travelled but have never come across this ever anywhere before so it come as a complete surprise to us. 
Anyway we chose not to pay as it seemed rather steep having already paid for our stay we thought it ridiculous as there are nowhere near enough sunbeds or seats for the amount of rooms at this Hotel, but that's how it is apparently !!
Our stay was good rooms are adequate, though rather small. Bathrooms are roomy and tastefully decorated. Clarke needs a mention who works on the front desk, he was a Gem and really helpful and a really good fella.
Would we stay again - doubtful !! The place is beautiful but pretentious and i think rather expensive for Room Only.  (very pretty though and beautiful Towels that match the décor)",Goodtime was Good

After a wonderful introduction, a delightful sense of discovery unfolds on the way to the guest rooms strolling past collected art and an eclectic decor of tropical bohème. I immediately felt right at home in a pink tonal palette of Barbiecore decor. The room was perfectly Barbie sized, tiny petite but well accessorized. 
By morning we were “sliving” on Sunday at the rooftop pool and snapped photos posing under the palmbrellas leaving our social media friends and family “jelly”.
As the sunset, we sat comfortably on the patio of Strawberry Moon for a casually elegant dinner. Veronika was our server, she was playfully attentive and made excellent recommendations regarding food and drink pairings. 
Highly recommend this hotel for a Miami Beach vacation or in our case “staycation”. The entire staff was friendly and helpful throughout our visit.","The Miami Beach hotel of your deco dreams, better than A Malibu Beach house and none of the furniture is plastic!"

Warmly greeted and waved farewell by Juan, efficiently checked in and out by Chris, served drinks and dinner with class by Mikaela, delivered breakfast with grace by Barbara, and taken on a detailed tour in style by Paul! I was mesmerized by the artist theme and enjoyed the photography, poetry and jazz. The easy access to the beach including longe chairs and towels was priceless. The room was clean, cozy and quiet. The location was superb and enjoyed strolling down Ocean Drive and Collins. Can’t wait to come back and grateful to have discovered this special place! Thank you for a fantastic experience.",A hotel with soul

1175532,HOTEL,The Betsy South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/dc/f3/b7/the-betsy-south-beach.jpg,[],7,$$$$,$352 - $708,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18559321466,"1440 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4108",info@thebetsyhotel.com,[],130,[],25.78652,-80.129684,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1175532-Reviews-The_Betsy_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.thebetsyhotel.com/,#7 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,4682,"We stayed at the Betsy during our March break with our two children (14 & 12).  We were immediately impressed and welcomed by the gorgeous lobby and lounge area (just like the photos!), and friendly hotel staff, who greeted us with champagne and beverages for our children. We enjoyed the ambiance - the bar, delicious scents, calming music, comforting decor.   We arrived early - much before check-in time, but no problem - our luggage was tucked away while we went up to the rooftop pool.  This was a treat!  The pool was well staffed, had a great menu and a nice vibe… great play list, which ties in with the nostalgic rock n’ roll photos that grace the hotel walls.  The pool vibe is distinctly different, yet complimentary to that of the library area, where classical music, often opera is piped in. The blue velvet sofa was my favorite place to read.  Every morning at 7:30, I joined the rooftop yoga class, with its beautiful views of the sun rising, followed by a coffee at the Starbucks across the street and a walk on the beach!  Glorious!

When it came to meals, the Betsy did not disappoint!  We had breakfast and dinner on the front patio and several lunches at the pool.  The prices were a little on the high side but the portions were large.  

Fritzner at the front desk was incredibly attentive and accommodating, and went the extra mile to ensure that we had a great stay.  Art, the concierge is a true gem of this hotel, and his restaurant recommendations were absolutely spot on!!  Juan, the bellman was the first to greet us, helping us with our luggage and making us feel welcome. 

The only elements that prevented me from rating this as 5 stars was our room - a 2-double bed suite with a pull-out sofa.  It was nicely decorated with green leafy wallpaper, cute, comfortable beds, and a sitting area, but the view left something to be desired.  

Overall, we had a fabulous time, at this well-appointed, friendly, art-filled, beautiful boutique hotel.",Lovely Hotel

We took the train from Rhode Island,  we love the train but it's a long journey.  Initially my husband  expressed regret that we hadn't gotten off in Orlando.  Well, once we checked into The Hampton Inn Mid Beach all our regrets disappeared.   We had room 524, a corner room with a view overlooking Collins Ave and the Atlantic.   The hotel was built in 1945 and was one of last Art Deco buildings built.  The manager of the hotel graciously shared the hotel's history with us.  Everyone at the hotel was helpful, pleasant and gracious.  The hotel is impeccably clean with outstanding soundproofing.  The rooms are somewhat small but in keeping with hotel's built in the 40's.  They use space very efficiently so the room size is irrelevant.  The location is PERFECT.  Collins Ave offers many dining opportunities within a short walk from the front door.  There is also a wonderful restaurant just off the lobby.  The beach is a very short stroll from the front door.

We have now decided to book two yearly visits to The Hampton Inn Mid Beach. ",12 out of 10 Hotel!!

115192,HOTEL,Pelican Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/27/84/3a/25/pelican-hotel.jpg,[],51,$$$$,$265 - $454,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 800-673-3373,"826 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-5809",reservation@pelicanhotel.com,[],29,[],25.778536,-80.13113,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d115192-Reviews-Pelican_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.pelicanhotel.com/,#51 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1429,"We’ve stayed on Ocean Drive a few times previously and , of the art deco hotels, thought the Pelican one of the best. It’s perfectly located, stylish and cleverly furnished to immerse you in that glamorous period feel. 
When we checked in this time , we noted it had had a level of refurbishment but, thankfully, it was still sympathetic with its period. So far so good. 
Our room was comfortable (great bed) with period furniture, smart TV and quirky bathroom. Impressively, the rooms to the rear of the hotel were surprisingly quiet at night - despite it being Spring Break. 
One disappointment though was the lack of hospitality. Previously, staff had always been welcoming, this time this was lacking. As a guest, your ‘resort fee’ covers a complimentary cocktail each day and beach loungers (not the umbrella though). You also get 20% off food and drinks. The same waiter served us three times and never applied the discount until reminded. The restaurant was always quiet as well (everywhere else full). Prices were high compared to some - and there’s lots of competition. 
Practically speaking, you have restaurants immediately to both sides of the hotel. There’s a CVS nearby and plenty of coffee shops etc. Parking is valet only, but was very convenient. Bear in mind, Ocean Drive is one way only now so you have to drive down from N to S. 
Overall, a good hotel in a great location. Perfect for getting the full SOBE experience. Just a shame the staff couldn’t crack a smile and be more welcoming.",One of the best in the Art Deco area but could do better.

Everything was spotless, and comfortable. The bathroom was amazing and the toiletries were upmarket and beautifully scented (I think we used everything!).

The Pelican is not cheap but we felt that it was great value for the experience.
We had such an amazing time that we returned for brunch on the day we were due to fly home. It did not disappoint and was a fantastic end to our holiday.

I'd love to particularly recommend Cristina, who performed my Standard massage. I've been doing this for 6 years and this year I went to the Standard. While the Hotel is a little different than most, I have to say that the Spa is the BEST I have ever visited. The variety of treatment options and services is impressive. I especially enjoyed the heated marbles and scrub rooms. The staff are completely attentive and helpful. They get A++ for good service.  The pool area has a hot tub with a waterfall that is very enjoyable. 

The Hotel itself has a very different vibe than most; it's not like a Marriott or Hilton. I think the target clients are well-oiled bikini-clad millennials who enjoy Yoga and such. Never saw so many string bikinis in my life!  As a 73-year old granny I was a little out of place. But everyone was very kind to me. The rooms are very small with no real work space. No coffee service in the room. Folks who needed to work on their PCs were sitting out in the garden. The restaurants and cafe serve up a host of healthy options, like vegan waffles and lemon grass smoothies -- no biscuits and gravy here. 

One other positive about this resort is it's pet-friendly. A host of goldendoodles and labradoodles wandered the pool area -- all very well behaved. Very friendly indeed!",Truly World Class Spa

I decided to book Nautilus as I have been there before and I had an excellent experience. This trip however, was the totally opposite experience.

First thing, I get to the hotel and the bellboy doesn't even open the door for me and my girlfriend. Not even an hello LOL. I found that extremely rude and a terrible first impression.

I booked my room through booking.com and booked the King Balcony Oceanfront room. When I get to the hotel, the front desk clerk tells me there was an error and that my Oceanfront balcony room was not available and they could not honor the room that I booked but instead they would put me in a equal value room called the Oceanfront King. This room has an ocean view but no balcony and it is a little bigger than the room that I booked. I did not want this room and I insisted that I get the room that I PAID FOR! If I wanted a window room, I would've just gotten the cheapest room. After about 15 minutes of him typing in some stuff, he goes to the back to speak to his ""manager"" and he came back to tell me that the room I booked will be available the next day. Almost as if I didn't complain they wouldn't have gave me the balcony room. Still pretty upset that they didn't tell me prior to my arrival and the room was booked 3 weeks in advance. I agreed to stay in the room they provided for one night.

The next morning around 10 am, I texted the front desk to see if my room was available and they told me that the room would be available at 3pm. They told me that they can move our belongings for us if we decided to go out but from the way things were being handled already, I didn't feel comfortable leaving my possessions in their hands. So we canceled our lunch plans and stayed at the hotel beach. Paid $160 for a beach bed, I don't understand why there is a charge for this but I guess this is how they make their money? At 3pm, I get notified that the room is ready. I go to the front desk and they give me the keys to my new room. The front desk clerk asks the bell boy to open the old room door for me because the keys to the old room no longer works. The bell boy comes up with me and leaves me to carry 5 bags by myself. It was really unbelievable!!!!

After all this, I decided to stay away from the hotel activities for the remainder of the trip. The day we check out, I asked to see an itemized list of the purchases I made, beach bed, lunch at the hotel restaurant, drinks at the pool and drinks on the beach. That was supposed to be everything as far as the charges go but then I noticed a bunch of charges from the minibar. I do admit that I removed some of the items in the mini fridge to make room for some of the things I purchased from CVS but everything I removed was carefully placed on the side of the minibar. They claim that there is a sensor on the items but it did not explain the cashews and M&M's that were charged not even near the refrigerator. After explaining to the front desk clerk that those were not my charges, he gave me a look as if he was saying"" are you sure"" type of look. He then goes to management again and they remove all the charges.

I don't like being embarrassed in front of other hotel patrons and this is exactly what happened to me twice! First, I have to plea my case that I should have a balcony room that I paid for when it should have never even gotten to that point. As I check out, I am pleading my case, making me feel like I am some sort of criminal. I would have happily paid for the things I used or consumed but this was not the case. If I am spending close to 600 a night for a room I think I should be able to afford a few overcharged M&Ms and Cashews. 

Overall, this hotel is not the same hotel I went to 6 years ago. The only good about this hotel was the nice smell in the lobby and the beach attendee Issac. Everything else was extremely subpar for the price you pay to stay here. I would recommend going somewhere else for this price.",2nd times not a charm

111888,HOTEL,Nautilus by Arlo,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/d3/bd/ca/nautilus-s-light-filled.jpg,[],9,$$$$,$253 - $464,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,3055035700,"1825 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-7414",hellonautilus@arlohotels.com,[],250,[],25.79441,-80.12915,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d111888-Reviews-Nautilus_by_Arlo-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.arlohotels.com/nautilus/?utm_source=local-listings&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=yext-nautilus,#9 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,5470,"STAFF: Helpful, warm, five-star service. Oscar, Lana, Arianna, Melody, Tea, Giuliano, and Jackie take pride in this retro boutique hotel and provided world-class service.

ROOM: We booked a King Ocean Front with a pullout sofa bed. It was fantastic… and HUGE. The bathroom was massive (especially for South Beach). The minibar was epically stocked and there was an espresso machine too! We watched the glorious sunset and sunrise from our huge window. It was so quiet I thought maybe no one was on either side of us, until I saw our neighbors the next morning heading to the rooftop terrace with coffee. The rooftop terrace was incredible! Oscar even made sure we knew how to access the terrace!

POOL: The pool was top-notch. The water was the perfect temperature, crystal clear, not crowded, tranquil, quality guests and very polished staff. I love that they have a delightful young man dedicated to escorting you to available padded loungers. I’m sure this would be especially helpful at times when it’s near capacity - no awkward weaving through the chairs and scooting them around to fit your group. 

CABANA: We were so fortunate to have a cabana our first day, as we wanted to heal our sunburns from our cruise. Svetlana took excellent care of us and anticipated our every need. The cabana had a large cushioned couch, cushioned ottoman, coffee table, SMEG mini fridge, standing retro cooler, fan, large TV, towels, storage, and a super rad orange safe. The piña coladas were boozy and not too sugary. Pro-tip: go with a double. Lunch review below…

BEACH: Direct, easy access. The private beach is steps from the hotel - just stroll through the bamboo tunnel, which runs parallel to the pool, exit the secure door (you need a room key to get in), a few steps across the bike/walking trail to a cute little sandy trail and you’ll see the navy and white striped Nautilus umbrellas and loungers. 

FOOD: The cappuccinos at the coffee bar in the lobby were perfect. The lunch from the Cabana Club was delish. We ordered the Cubano, Tuna Togarashi Salad, and Kids Hamburger. This was our 4th Cuban Sandwich on our vacation, and it was the best! 

LOCATION: I preferred the location of Nautilus (18th and Collins) on South Beach over the other hotel (9th Street and Collins) we stayed at before our cruise. It is quieter and more upscale. It’s a short walk or Uber to Española Way, the shops and restaurants on Lincoln Road, and the Port of Miami was only about 15 minutes. 

Final thoughts: Our 8 year old kid said this resort was her favorite part of our vacation - beating Atlantis and the cruise ship!!! We were married at Four Seasons The Biltmore Santa Barbara and the service level at Nautilus was beyond any Four Seasons we’ve stayed at. It was truly paradise and we’re already planning a return trip. My only regret is that we didn’t stay longer.",My extensive hotel research paid off…

The hotel was great to come up with a creative solution to still allow us to check in and walk up the stairs to our room.  They also extended the complimentary happy hour for all guests that day in the lobby during the duration of the outage.  Our room did not disappoint. After reading the reviews, I had planned to request a room facing Ocean Ave, but with the outage we were just happy to get any convenient room.  Our room patio door opened to the courtyard.  We loved the quaint European feel of the courtyard and the fact that it seemed to protect our room from noise.  We loved our complimentary beach cart and toted it to the beach the next day!! We loved the Tommy Bahama style chairs and umbrella.  We also loved having the towel bins in the hallways to toss our beach towels in.  We took advantage of the complimentary washer/dryer as well.  On day 1 we had a reservation at the Havana restaurant, but since the power was out we walked elsewhere for dinner. We loved the staff, the complimentary bicycles, and the location! There is an incredible French sandwich shop around the corner for lunch. The historic Betsy hotel at the end of the street is worth checking out to listen to music in the lobby or the courtyard on the back side.  Definitely take advantage of the rooftop happy hour! We also visited the Italian restaurant Vino y Pan around the block where they literally stand in there and make the pasta. Such an incredible experience, but you'll need a reservation. The room itself had a lot left to be desired.  When we entered the room, there was no view.  Our room was facing the building beside us.  It was also a little dark and dank.  The bedroom itself looked beautiful, but look are sometimes deceiving.  Each morning we woke up, we noticed bites on our bodies.  After the first night, I thought perhaps we had been bitten while we were out.  But, as the next few nights rolled by and I had new bites each morning, I figured it was something in the bed.  Just before checkout, I contacted the front desk regarding the bed situation. A manager came to our room and inspected the bed.  He stated he didn't see any bed bugs or signs of them.  He suggested we had possibly been bitten by a mosquito.  But, they were supposed to call a professional to come out and inspect the bed and call to give us an update.  Unfortunately, no one ever called.  It's been weeks and we have not had a update and we have not heard a single thing from Marriott regarding our experience.   

I wanted to like this hotel so much!  The location was excellent, as was it's proximity to the beach.  There was even a convenient little beach cart with chairs and an umbrella in our room to be used on the beach.  The live performers were so great.  Overall the staff was friendly and helpful.  But, they completely mishandled the bed situation.","Great Location, Okay Hotel"

Johanna - A very sweet , cheerful and kind young lady. She is the future of this hotel. She was simply amazing. Again, my wife and I were taken away by how great she was at the front desk. She knows every guest and remembers who you are and when you are leaving. Everytime we saw her, she ALWAYS had a smile on our face. We would literally look for her in the lobby because it would feel weird if we passed by and didn't say hi to her. She was so welcoming to us. Even when we were leaving she literally came all the way from her desk to the exit doors to thank us for staying and hope the trip was well. Its so hard to find someone so dedicated to their job these days. She is one of the rare individuals who just loves her job so much and has an amazing attitude. If you are going to book your stay at this hotel, call before hand and ask for her. She is their pre arrival specialist. Trust me on this and ask for her. I can see her one day being a GM for a hotel, she has that in her. Her hospitality was next level. 

Because of these 2 individuals, we will ONLY stay at this hotel the next time we visit South Beach Miami.

It is in the heart of South Beach and in the middle of everything. To top it off,  -- it's oceanfront! 

We took our family for a four-night getaway in December. Our room was lovely and we had views of the ocean. We slept in the king bed and our son slept on the pullout couch. We still had room for all of our gear. There was a lovely welcome basket full of treats awaiting us! The room is laid out well to maximize space and the bathroom is super cute! It was super hot outside, but the air conditioner worked perfectly in our room. Having use of free washers and dryers was an added perk that we did not expect, but were extremely grateful for! 

The STAFF was world-class! Our Bellman: met us at the parking deck (at (ZOcean Hotel) with a cart, pleasantly loaded our stuff, and led us to the hotel. In all we were traveling for three weeks, so we had A Lot of stuff (yes, we tipped generously). He was great! We saw him from time to time throughout our stay and he was always busy wiping down the elevator buttons, handrails, bikes, and everything else. Even though covid was still happening, we felt really safe there. The Front Desk Staff: was Delightful! From the time we arrived they called us by our name... wow! They kind of sang our name in a pleasant hellooo Ms. ---. It was rather interesting and felt lovely. They were eager to answer questions and help. There was always a smile on everyone's faces. 

The LOCATION: We loved being immediately on Ocean Drive because we could walk outside of the hotel and be able to see and do everything around us! Immediately outside the front door of the hotel is Havana 1957 restaurant. I would've liked to have eaten on their patio, but there was always a wait, so we ordered carryout and to the hotel's ROOFTOP Experience. We LOVED eating our family meals on the ROOF of the HOTEL! The view was GORGEOUS! In the mornings we had breakfast on the roof and in the evenings, we had dinner there. It's a perfect place to sit because we could see everything and were often serenaded by the music below. 

Things To Do: The hotel supplies each room with a cart and all the beach supplies you'll need for a good time! Walk outside of the front door and there’s the South Beach!
The hotel has bikes in the lobby and you can check them out for 2 hours at a time. We did this multiple times and rode along the beach, paths, or Ocean Drive. 
We often walked to Lincoln Mall 5-7 minutes, Venezuelan Bakery for breakfast (3-5 minutes), or to Washington Avenue to catch the Big Bus. 
We ate several meals on Espanola Way... LOVE IT THERE! The Mexican restaurant on the corner is our favorite!

The location is fantastic - you are right across the street from the beach, and close to everything in South Beach. The property comes with beach chairs & umbrella they will lend you for free so you can have a great setup right by the ocean.  The rooms are big, clean and fairly updated. I had a king suite with a sleep sofa and kitchenette, and it was perfect for three days.  Couple of cons: If you want a view, forget it. Most of these rooms face the inside courtyard. And my ""corner"" room came with a patio, but the view was of the AC unit for the building next door along with a dirty, noisy alleyway below. There's no pool. And it was loud - because of my room location at the side of the building, I could hear restaurant workers talking loudly in the alleyway next door late into the evening - and woke up early with the sound of trash trucks or construction next door.  Would I return again? Certainly. But I would request a room in the center of the facility and probably on a lower floor (the elevator was super-slow, and the only ice machine is on the first floor).  There is also no on-site parking or valet, although there is a garage close by. You feel a bit isolated on that part of Collins Ave.  2) The hotel advertises a happy hour on the website and within the hotel but...but there is no happy hour. Drinks are expensive ALL the time. It was suggested we go elsewhere if we are looking for a Happy Hour. 3) No complementary coffee. The rooms have a nexpresso which is considered coffee by the hotel, but not by me. We had to purchase coffee in the gift shop for $3 a cup every morning.  4) There is no shoreline to walk on. This is a favorite activity for us and were disappointed to see this was not an option.  For us it was a once in a lifetime trip, I wish I could say it was everything we had hoped for but it misses that mark.",Before booking I wish I knew the following....

219199,HOTEL,The Palms Hotel & Spa,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/25/0e/18/5d/pool-beach-view-at-the.jpg,[],50,$$$$,$325 - $511,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17864203219,"3025 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4106",sales@thepalmshotel.com,[],251,[],25.806063,-80.124115,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d219199-Reviews-The_Palms_Hotel_Spa-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.thepalmshotel.com/,#50 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,5034,"My family and I, including our grandkids aged 4, 8, and 10, had a wonderful stay at the Palms. It is expensive and worth it. I had some concerns ahead of time, all of which proved groundless. 

First, I was worried because we came during Spring Break and there were shootings and a curfew in South Beach. However, all was tranquil Mid Beach, where The Palms is located.

Second, I couldn’t tell the size of the pool from the website photographs. It turned out to be nice and large. Because of the garden setting you feel miles away from anywhere.

Third, from its website the hotel looked fairly sophisticated and adult, what with its Aveda spa and yoga classes. However, there were plenty of children there. My grandkids made instant friends in the pool and, as I said, had a blast. Their ebullience was not frowned upon. Also, children’s food options were ample, from the breakfast buffet (ultra pricey for adults, not bad for kids), the poolside gelato stand, pizza at the Tiki Bar, and many options at the Essencia restaurant, including the just-baked dinner rolls, really superb chicken wings, hotdogs, and fries, and off-the-charts brownies.

Finally, please know that the beach is “just right,” with soft sand and fun-but-not-scary waves. The water was a great temperature for swimming when we were there (late March). My only quibble was some larger-than-pebbles rocks underfoot as you enter the water, but these weren’t big or plentiful enough to require water shoes.

The rooms were large and comfortable.

As an added bonus there were a few iguanas by the pool, and a falconer brought a falcon to breakfast one morning (on a leash) to scare away the other birds. Excitement!
",Perfect beach-and-pool vacation with young kids

5888192,HOTEL,KAYAK Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-m/1280/1d/1e/f4/79/kayak-miami-beach.jpg,[],48,$$$,$199 - $333,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 844-419-0192,"2216 Park Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-1722",stay@KAYAKmb.com,[],50,[],25.79864,-80.13036,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d5888192-Reviews-KAYAK_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://KAYAKmb.com,#48 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,158,"The Kayak Hotel on Miami Beach is the kind of hotel you love to tell your friends you stayed at, but in reality, you hated every minute of it. On its face, it's a ‘tres hip’ South Beach boutique, with a hip bar and trendy restaurant, but the reality is that its too cool for its own good. .Here’s my testimony:

I walked in  and really felt I found a gem…the lobby decor is tropical and it smells great, the bar looked inviting, and I noticed an on-site restaurant…but that feeling did not last long. I knew we were headed downhill when a very nice man, located near what appeared to be a front desk, told me that check in was “self service.” HUH? Yep, he showed me the sleek little tablet where I would have to check myself in. Within a few seconds, there was a problem…the piece of technology  that was checking me in  wanted payment, even though I had prepaid on Priceline. Oops. Human required. I was told to return in 10 or 15 minutes while my situation was ‘sorted out.” OK, so, no problem, I will just sidle up to the chic bar and have myself a Tito’s and pineapple. OOPS!!! “The bar and restaurant are closed Monday and Tuesday,” the nice man told me, and that was that. What kind of hotel has a lobby bar and restaurant this is closed two days out of the week?? So I had to talk a walk outside  and find my Tito’s elsewhere. 

I returned and in fact it was confirmed I had paid in full. Which means I could  “DIY” it  and check in with the tablet and get my room key. Which I did. The room…..it's not only that it was tiny…it was that there was no place to put anything. No drawers, no shelves, no storage. So my wife and I had to put our bags and backpacks on the 12 inch gulley  between our bed and the wall. Then, as  I was unpacking, I heard a high pitched tea kettle-like sound. LIke a dog whistle. It was quite irritating, and for the life of me I could not identify the source.  I went back to  the front desk to see the nice man, whose name is Jack, who told me to  follow him upstairs to the room. He immediately identified the source-- “oh, it's the toilet. That happens when you flush.” He then told me how to lift the septic tank and jigger the internal  levers until it stopped…which I had to do every time I flushed for the remainder of my stay.

The Wifi signal…one word…WEAK. Most calls wither dropped or were interfered with. The TV….again, way too hip, way too dysfunctional. They leave you with two remotes, one standard and one teeny tiny ultra cool sleek looking thingee you move with your fingers…but since  there are no words on it, just icons that were meaningless, I was on my own to figure out.

Cleanliness….well., if you don’t look under the bed or in the corners, you would be much happier. Ignorance is bliss.  I lost my phone under the bed and to my great fortune came  in contact with  cakes of dust begging to be vacuumed. Ew.

Ah, last but not least, the “Courtyard View.” This is an insult to the intelligence. What they don’t tell you is that the “Courtyard” is the  ""tres hip"" and very dark LOBBY!  No lush green sunlit garden. Nope. The dark lobby. Ergo, in the  room it's night time, all the time. 

The saddest thing of all to me is that the Kayak Hotel is sliding on the slippery slope of a terrible trend. It’s a  deflating, and depressing reality in our world: Human kindness, personal interaction, the feeling that you are literally someone’s “guest” is disappearing--not just from  the hotel industry but the service industry in toto.","Hip and Woke, The Joke was on me."

5888192,HOTEL,KAYAK Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-m/1280/1d/1e/f4/79/kayak-miami-beach.jpg,[],48,$$$,$199 - $333,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 844-419-0192,"2216 Park Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-1722",stay@KAYAKmb.com,[],50,[],25.79864,-80.13036,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d5888192-Reviews-KAYAK_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://KAYAKmb.com,#48 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,158,"I stayed here in November 2021. I had a fairly decent stay, but it was NOT as close to certain activities as some of the reviewers made it seem. It IS near a Walgreens within walking distance, which is perfect for travelers who tend to forget small necessities when packing.  However, take 'walking distance' with a grain of salt, dependent on what you're there for. I found myself Ubering more often than I expected but quickly rectified that by adjusting plans to combine  with how long I'd be away for the day. 

That aside, the hotel itself is cozy, safe and comfortable. I stayed on the 1st floor and although some reviewers complained of noise, I had NO such issue. If you stay on the 1st floor, they closed the door of the hallway that leads from the lobby to your room. That helped eliminate a lot of 'lobby' conversations & interactions. 

I found the restaurant/café to be a unique edition to this boutique-style hotel. I must say, I did NOT eat here so I cannot state much regarding the menu & food. I will say, though... I did enjoy a morning cup of coffee there and was able to linger out on the restaurant's back patio, which provided a relaxing vibe and flowy breeze while enjoying my coffee. That was nice and had a very decent ambiance.

Rooms were clean. Beds were a nice size. Although there was only 1 roll of tissue in the room upon my arrival, staff was pretty good about bringing another roll when asked. They provide you with a general number to text during your stay, rather than calling to the front desk.  I actually preferred that. I've always hated calling front desk for any reason. I wish EVERY hotel incorporated a text system for requests, I'd be happier with that method. 

Overall, I enjoyed my time there. Whether I stay again is solely dependent upon distance and my reason for being in Miami. If I am primarily relaxing, yes I'd stay. If I am there attending various things where I'd be back & forth leaving out frequently, I'd likely opt for a different location.",Decent Stay

5888192,HOTEL,KAYAK Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-m/1280/1d/1e/f4/79/kayak-miami-beach.jpg,[],48,$$$,$199 - $333,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 844-419-0192,"2216 Park Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-1722",stay@KAYAKmb.com,[],50,[],25.79864,-80.13036,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d5888192-Reviews-KAYAK_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://KAYAKmb.com,#48 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,158,"My husband and I have been in search of a new hotel to stay at while in Miami. Father's Day weekend was coming up and I figured I would book a quick trip for us to go and try a new hotel. Literally from the moment I walked in the lobby to checked in I fell in love! The ambience is to die for! The scent too! I am not too sure what they use but it smells so good. When you check-in there is no one at the front desk because it is a self- check-in (which i love!). The first night we stayed in the Cozy King Room. The room is really cute, only problem it was too small for my husband, our 5 year old and myself. Immediately I asked the gentleman working the front that night and he was nice enough to help me find something bigger. Unfortunately that night they were booked so he could not show me any but did put a note on my account for the person in the morning. In the morning I ran into the the girl that was working the front and she helped me right in the Hall way- they carry iPad's and they have cell phones. She quickly looked and found a Contemporary Suite that would be available after the check out and cleaning. We got to our Suite and oh my! That was room was amazing! Spacious enough for the 3 of us. The least best thing about this Hotel is the reservation part, if you want to extend your stay you will have to create a whole new reservation instead of adding to the existing one. I had that issue and since I had to do that I did not get housekeeping services done because I put the request on the old reservation. If you are wondering about parking, there is a parking garage right across the street. I parked on the side that would put me on the same side of the hotel and the elevator takes right in front of the hotel. Parking is $15 for 8- 24 hrs ( I know for sure 24 hours but there is a time range for the prices). The beach is right up the street. Ocean Drive is probably less than a mile away (about 10-15 min drive depending on traffic) Lincoln Mall is about a mile away. All in all this is a great Hotel. I will be staying here for all my trips to Miami!",BEST HOTEL IN MIAMI!!!

5888192,HOTEL,KAYAK Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-m/1280/1d/1e/f4/79/kayak-miami-beach.jpg,[],48,$$$,$199 - $333,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 844-419-0192,"2216 Park Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-1722",stay@KAYAKmb.com,[],50,[],25.79864,-80.13036,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d5888192-Reviews-KAYAK_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://KAYAKmb.com,#48 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,158,"My best friend and I shared the cozy king. That bed is so big we never knew the other was in it! The sheets and pillows were the stuff of dreams. The room is in a corner overlooking the outside dining patio. The plantation shutters open and the windows open so we were able to get fresh air! The bathroom door did get stuck if you closed it all the way and our TV didn't work except for half a day the whole week we were there but those issues were overshadowed by the WONDERFUL staff, from the Hotel Manager down the line, EVERYONE was super friendly and always helpful. Albert (the Manager), Patrick (hotel staff) and Sania (Layla restaurant) are particular standouts. 

We could hear music from the patio and in the evenings when it was busiest there was some noise from patrons but we loved the music and the chatter wasn't too obtrusive. We didn't have any issues with the elevator being too busy or slow. The rooftop patio is very zen. There are lots of plants but also good views of the surrounding area. The swimming pool is very small but the whole time we were there it was never busy so there were no issues there.

Layla restaurant has great food for all meals. It is somewhat pricey (but so is everything else in MB) but they use the freshest ingredients. My bff loves coffee and she said the dripkit was some of the best she's ever had. I loved the baklava! On weekends, guests are able to order room service since the bar and restaurant are very popular. We got a ton of food for supper and all we got were sides and the baklava.

There is very little parking in front of the hotel but there is a parking garage (and the Miami Ballet!) directly across the street. It's only a five-10 minute walk to the closest beach (we always walked right by Mr. Chow's). The hotel is a great starting point for pretty much anywhere you want to go.",All-around wonderful stay

225171,HOTEL,Venezia Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-m/1280/25/73/7f/c9/caption.jpg,[],159,$$,$132 - $219,hotel,4.0,3.5,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 786-655-9669,"3865 Indian Creek Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33140-3796",hello@veneziahotelmiami.com,[],50,[],25.811575,-80.124214,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d225171-Reviews-Venezia_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.veneziahotelmiami.com/,#159 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,26,"Das Venezia Hotel liegt wenige Minuten vom Strand entfernt. Leider bietet das Hotel keine Parkmöglichkeiten an, sodass man entweder für 30-50$ direkt am Hotel parken kann oder wenige Laufminuten entfernt bei Dunkin Donuts in einem Parkhaus (pro Tag max. 8$) parken kann. Das Hotel hat eine moderne, schöne Eingangslobby. Auch die Zimmer sind sauber und modern eingerichtet. Einige Möbel weisen jedoch deutliche Gebrauchsspuren auf. Alle zwei Tage erfolgt ein Raumservice. Die Zimmer sind alle sehr hellhörig. Laufen der Gäste aus oberen Etagen wird deutlich wahrgenommen. Auch lautes reden/Baby Geschrei aus anderen Zimmern (ggf. Ohrenstöpsel mitnehmen).
Das Frühstück wird an einer Art „Bar“ ausgegeben. Man sagt was man möchte und dies wird zubereitet. Das Angebot ist sehr eintönig und nach 3 Nächten wirklich langweilig. Zudem spricht das Personal schlechtes Englisch und fragt häufig nach. 
An der Rezeption kann man sich kostenfrei Handtücher, Schirme und Stühle für den Strand ausleihen. Auf dem Dach bietet eine Terrasse angenehme Sitzmöglichkeiten und besonders Abends einen schönen Blick auf die Skyline Miamis.",Angenehmer Aufenthalt

18032263,HOTEL,AxelBeach Miami,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/23/5f/3c/02/axelbeach-miami.jpg,[],41,$$,$137 - $227,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 786-628-6362,"1500 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-3111",miami@axelhotels.com,[],160,[],25.787577,-80.1308,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d18032263-Reviews-AxelBeach_Miami-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.axelhotels.com/int/axelbeach-miami/hotel.html,#41 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,362,"We enjoyed a three-night stay at this ""hetero-friendly"" hotel, and you can't beat the location of this property.  The prices are worth the one-block walk to Ocean Drive, so you can easily walk to restaurants, the beach, and nearby public parking.  The onsite restaurant had a great breakfast (not included in the room rate) and cocktails were available.  Nice pool area and hot tub, but disappointing that you could not turn on the hot tub jets (the handle on the timer was missing) and that whole area closed down at 8 p.m. so you could not enjoy a late night soak or swim in the heart of an area that is up most of the night.  Speaking of which, if you have a room facing the street (like we did) be prepared for lots of street noise and roaring sportscars into the wee hours of the morning.  The simple solution is earplugs since this is party central in South Beach!  

Much of this is an older property that appears to be recently acquired by Axel Hotels.  They really should make some investments in the property with simple things like luggage racks in the room, televisions that will connect to your own devices (like they say they do, but they don't), some shelves in the bathroom for personal toiletries, curtains that close smoothly, cleaning the windows, etc.  The old rooms have wonderful charm, but the walls are thin and the lighting is all very dated and/or plain.  Rather than an overpriced honor bar, it would have been nice to have had a refrigerator and microwave.  There was a spa advertised but all that I could find was a door that said ""out of order.""  Also, there was a gate at the ""rear"" of the property that opened onto the next street (full of great restaurants, etc.) but you could not use your room key to enter from that location.  Time to get that gate fixed!

And one last thing that I thought was odd.  There is a small drop-off area for guests to leave their cars when they check-in, but some of the staff is allowed to park there.  There were as many as three cars parked there at one time, which did not leave much room for the guests.  There is a large public parking garage (for a fee) just a block away, and I think they should pay for their staff to park there.  That would go a long way to making the property look more professional.  ",Superb location but could use some attention.

I have to first start off by saying that this boutique hotel and its staff were impeccable and extremely clean. The products lingered throughout the hallways and that was definitely a plus. Smelled and felt cleaned.
Shoutout to HENRY, MICHAL, and NELSON from the ( FRONT DESK ). Henry was the lead of this pack that drew me in. I communicated continuously prior to the trip, I'm sure I ran Henry nuts by calling often about my reservation but he catered to my every request with no problem. Michal was my morning front desk person who extended kindness upon giving me a breakfast voucher every morning, he was extremely sweet and attentive. Finally, Nelson who wrapped up our experience was so generous, holding our luggage while we lingered around waiting for a late night flight and used the time to get some last minute sight seeing on the strip!
Let me brag about the food here. Even if you do not stay with Majestic Hotel, you must give Ocean 7 a try It is very rare that I go to a restaurant and I do not have some problem with my order or food. THE FOOD HERE WAS AMAZING. I'M TALKING ABOUT FINGER LICKING GOOD , SEASONED RIGHT, THROUGH EVERY SINGLE BITE. JEFRREY & JEROME our amazing servers of ( OCEAN 7 ), little restaurant that sits on the property (partnered with hotel). We specifically requested to eat in Jerome's area each morning for breakfast. The simple breakfast was definitely made with love and we were shown MAD love.
And, at night we vibed with Jeffrey. He was our entertainment and the guide we needed. He kept us on point about everything as the other gentlemen did, and he directed us to experiences that he thought we would enjoy.
To be honest I did not know what to expect from a boutique hotel. I usually stray away from anything rated under 7/ 10, but I'm also realistic that everyone's expectations are what can drive ratings down. These 5 guys 🤣, no pun intended, really made us feel warmed and welcomed. I'm heavy on customer service and it made our stay worth it. I will definitely be back to stay with this property, hands down!!
Thank you Henry, Michal, Nelson, Jerome, and Jeffrey it is because of you guys that this trip was everything. Until we see you next time 🤗
Take care.
10 🌟",Customer service at it finest!

Every guest on the 1st floor called and they refused to stop because the kitchen was closed and that's the only time they could do it. According to the construction worker this was approved by Pedro and someone else to do at this time.

Not sure how this place has a review this high. Check-in is a small window inside a loud & busy restaurant so hearing is difficult. $61 for ""early check in"" for 2hrs early. $20+ a day, daily resort fee. $150 deposit per room which ""can take 7-10 days to release"". Paperwork states they cannot guarantee noise free rooms… 

We were on the first floor, can clearly hear the restaurant at all times. Fire alarm battery low beep in the hallway. Windows are frosted white so you can't see out, can hear noise from outside as well. The coffee cups are dirty, the coffee maker has dust on it. The closet has damage to the walls and is dusty. The robes have hair hanging off them. 

Rooms are ""renovated"" looking, like a flipped house. New floors and tiling from what it seems, new looking furniture. None of it is good quality, tile work is bad, furniture and beds don't feel nice. Dusty rooms, hard beds, all the vents and ACs are full of dust. Walls and door frames appear to have been painted a dozen times. The toilet runs constantly, the toilet seat is loose. Honestly we had 3 rooms for 3 nights, we abandoned after the first night and ate the no cancellation cost. 

Front desk does not know if they will refund the resort fee which is based on being here, said I have to contact the agency it's booked through even though it has literally nothing to do with the agency since it was paid after arriving, outside of standard fees. 

I've received multiple text from their automated service which I did not agree to. 

This place is appalling. The only redeeming feature is the location, which doesn't have parking you have to stay in the garage a block away. No validation or otherwise. 
",Avoid at all cost

The Majestic South Beach was perfectly located within a few steps to a breathtaking beach front. The resort staff were amazing and friendly. 1011427,HOTEL,Majestic Hotel South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/16/8e/f2/51/majestic-hotel-south.jpg,[],156,$$,$134 - $244,hotel,3.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13054553270,"660 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6219",info@majesticsouthbeach.com,[],49,[],25.776659,-80.13166,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1011427-Reviews-Majestic_Hotel_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.majesticsouthbeach.com,#156 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,169,"Pleasantly surprised with this neat boutique, yet historical hotel.  Booked at last minute and cost was less than $200 which included free breakfast.
The Majestic sits at the hub intersection of Ocean Drive and easily walkable right across the street to the beach with numerous beach activities.  
The hotel is inclusive of an independent restaurant ""Ocean Seven Cafe"" which is is part outdoor cafe and inside dining that fills up most of the ""lobby"" so that the check in area is about 5 square feet.
Upon arriving at the hotel, I currently have mobility issues that require a can and stairs are a challenge.  I took the accessible ramp which begins a few steps into the ally between buildings.  I had to navigate over hoses, electrical cords and around a small work desk where an employee was was working at a laptop.  The dining tables and chairs on the porch were close together and I apologized as I wiggled through.  I can't imagine someone trying to navigate in a wheelchair.   
Check in was friendly and accommodating.
The elevator Is ""hidden"" behind one of the original heavy engraved art deco doors.  I thought it was very clever how the history was kept while updating with the elevator.  You do have to PULL the art deco door open by the knob which is very heavy to enter the elevator.
The rooms and hallways were small compared to more modern hotels but that's just the nature of older hotels.  The facility was clean readily marked to navigate within the hotel.
Room was a basic accessible room.  Bed was comfortable.  Although the shades opened...the windows were painted white so you couldn't see out.  Not sure about why that is.  
The room was well worth the money however at this time I will note that the accessible bathroom had NO GRAB BARS.  Not by the toilet nor in the shower.  I highly recommend that this be considered as a safety precaution for guests with mobility needs.
The Oceans Seven Cafe was extremely convenient, priced right and very tasty for food and drinks.  A fantastic spot on the patio or porch to people watch and dine. It appeared to be no lack of wait staff and they were all timely and attentive to me and others around me.
I would stay here again.  
I will add that even during my leaving and using the cane and pulling my bag, the Ocean Sevens wait staff were very quick to reach out to assist me as I made my way to the sidewalk for transportation.   There is a valet service and pull in area for UBER/LYFT making your quick and easy to access.",Perfect location; Accessibility needs improvement.

2316201,HOTEL,The Shepley Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/0f/39/ba/be/the-shepley-hotel.jpg,[],42,$$$,$193 - $319,hotel,4.5,2.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 786-260-6124,"1340 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4209",info@theshepleyhotel.com,[],29,[],25.784899,-80.131,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d2316201-Reviews-The_Shepley_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.theshepleyhotel.com,#42 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,980,"We stayed here for three days and two nights after a cruise. I chose the hotel because the photos online reminded me of an hotel that the fictitious Hercule Poirot would chose. The hotel decor and service did not disappoint. Photos on the website were very close to reality. Many of the Art Deco characteristics like the fabulous floors and metal stair rails are original. The designer who chose the hotel’s more recent furniture, lighting, and decor had exquisite taste and they have mostly been kept in excellent condition.  We spent time in the foyer on the comfortable couches with plenty of small coffee tables to have a coffee or a snack.  The hardcover design books in the foyer bookshelf were a great diversion from the iPad while waiting to check in or awaiting an Uber. The air conditioning keeps the foyer and hallways very cool and comfortable.

We liked our room and the overall cleanliness, distance from the street and decor. The floors are wood so main floor rooms hear some clumping above, but luckily for us, it was not excessive. The bathroom fixtures like the towel rack, faucets, shower heads in our bathroom were rusty but these could have been overlooked if the shower had actually worked the first night.  We brought it to the attention of the hotel the next morning and they fixed the rain shower head so that we could use it on our second day. The take away is check your shower, safe, phone (which also didn’t work the first day) right after check-in. 

The buffet breakfast is very European with tasty croissants, two types of coffee, orange juice, cereal, cheese, ham and fruit. The website is accurate except for the cake shown in the photo. Who eats cake for breakfast anyway?

The hotel is non-smoking but the front terrace with comfy chairs and table seating is not. Both sides of the terrace have ash trays,  and because of the popularity of this hotel with Europeans, you can expect to be exposed to smoke wafting in your face at breakfast or anytime during the day.  I suggested to the night Manager that the hotel should designate one side as non-smoking, as we feel a “non-smoking hotel”  should have some outside space for non-smokers.

The location of the hotel is right in the “centre of the action” but it’s  not on the noisiest street, which is definitely Ocean.  Expect loud music from cars, scantily clad passers by, and possibly some drama from the hotel balconies across the street. 

On our second night there was even an altercation when a guest allowed two people from off the street to come up for a cigarette and eat a sandwich on the hotel’s  table and chairs.  Another person tried to come up as well, and the first fellow took exception, so there was an altercation with yelling and finally the “crazy person” left.  Before the third person tried to come up on the terrace, I told the night Manager and he said that it was “of no consequence to him”. Even when there was the altercation happening, he did not come out. Management has posted a private property sign beside the front door but I think there should also be a sign closer to the street that prohibits the general public to approach guests.  The guest was clearly uncomfortable when the stranger asked her for a cigarette and then sat right beside her on the couch to smoke it. She admitted to me later that the whole incident was very scary. I feel the night Manager should have come out and politely asked the non-guests to leave as the area is not big enough to allow non guests, and it would have been a relief to the guest who was in the middle of the whole incident. 

We  likely will not stay here again unless the smoking policy changes, but it was definitely interesting watching the Miami street life, walking to the beach, walking to restaurants, and feeling the ambiance of an original Art Deco boutique hotel. 

The hotel has made good choices in hiring Gabriela at the front desk. She is fully bilingual, intelligent, efficient and polite. Their hard-working, well-groomed and polite young men constantly cleaning the foyer, opening doors, carrying luggage up the stairs and generally being helpful are also an asset to the hotel and made our stay very enjoyable.",Charming Boutique Hotel Amid Chaos

2316201,HOTEL,The Shepley Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/0f/39/ba/be/the-shepley-hotel.jpg,[],42,$$$,$193 - $319,hotel,4.5,2.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 786-260-6124,"1340 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4209",info@theshepleyhotel.com,[],29,[],25.784899,-80.131,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d2316201-Reviews-The_Shepley_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.theshepleyhotel.com,#42 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,980,"There was a time before March 2020 when I would have given The Shepley Hotel a top review on almost every account. The property is nice and refurbished, the hotel room is beautiful to the eye, the bed is comfortable, the bathroom has products with an exclusive feel, the staff are nice and friendly and will help you carry luggage and open the front door every time you pass.

But that was then. 

On our first international travel in two years, in a time where the Omicron version of Covid-19 is raging through Florida and USA, safety is the main concern. We were therefore shocked at the next to non-existent safety attitude among the staff of The Shepley Hotel. 

First of all, the hotel was severely overstaffed, meaning that it was hard to pass through the common areas and maintain social distance to the employees. Secondly, at least half of the employees either weren't wearing a mask at all or carried it on the cheek or neck. Since social distancing wasn't practiced at all by the employees, it meant that we were forced to pass an unmasked employee with only a few inches distance every time we entered or exited the hotel. The staff also seemed surprised that we declined to have someone come up close and try to carry our bags (Hello! Six feet social distancing!)!

The automated disinfection gel at the hotel entrance remained empty throughout the three days we were at the hotel - a symbol of the carelessness.

Funny enough, the room price included breakfast, but this had been cancelled due to Covid safety measures. Could it be more of a joke?! Coffee and tea was offered where the breakfast normally would have been served, but when trying to get a cup of coffee, we often needed to share the cramped space with an unmasked employee fibbling with his smartphone instead of leaving space for us.

I am sure that - once we are through the pandemic - The Shepley Hotel will once again be a great option in the nowdays desolate South Beach Miami. But based on the current situation, I strongly advise any traveller interested in not spreading Covid to stay away from The Shepley Hotel.",Frightening covid unawareness at otherwise great hotel

2316201,HOTEL,The Shepley Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/0f/39/ba/be/the-shepley-hotel.jpg,[],42,$$$,$193 - $319,hotel,4.5,2.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 786-260-6124,"1340 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4209",info@theshepleyhotel.com,[],29,[],25.784899,-80.131,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d2316201-Reviews-The_Shepley_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.theshepleyhotel.com,#42 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,980,"We came to Miami in the middle of the spring break season and things were pretty wild in the Art Deco district but all the craziness and noise were left behind the minute you stepped into the lobby of The Shepley. It’s like crossing over into a different era. Cool, quiet, soft sofas, pleasant music playing in the background. I now understand the raving reviews about the staff - I had a feeling they loved us just for staying there! Always friendly and attentive, ready to chat about anything and nothing, prompt to give helpful suggestions. Clean rooms with minimalistic decor of the past century, spacious shower, very comfortable beds. I always have a hard time sleeping on vacations and I’m super noise-sensitive but I slept so well at Shepley to the soothing humming of AC. I don’t know if we were lucky but I never heard any noise coming from other rooms or the street (out window faced the back yard). Loved the convenience of having beach towels and chairs, and they have a pretty good espresso downstairs. Lack of storage space in the room is my only minor complaint but toward the end I realized there were some drawers I could have used that I simply failed to notice. All in all, we had a great stay, and for someone who is very picky when it comes to hotels, this one lived up to my standards and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. 2316201,HOTEL,The Shepley Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/0f/39/ba/be/the-shepley-hotel.jpg,[],42,$$$,$193 - $319,hotel,4.5,2.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 786-260-6124,"1340 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4209",info@theshepleyhotel.com,[],29,[],25.784899,-80.131,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d2316201-Reviews-The_Shepley_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.theshepleyhotel.com,#42 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,980,"I stayed with my daughter for 3 nights here during the spring break mayhem.  I was on the bottom floor.  I read all the bad reviews before posting.
Here was my experience:

Cleanliness:

Cleaning staff was exceptional.  I usually never tip, but did this time.

Staff:

The staff was unbelievably nice and accommodating...and don't forget this is during spring break!  Coming into this hotel after being outside was an oasis of serenity.  I was usually greeted by two staff members at night and three during the day.  

I once had a problem with my uber app, so they call a taxi for me AND make sure the driver arrives on time by calling again to confirm his current location during our wait.  They then come outside to update us on the taxi status.

Staff was always friendly and easy to talk to.

I have been to the Oriental hotel in Bangkok, i have stayed at the Shangri-la in Singapore, i have traveled all over this world and i can tell you that the staff was more helpful and friendly than any hotel staff i have encountered.

The beds were very comfortable, the boutique old sea style luggage furniture was charming.

Reality check:

This is a 1938 historic hotel.  You will hear foot steps above you.  Get a suite on the second floor to avoid that if it bothers you.

If you need more space, get a suite. My room was small but adequate for the price.
This is a bare bones hotel with no bar or cafe.

Final comments:

Location is divine.  I took the (now free) bus 150 from the airport.  It drops you off 80 meters from the hotel.

You are a block away from the beach, and from Washington ave.  This location is perfect. There is a walgreens very close.

Nice boutique historic hotel.",Affordable luxury

3819950,HOTEL,Posh South Beach Hostel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/0a/28/94/9a/lobby--v9474004.jpg,[],1,$,$43 - $104,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-398-7000,"820 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-5808",bookings@southbeachgroup.com,[],58,[],25.778608,-80.13247,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d3819950-Reviews-Posh_South_Beach_Hostel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.poshsouthbeach.com,#1 of 206 Specialty lodging in Miami Beach,206,868,"My friend and I got tired of paying inflated prices for Airbnbs where we couldn't make friends with anyone, and decided to fall back to the tried and true strategy of staying in a hostel. We took a chance on Posh, even though it was slightly more expensive than others.

The first impression was good; unlike other hostels I've stayed at both in Miami Beach and elsewhere, Posh has professional, paid staff instead of random ""volunteers"" who only get compensated with room and board. It appears that Posh is affiliated with nearby hotels like Whitelaw and shares staff with them.

Special shoutout to Angel who checked us in and took care of us during our 3 week stay. We came in late at night and usually, overnight staff are tired and grumpy, but Angel was upbeat and friendly and put us in a good spot when we said we wanted to avoid foot traffic and noise.

I liked that you get a free towel upon check-in and can trade it in every day to get a fresh one. Also, they have on-site laundry (bring your own quarters and detergent).

My favorite part of Posh is how good it is for meeting new people, which is the most important part of any hostel. They have a big kitchen / living room with a large TV, sofa, and lots of stools. There's also a pool (unheated, unfortunately) open until around 7 PM with a sundeck and lots of lounge chairs, and a downstairs patio area as well. While there's no free breakfast/dinner, they do have a free daily happy hour at a nearby affiliated hotel; as much gin/vodka + juice as you can drink (make sure to leave a tip though!)

Like any hostel, things can get rowdy especially around holidays, but Posh has on-site security to keep things safe and to remove the occasional guest who creates a bad experience for everyone else. Another shoutout for Angel's professionalism in this regard; while working on my laptop upstairs, I see him graciously open doors for guests who've forgotten their keys, walk up and down the halls to make sure everything's in order, and I've even seen him pitch in to do some cleanup (probably not his job) to make the place look presentable. He is definitely treating his job at a hostel as if he is a manager at the Four Seasons, and whatever you folks are paying him, it isn't enough.

A little constructive feedback for Posh is to repair the fridge/freezer and the laundry coin machine. Also, improve the plumbing of the toilets (they clog easily), and get a bigger water heater. Overall, had a great experience and I'll be back!",Best Overall Hostel in Miami Beach!
