3819950,HOTEL,Posh South Beach Hostel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/0a/28/94/9a/lobby--v9474004.jpg,[],1,$,$43 - $104,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-398-7000,"820 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-5808",bookings@southbeachgroup.com,[],58,[],25.778608,-80.13247,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d3819950-Reviews-Posh_South_Beach_Hostel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.poshsouthbeach.com,#1 of 206 Specialty lodging in Miami Beach,206,868,"The Posh South Beach Hostel was a fabulous place to stay. Located on Collins Ave, conveniently steps away from Ocean Drive, Miami Beach and the main hub of oceanside Miami nightlife, Posh provides THE Miami experience. There's something about being able to walk around the whole city with minimal Lyft/Uber rides that fully engulfs you in the spirit of Miami. The heat, surroundings and energy provided me with immense motivation, positivity and a new spice for life!

The hostel itself was truly amazing. The staff members were kind, caring and helped with anything one might need. Immediately as I walked up to the hostel, I was greeted and escorted in. Excellent service. Check-in was smooth and I was given a tour and explanation of the rules and property. There are three rooms filled with two tier bunk beds. The bunk beds are large and comfortable. Larger than a twin bed. Plenty of room to stretch out and relax. Linens provided. 

The aesthetic of the hostel is beautiful. Clean cut, modern, simplistic design in nature with neutral tones creates a clean slate to launch off from while on vacation. The atmosphere of no doors allows for great friendships to be made. It is a trusting vibe where everyone is welcomed. You are provided with a large locked drawer that can hold everything you would like to keep extra safe. The design of the bathrooms, floors, showers, kitchen space, living area... everything! is beautiful. Oh... and get this! There's an infinity pool and grassy lounge area up top on the roof. I had to take a full day to enjoy this pool area. I couldn't believe the amazing amenities that were provided given the price of the stay. Posh South Beach Hostel, please never change. There's no doubt in my mind I will be back for more! <3",THE Miami Experience.

3819950,HOTEL,Posh South Beach Hostel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/0a/28/94/9a/lobby--v9474004.jpg,[],1,$,$43 - $104,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-398-7000,"820 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-5808",bookings@southbeachgroup.com,[],58,[],25.778608,-80.13247,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d3819950-Reviews-Posh_South_Beach_Hostel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.poshsouthbeach.com,#1 of 206 Specialty lodging in Miami Beach,206,868,"   I will start with Lee,the manager of the hotel,who goes above and beyond accommodating needs and assisting customers. He provides truly a five star service. Thank You. Also the front desk is pretty friendly,I was lucky checking in with Sabetay along with Mr.Lee,who also provided very friendly and professional assistance during the whole stay. I really appreciate both. The young guy,bartender is another highlight of the stay,also very pleasant personality... 
   Location is just perfect,so easy to just go around in the morning or any other time of the day for breakfast,lunch,dinner or grocery shopping. Walk around the block to Washington Avenue if you looking for local prices(I only figured that out during the last couple of days...lol) That way you paying $2 for Cuban coffee instead of $5 on ocean drive...
   The hostel has multiple bunk beds at the same rooms,which is unusual at the beginning,but during the stay,most likely you are going to meet quite few people and make few friends along the way,due to that particular layout.
   The staff cleans the premises on daily bases,but unfortunately some people don’t have common sense and are piggy enough not clean after themselves,which creates a bit of a mess from time to time. So when you are a guest of the hostel,clean after yourself,you are at shared space,not at home!
   The only downside of the place was an air conditioner set up at 72 degrees,and working non stop keeping premises very cold,and absence of cutlery in the kitchen. No forks,spoons,bowls,cups,and only one knife for that matter....
   That’s about it... 
   PS: In the lobby of the hotel they have happy hours for the drinks based on tips only(and let me give you a good advice on that..,the better you tip the bartender,the better during you going to get,so don’t be cheap...))) The drinks are very good,as well as the food in the restaurant downstairs at the lobby of the hotel, where they have a cozy set up of tables and chairs inside and outside of the premises with great views of Collins Avenue...

217410,HOTEL,Hilton Grand Vacations Club McAlpin Ocean Plaza Miami,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/8d/c3/b5/exterior.jpg,[],38,$$$$,$450,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18772149175,"1430 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139",rentalsales@hgvc.com,[],52,[],25.786291,-80.12979,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d217410-Reviews-Hilton_Grand_Vacations_Club_McAlpin_Ocean_Plaza_Miami-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.hilton.com/en/hotels/miamsgv-hilton-grand-vacations-club-mcalpin-ocean-plaza-miami/?SEO_id=YEXTN-GV-MIAMSGV&y_source=1_Mjc3Mjk0MjMtNzY5LWxvY2F0aW9uLndlYnNpdGU%3D,#38 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1257,"My husband and I stayed here from April 1-4 2023. We really enjoyed the location of the property and access to dining, the beach, shopping etc. The property is an older building that is remodeled. The elevators are small and older but again location, location, location. The front desk is only in the Ocean Plaza building and we stayed at the McAlplin. We went to the beach on 2 of the days we were there and the front desk clerk let allowed us to take 4 beach towels and rent an umbrella and 2 lawn chairs from “Esteban's Place.” “Esteban's Place” is the company the Hilton uses to rent beach equipment which is great since I did not want to lay on a towel. The gentleman at Esteban set up my chairs and umbrella for me once I showed them my paid receipt from Hilton. The room had a kitchenette with a toaster, coffee maker, electric kettle, stove, and dishwasher. Landry was on my floor so that was a huge plus as my husband and I work out and go through so much laundry. The front desk gave us laundry soap too so we did not have to buy any. Walgreens is a couple of blocks away so that was nice we could get things we forgot or needed. 

The only downside is there is no pool and it would be nice if there was a partnership with the Hilton Hotel on Southbeach to use their pool. We did not really miss the pool at all though because we were at the beach and busy going to restaurants etc. There is a hot tub on the roof you could use that is rather small but it is there. We did not use it but I did go on the roof during the mornings etc. The hotel is across from a really nice part with a swing set and palm trees. I would recommend this property. 

",Great place with a great location!

It close to all the restaurants and had a great view of the beach. Ocean drive was closed to traffic so it may for great walking. So many restaurants nearby, good luck picking out one for the evening. In addition, there is a walking path along the beach. This is the art deco district so the architecture all around was different and interesting. The Art Deco Information center is down a block if you are interested in a walking tour of the area. 
The room was perfect - nice and clean with just enough space to spread out. Much better than a hotel room. Only downside of the room was the trash pickup on Tuesday morning - wow was it loud (they do provide earplugs - use them!). The roof top hot tub was nice (not as nice as a pool), but generally not very crowded and it had a nice view of the ocean. Getting a lounge chair and umbrellas at the front desk was very easy and cheaper than getting it on the beach. The beach is excellent - clear water and nice white sand. 
The staff was excellent. Tall Paul was always around (does that guy get any time off) to help and the front desk staff was always nice and helpful. There was coffee and water in the lobby every morning; however, the Starbucks is less than a block away (order on the app and it will be ready by the time you get there).
Overall, this a great location for a nice beach vacation. Sure everything is not right there at the hotel (no pool and the beach requires a little walk), but it is close to everything you would hope to be near in South Beach.",Great Location with Great Staff

The location is spectacular but you must like historic properties. First, the rooms are smaller than comparable HGVC properties. There is a pull out sofa but four in this one bedroom would be a challenge unless you came with minimal luggage. Since this part of Ocean Drive is closed to vehicles, you must park your car nearby, call the hotel and the hotel will come out and move it for you. Do not bring a lot of luggage. You then park your car. We used nearby municipal lot at $20 per day. You could choose a valet option at $40. It is the quietest part of Ocean Drive but some service vehicles will use the alley directly behind the building and right under us. The noise was not bad but heavier windows might have helped. 217410,HOTEL,Hilton Grand Vacations Club McAlpin Ocean Plaza Miami,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/8d/c3/b5/exterior.jpg,[],38,$$$$,$450,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18772149175,"1430 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139",rentalsales@hgvc.com,[],52,[],25.786291,-80.12979,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d217410-Reviews-Hilton_Grand_Vacations_Club_McAlpin_Ocean_Plaza_Miami-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.hilton.com/en/hotels/miamsgv-hilton-grand-vacations-club-mcalpin-ocean-plaza-miami/?SEO_id=YEXTN-GV-MIAMSGV&y_source=1_Mjc3Mjk0MjMtNzY5LWxvY2F0aW9uLndlYnNpdGU%3D,#38 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1257,"We stayed here because it was the only Hilton Grand Vacation property in Miami's South Beach area.

Our first impression wasn't great.  The street in front of the property was closed off permanently.  So there wasn't a way to stop and drop off our luggage.  Fortunately, the valet at the Winter Haven Hotel was nice enough to let us park while we checked in.

During check-in, the hotel staff said that we could park at the nearest intersection at 14th and Ocean Drive and unload there.  But when we got to that location, the security told us otherwise, so we had to go back to the Winter Haven and unload there instead and had the bell hop meet us there to take our luggage back to the hotel.

The lobby and rooms were simple.  Not sure when they were renovated, but it looks like they updated recently.  I have to say, the sofa bed was one of the more comfortable ones I've ever slept on.

The hotel's location was right across the street from the beach.  The hotel made arrangements with a beach chair rental place for discounts.  They gave us vouchers that we could use and charged them to our room.  This way, we didn't have to pay the rental place directly.

The staff was really friendly and gave us plenty of recommendations for sightseeing and restaurants.

They place has a small exercise room as well as a hot tub and sun terrace on the top floor.  Unfortunately, if one is in the hot tub, there is no view of the beach or surrounding area.

We were there for only 4 days, but it was definitely a great experience.  Even though we spent more time sightseeing than on the beach, I would still recommend the place.  Wish we could have stayed a few more days.  Just be aware that unloading your luggage can be tricky.",Great location!

Usually it's a positive experience.  However, we visited on the last weekend of February 2022 and found a few issues that other guests should be aware of.

--  Ocean Drive is blocked off from 12th Street to 15th Street.  The roadway in those blocks is now pedestrian-only (bikes, scooters and skateboards ARE allowed on the roadway.)  This means you can no longer pull up in front of the property to unload luggage.  The doorman will meet you by The Betsy Hotel and take your luggage to check-in, but you have to call to coordinate this service.  Overnight vehicle parking is still available at the municipal parking garages on 13th Street and at Collins/16th Street for $20/24-hour period.

--  The elevators in the Ocean Plaza building are under renovation.  We stayed in the McAlpin location where the small elevator worked fine.  The work on the elevators has been going on for at least 1.5 years by our experience. 

-- TV reception was a bit of an issue.  Their (presumed Direct TV/satellite) TV service kept getting interrupted with numerous ""Lost Signal"" error messages.  Made watching shows and the news (Russia/Ukraine invasion) very problematic.

-- Although not directly an issue with HGV-Miami, traffic is worse than usual for those driving in.  In particular, Collins Avenue is under major construction in several locations in upper South Beach.  

All in all, HGV-Miami is still a very nice property once you get there.  The staff is friendly and, generally, the property seems well maintained.  Our 1-bedroom unit was comfortable and clean.

We'll get back here eventually, but the above issues took some of the edge off of our visit this year.  Hope they get both elevators working soon.",A few tips from our February 2022 visit.

We often at it all to ourselves ( maybe others didn’t want to take the stairs). The other building had a slightly large tub and we used that one night . The place was very clean.  There was a worker always cleaning marks off  walls, sweeping, spraying down high contact areas.   They have coffee tea in lobby available all day. And even got a new carafe when it was empty mid day for my husband.  We liked the upper floor because it seemed much quieter ..we had no issue with noise where you might on lower floor. Can sell beer wine at desk as well. They don’t have a pool but you have the beach across the street , restaurants and shopping museums all in walking distance so we didn’t rent a car.   It would sleep 4 (2 in pullout couch ) but it would be tough with one bathroom and not much privacy ( pocket door from living/eating area)  but it was perfect for a couple. This portion of Ocean Drive is, thankfully, still closed to auto traffic. You can sit out on the front porch area of either building and watch the world go by. The main entrance doors are really heavy they could do with pinning them open or offering assistance especially when you have luggage or shopping. 
Music around the pool was very same-y all day every day. I felt for the pool attendants who were hassled all day by disgruntled residents who couldn't get seats as the free ones go quickly leaving only those with a minimum spend or charge, luckily we were up early so it wasn't a problem for us. 
The location remains the hotel's asset, on South Beach and close enough to the action yet in a quiet neighbourhood so you can have some peace when you want it. Food and drink is now overpriced. Recommend Oliver's Bistro nearby for meals.

All the reception staff are excellent, especially Luis.  They make the Hotel!

The location is also ideal for getting round, the Publix supermarket is in walking distance and Montys, is only a 10 minute walk which serves lovely food! We walked miles to soak up Miaim.  With the $ v £ exchange we found everything expensive on this trip.
If you want to go to the Bayside Market Place & take a boat tour, I suggest you buy the 2 day hop on hop off bus tour as this covers a boat trip and has a stop at the Bayside Market Place, more cost effective than Uber or Lyft and then the boat tour cost.  We learnt this after paying out!

 It was at an ideal location for South Beach and the hotel and room was clean. However the room is quite small which was fine for a 2 night stay but probably not if you're staying any longer. 
There was WiFi in the common areas of the hotel however this did not stretch to our room which was quite frustrating.
The staff were friendly and welcoming. 
There was a café at reception which sold some nice breakfast snacks and hot drinks. 
After our stay the hotel took an additional $80 from our credit card and are still yet to respond to us to what this relates to and there was no mention of any further charges on our check out. 
Overall the value for money is good but could be better if there was WiFi in the room and they didn't take an additional charge without informing us. 
",2 night stay - Dec 22

I don’t know how they work the room cleaning. We just put our do not disturb out for 4 days and got our own towels, etc from the housekeeper. The tropical plants around the hotel are nice. The price is one of the best I found in Miami for a clean and safe place. It was across the street from the beach and they provided towels and chairs with cushions on them. We asked for late check out and they were able to accommodate that so we were able to spend the whole day on the beach and at their restaurant, Extra Virgin. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. We did check out the rooftop pool which also looked clean but we didn’t use it. There’s a sitting area up there too that was nice. Didn’t have anything but a few chairs and table but if we wanted to go up there it was off the street so it was quieter. The staff were very friendly. Our particular room was on the first floor and looked a little different than the pictures. The shower was the same floor and stone/tile but it was not exposed like the picture made it look. Still nice, just not as fancy looking as the pic made it look online. Im sure other rooms are set up a little different. I think we had the first room closest to reception. It was quiet and we loved it! I would definitely recommend this spot. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, shops, liquor store, beach, Walgreens. We ubered to our cruise the next day with no issues! We would definitely stay again. We were also so impressed with the food at the restaurant … we had their brunch and it was really good. ","Clean, friendly, great location"

The location was perfect, we walked everywhere we wanted to go.The valet parking is difficult to see as it is an alley next to the hotel, no attendant, you have to park the car if a space is available and take keys to the front desk. They take the car to a parking lot down the block so allow at least 15 minutes for them to retrieve your car. 
The room was small but well appointed, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Unfortunately we were on the first floor and our window looked out to the alley and business parking so were woken up at 6:30 am by truck devileries. We were only there 2 nights so put up with it but I would recomend requesting a room on other side or level.
The pool is very nice but limited loungers, the beach was a short walk away which was very nice, the resort fee covered lounge chair, umbrella and there was also bar service.",Short  local getaway

Upon arrival, we were grateful for early check-in and also had a complimentary bottle of wine delivered to our room.  Our room was the Premium room with partial ocean view and balcony on the 10th floor.  Since this is not an ocean front location, I was not surprised that it was more of a glimpse vs. ocean view. Not a huge deal. There are hotels across the street that I’m sure come with a premium cost if you want to be on the beach.  Hotel guests have beach access across the street at the Lowes hotel with free lounge chairs, but there is a charge for the umbrella.

5600182,HOTEL,Berkeley Shore Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/91/c8/7d/exterior.jpg,[],40,$$$,$158 - $294,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 786-605-0810,"1610 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-3113",reservations@berkeleyshore.com,[],96,[],25.789751,-80.1306,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d5600182-Reviews-Berkeley_Shore_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.berkeleyshore.com,#40 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,828,"Stayed here for almost a week.  So heres the good, the bad, and the ugly. 

Pricing/booking: I picked this property because of the location.   It was perfect for walking and exploring and standard room way cheaper than the beachfront properties right accross the road.  Now i paid extra, and wish i didnt.  Standard rooms are either on lower  floors or without any view (alley) or looking inside another hotels window. Standard rooms were about ~$170 in june.   I kinda waited last minute (a month before trip, and a lot of hotels in south beach were already sold out, they were better and cheaper).  This was a special occasion and i figured if the weather sucks we will live out on balcony for extra $$.  I booked the most expensive 2 double beds room they had which was double the standard room rate (see above and do the math).  Please see the pictures attached of what was shown and sold as that room type and for the price i paid.   When we arrived, i found that the pictures were misleading and the balcony was horrible.  There was a hotel foundation ""beam"" right in a middle of the balcony which was never shown online, which would make me reconsider and not pay $$$.   We never bothered sitting there, just ruined the whole experience.   Keep in mind ""partial ocean"" view is not because of the beam, but because of the other hotels in front of it blocking the view.   The the hotel beam just killed the vibe.   Every higher floor has i think 5 units per floor (boutique hotel) for example lets talk about 7th floor: rooms 700, 705 ( numbered 5 and another one on the other side of hotel) are both on sides and will look out into the alley or back. Rooms 703, 704 (numbered 1, 4 on attached pic) are partial view but have a beam right in a middle of your balcony which ruins it and not what is advertised when they charge you double the price. Rooms 701, and 702 (numbered 2,3 on pic attached) are in a middle and are the ONLY 2 rooms on each high floor  that still have partial view of the  ocean because of the hotel location BUT they are without the blocking beam, which is exactly what is advertised online, and they are the same exact price as the ones with blocking hotel beam.  Not cool, and false advertising.  If i would have known this in a first place I would have saved my money and not bother with a balcony at all.  Shady practice. 

Rooms: I knew to expect the shower in a middle, which was still weird once we got there.  It was just uncomfortable.   One person made sure to not walk around the room when another person was showering, and in general just leaves a person  feeling exposed (mentally not a good feeling).  The bathroom was just a toilet, and a full length mirror right in front so you can stare at yourself  while you take a dump...I was embarrassed for myself everytime i sat there.  There is no tiny sink, no table nothing, so you have to come out, touch the door handle and then wash your hands outside.  Just weird.  The shower had a nice water pressure and nice shower head (rain effect).  The sink was a hot mess and water everywhere.  The outlets at the bed table was wonky, and had to use one accross the room.  Coffee machine was nice, and robes were a nice touch. We did appreciate the cooler/fridge as well. Our room was coming out to the pool and collins ave and eveb though there was a clear noise at night, the sliding doors took care of it, and we slept good.  Beds are nice and comfy.

Location: it was perfect. Easy 5 min walk to the beach, included loungers was a convenient touch.  Restaurants all around, cvs and walgreens and a mall near by. This hotel is included as a pickup spot for a key west day trip which was nice if you are thinking of doing that.

The staff was pleasant, but quite a few did not speak English (housekeeping). Fitness room is the tinniest I have ever seen but airconditioned and nobody was ever there. The pool area looked nice but we never used it. Cannot speak on parking or the inhouse restaurant.  Check in and check out was a breeze.  They do hold a deposit of $300 😳 which they give back of course if you dont break stuff.",Ok if you book the cheapest option

5600182,HOTEL,Berkeley Shore Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/91/c8/7d/exterior.jpg,[],40,$$$,$158 - $294,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 786-605-0810,"1610 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-3113",reservations@berkeleyshore.com,[],96,[],25.789751,-80.1306,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d5600182-Reviews-Berkeley_Shore_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.berkeleyshore.com,#40 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,828,"Had a great time in Miami with family, week of April 25!  In reading the previous reviews before I chose this hotel I was a bit nervous because some of them were really bad.  I’m glad that I followed through and booked this hotel.  

The location was perfect, walkable to tons of restaurants, a Walgreens/liquor store, and the beach.  Did not have to rent a car, could walk or Uber to anything we wanted to do.  The restaurant at the hotel had very good food and drinks and had a large outdoor seating area to enjoy the nice weather and also to people watch.  We were given vouchers for a complimentary “continental” breakfast for every morning of our stay.  Their version of “continental” was an egg (cooked to order), toast, a bowl of fresh fruit, coffee and juice.  It was very good and more than I eat for breakfast on any given day. There was a happy hour (4-7?)every day with discounted drinks and apps.  Also, as a guest of the hotel you receive 20% off  your bill for any food you purchase.  It rained our last evening and it was great to be able to eat dinner there and not have to get wet walking somewhere else for dinner.

The pool was small but nice, there appeared to be a decent gym and the ice machine and water/sparkling water dispenser by the pool were a nice touch. There was one day that the ice machine was not working but they gave us ice at the bar.  The hotel is one block from the beach and Loews (Boucher Brothers rentals) has an agreement with the hotel, two complimentary chaise longues and towels per day per room.  Umbrella rental is approx. $30/day.  Food and beverage service on the beach (from Loews) is good, although a bit pricey and the servers were stretched a little thin due to lots of orders. The drinks were good and my chicken caesar wrap was very good quality.

The beds and the shower were very nice.  The shower itself was in the middle of the room but frosted so that you could not see in.  We opted for the premier Plus room with balcony overlooking the pool and partial ocean view.  Was very happy with our choice.  Our group was in Rm. 701 (end room) and 704.  It is my observation that if you stay on the 4th floor or higher that you might have the better experience, and maybe this is where the negative reviews come from.  The front of the hotel facing Collins Ave. only goes up to the 3rd floor, any room facing the street could be a bit noisy from the street traffic, any room on the 1st floor is close to the lobby/bar and could be noisy. 

Here are a few observations for full disclosure:
-try to stay in a room on a higher floor (farther from the street noise)
-walls could be a bit thin, every time someone flushed in another room it was loud
-there were no drawers to put your clothing away, just a closet and a couple of cubbies
-the mini frig is actually a cooler, not a refrig..It did keep things pretty cold, though.
-no microwave in the room
-lighting by the bathroom sink was not ideal for applying makeup.
-only one staff member at check-in desk at any given time due to this not being a huge hotel.  You may have to wait a bit if several groups are checking in at the same time or need assistance with something.  However, the staff were very courteous and helpful.

Overall we had a wonderful time in South Beach and due to our positive experience at Iberostar Berkeley would definitely stay there again.  Miami is expensive and if you want to stay somewhere nice with a great location but don’t want to pay the exorbitant prices of a Loews, this is a great choice.",Great time in South Beach Miami

6959850,HOTEL,The Confidante Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/26/b9/07/e8/exterior.jpg,[],52,$$$$,$247 - $420,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,,"4041 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140-3713",concierge@theconfidantehotel.com,[],354,[],25.812696,-80.122246,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d6959850-Reviews-The_Confidante_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://theconfidantehotel.com,#52 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,6791,"My family of four (husband, 10 yo boy and 8yo girl) just returned from a long weekend at the Confidante over Easter weekend. 

We stayed in a high floor room in the older part of the hotel overlooking Collins avenue. My husband was disappointed that we didn't have a balcony or ocean view  (no upgrades happened to be available at check-in for Hyatt Globalists), BUT I didn't mind it with the skyline in the distance and pretty sunsets! He felt the decor could use an upgrade, but I appreciated the period piece furniture and eclectic patterns. We both agreed everything was clean and tidy, and were surprised at the rather generously sized bathroom for Miami (great art deco design there too). The housekeeping did a fantastic job keeping our room fresh every day, bringing us extra towels, and accommodating our schedule of when we would be in and out. I preferred the size of this hotel vs the huge resorts - boutique is definitely more my vibe. It was cozy, cheerful, easy to get around. 

The poolside chairs were cushioned and comfortable, but beware this is Miami, and they are packed in. Some seemed a tad on the ragged side. The chairs at the beach were not as comfy and could also use an upgrade. Staff from the pool to the bar to the restaurant to the lobby were all very friendly, helpful and they work extremely hard. The pools were too crowded for my taste, and the water quality was cloudy, so my husband never went in them. I went in a little bit. The kids swam quite a lot, and didn't seem to mind. We enjoyed walks on the promenade and beach (right in front of the hotel) and afternoon swims in the ocean when the water was typically more calm. 

The Confidante is close to plenty of other hotels and a variety of restaurants. We enjoyed Primo across the street for sandwiches and coffees, and Piola pizza restaurant for dinner one night. The hotel restaurant/poolside bar itself was incredibly expensive, so we were more conservative about ordering on location. Keep in mind all the hotels add on an automatic 21% gratuity to the prices that are already high. Two margaritas come to about $45. They also tacked on a $201 lunch to our bill one day, which we did not order. They refunded the money without too much hassle, but make sure you receive your tab each day, and I would get the printed copy of the full bill before you check out.

In all, I felt the hotel did an excellent job of keeping everything family friendly, but also fun for the young adults/party/influencer types. Music by the pool was fun yet chill, and everyone of all ages seemed to be enjoying themselves. The Egg Hunt on Easter was a big hit with my kids - what a ""sweet"" activity to have for families. My kids were bummed not to win the GIANT chocolate bunnies, but I was secretly ok with this ;)

Thanks for a great time - I would definitely stay here again! 
","Cute, Friendly & Fun!"

1161105,HOTEL,SLS South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/c8/af/b8/exterior-view.jpg,[],45,$$$$,$258 - $527,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Accor Hotels.,13054190991,"1701 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-2006",slssouthbeach@sbe.com,[],140,[],25.792536,-80.128746,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1161105-Reviews-SLS_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.slssouthbeach.com,#45 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3508,"TBH, I would give it a 3.5 stars. The food on site is quite solid but pricey and the service is slow (but isn't that everywhere post-pandemic, when you're short on staff).  The rooms are tiny but they are well appointed and the showers (water pressure) are excellent.  You're not in SoBe to stay in your room anyways.  Like some others have noted, the elevators were out of commission so it was stairs stairs stairs - which I was fine with as I'm trying to get in shape.  The wifi was very strong and consistent.  The local valet service was useful to go a couple of miles down the block for dinner drop off.  Housekeeping was thorough.  Yes, you will hear the beats and the bass at least until midnight but if you want restful sleep, this isn't really the place for you.  The hotel could use more quiet spots as many digital nomads were trying to get some work done but there's not really a lot of good spots to do so - I saw a lot of people on laptops at the pool or at the outdoor dining restaurant.  Ultimately, for a party spot, this is a solid option.  For a work function, ehh, not so much.",It is what it is

1161105,HOTEL,SLS South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/c8/af/b8/exterior-view.jpg,[],45,$$$$,$258 - $527,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Accor Hotels.,13054190991,"1701 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-2006",slssouthbeach@sbe.com,[],140,[],25.792536,-80.128746,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1161105-Reviews-SLS_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.slssouthbeach.com,#45 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3508,"So my stay at the SLS was a bit of a catalog of errors.
The SLS is in a beautiful Art Deco building from, I guess, the 1950s - but that comes some major drawbacks.
I arrived on a Sunday just before 4pm. I was told that my room still wasn't ready, even though check-in was at 4pm. I was therefore put in another room that was ready. Room 402.
There are two elevators in the hotel. One was broken and had a barrier in front of it. I waited for the other one. And waited. And waited. With about 12 other people. You see, there is no service elevator, so this one elevator has to serve 12 floors of rooms, and the basement, and all the cleaners and facilities and kitchen. So you ALWAYS have to wait about 10 minutes for it. And when you're waiting on the room floors, it doesn't say where the elevator is, so you just wait. And wait. And wait.  
Or you give up and take the stairs. Which are very narrow and dark and painted black, so you can't see them, so you might die. But after waiting for 10 minutes for a lift that never comes, it feels worth the risk. 
What they didn't tell me was that the room I had been put in, Room 402, was the smallest room in the hotel. So much for ""King Deluxe"", it was more like ""King Closet"". The bed basically took up the whole room. There was no wardrobe - a tiny hanging rail with room for one shirt. A small uncomfortable chair (whereas in the pictures there's a nice long sofa). And a tiny shower room. Oh and the sheets were nice but the pillows were all cheap artificial foam ones. Ugh.
Honestly I was so claustrophobic that the next morning I rang to complain, and was told I could change rooms - but I would have to check out at 12.00, and then check back in again at 4pm. (and no, no refund or compensation for putting me in a cupboard).
I couldn't stay in the room, so I took one of the nice pink bicycles round to Soho Beach house for the day and worked from there, returning at 12.00 to check out. Thankfully they were able to move me right away into my new room, room 1112 on the 11th floor.
Unfortunately now NEITHER of the elevators was working. Yup, the one on the left was still broken (and by the way it was broken right through until I left the hotel the following Thursday), and now there was someone fixing the lift on the right as well. So I had to take those narrow stairs. Yup, 11 flights of stairs. There was a whole bunch of us climbing the stairs, and a bunch of people coming down the stairs, so it all got rather amusing. Nobody died, thankfully. 
My new room (1112) was better - small but just spacious enough you don't feel like you're going to suffocate, and at least there was a bit more hanging space, a sofa with a little space to work on, and a bigger bathroom.  I still couldn't believe they'd put me in the cupboard room when I was paying $500 per night. But this was a nice room, If only the elevators worked.
I got lots of glute work-outs going up and down those 11 flights of stairs. 
The other crazy thing is that when you take the stairs down to the Mezzanine floor, you either have to go down to a fire escape that brings you out to some weird alleyway behind the building (kind of scary) - OR you can barge into the hotel meeting space, which has nice stairs to the lobby. But those are the only options. As it happens, my company was using the meeting space for our offsite, so we were constantly interrupted by people who were fed up waiting for the elevators and the only way to the lobby was through our meeting room.  As if the constant thud, thud, thud of the house music downstairs wasn't distracting enough...
So if you're planning an offsite, look elsewhere.

To summarise, if you like Art Deco buildings and have the patience of a saint and don't mind going up a dozen flights of stairs every time you leave something in your room, then this hotel isn't bad. The staff are friendly, the location is nice, the pool is great. But please, sort out the elevators... And if you get given room 402, politely suggest that you didn't come to Miami to stay in a prison cell.",Very tired and the elevators don't work

1161105,HOTEL,SLS South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/c8/af/b8/exterior-view.jpg,[],45,$$$$,$258 - $527,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Accor Hotels.,13054190991,"1701 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-2006",slssouthbeach@sbe.com,[],140,[],25.792536,-80.128746,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1161105-Reviews-SLS_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.slssouthbeach.com,#45 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3508,"I could hardly wait to get home to write this review on the RIP OFF experience we had at this hotel.

 On our way to Key West we stopped at the SLS and reserved and PAID FOR IN FULL an ocean front room. When we arrived back a week later we were told that all the ocean front rooms were occupied! Imagine that- paying for an ocean front room a week in advance only to find that our reservation was not honored!

The manager was young and only a manager for 3 weeks, and his inexperience shined brightly as he tried to switch us around.

We were offered an ""upgrade"" to a pool view villa and after negotiating for the hotel to throw in a free breakfast, free valet, and waiving the resort fee, we were taken to our villa room. Turns out the pool has blasting music that was loud enough to dance to in our room with the door closed. We asked how long the music played, and were told the ""pool party"" went on until 2 AM. Now, if I was a 20 something that might have been fine, but in my late 60s that was unacceptable as I find myself in bed an asleep at 2 AM. I don't think that peace and quiet are too much to ask for at 2 AM, but hey, that's just me.

We were shown a third room with an ocean view, but the beds seem to have been made for very small people and the room size matched the beds. Not acceptable.

I called around but all the hotels were pretty much booked unless we wanted to pay over $900 for the night. So we decided to just forget our night in Miami Beach and come home instead. The result of this was our also giving up our anticipated night on the town and our plans to see an old friend the next day.

I can walk short distances just fine but use a mobility scooter for more than a block or so. When my wife was talking with the manager he said that we didn't tell the hotel we needed a handicap room when the reservation was made. Funny thing is that I made the reservation in person at the same front desk as I was at when I was telling the manager how unacceptable his comments on handicapped people were.

As we were checking in another couple who had also reserved an ocean front room also were told that none were available, and that the fine print said that the room reserved might not be available at check in. They caved and took a lesser room, however mine had been paid in full.

 I have stayed at many hotels around the world from the Savoy in London to the Motel 6 at the Managua, Nicaragua airport, but this was my first experience at such a blatant bait and switch.

Shame on you SLS for not honoring our fully paid for reservation and then offering us another room where the music would be playing until the early hours of the morning. That was a dirty, underhanded  move on your part to oversell rooms in the hope that you could make more money on travelers who had no other choice. And shame on you for trying to blame us for not telling you of my handicap condition when I made the reservation right in front of the reception desk. 

A truly first class hotel would have bent over backwards to honor their reservation and if it were just not possible would have found us similar or better accommodations at another hotel on their dime.

I hate it when people try to scam me, and that's just what this was like. ",Scam bait and switch

The kicker was— they sell their beach chair access on ResortPass so the people who were in front of me who weren’t hotel guests got chairs before us.

1161105,HOTEL,SLS South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/c8/af/b8/exterior-view.jpg,[],45,$$$$,$258 - $527,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Accor Hotels.,13054190991,"1701 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-2006",slssouthbeach@sbe.com,[],140,[],25.792536,-80.128746,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1161105-Reviews-SLS_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.slssouthbeach.com,#45 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3508,"Did a Pool Day Pass here after a cruise as we had a whole day to wait for our evening flight. 

We had stayed at the Shelbourne a block away a few weeks ago and been really disappointed. Having stayed in South Beach before, we called the SLS the “SOS”….Style Over Substance as it’s where the ‘beautiful people’ go with Ferraris parked out front. We couldn’t have been more wrong though!

First impressions count and when Peter Erasme is your first point of contact as you exit a cab, be prepared to be charmed. He couldn’t be more helpful (even though we were only day guests) and took our bags, checked us in and explained where the facilities were. He even offered us use of a room if we wanted to shower before leaving.

The pool area itself was lovely although be aware the music gets turned up a notch around 11am (this was a weekday) as the hotel attracts a young set. This didn’t bother me though as I quite like me dance music (I’m mid 50s). The pool itself was a good temperature and length (salty water though) and I had a decent swim.

We ordered some food and drinks and it is not extortionate given the location ($10 can of beer, $24 for a huge cheese burger that I struggled to finish. They also came round with grapes and ice lollies while we were there.

When we were ready to leave, Peter again helped get our bags, call a cab and wished a warm farewell as we got in the taxi.

Just a shame we didn’t stay here instead of the Shelbourne as it was cheaper too!",SLS Day Pass Luxury

Location is right in the middle of the action in Brickell, within walking distance of 20+ restaurants and great shopping.

Staff were friendly, engaging, and very willing to help in any way - could not have been nicer.

The rooms are clean and groovy, but lacking some basic amenities like shelf space and towel hooks in the bathroom. If you're a lady with a big vanity you'll be putting it on the floor.

A big call out is to ask for a high floor. Friday and Saturday night there is a nightclub off the lobby; we were originally on the second floor (that is, right above it) and it was like being in the nightclub itself. 

Again staff couldn't have been more accommodating in getting us moved, but not really cool to have to do a room change at midnight.

649833,HOTEL,Kimpton Angler's Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/05/79/41/9f/entrance-the-angler-boutique-reso.jpg,[],35,$$$$,$214 - $402,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13055349600,"660 Washington Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6208",talktous@anglershotelmiami.com,[],132,[],25.776522,-80.13404,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d649833-Reviews-Kimpton_Angler_s_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.anglershotelmiami.com/?cm_mmc=YextLocal-_-cp-_-US-_-ANGL,#35 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2430,"Four night stay in March 2023.  Two rooms.  Loft suite 116 and studio suite / king room with living area 309.

PROS:  Kimpton Angler's Hotel is well-situated in Miami's South Beach.  Luciana at the front desk is incredibly knowledgeable and helpful.  The rooftop pool is spacious with attentive towel service and city views.  Housekeeping was responsive and attentive on request.  Food and beverage staff were friendly.  Morning coffee service was conveniently served in Seawell Fish & Oyster.  The municipal parking garage is located right around the corner, making parking a breeze.  Even with the close proximity to Ocean Drive, the resort felt private and we did encounter any noise issues.  The property is quieter and much more relaxed than the Kimpton Surfcomber.  Convenient access to the trolley.

CONS:  This is a high-traffic property that feels understaffed.  There were frequently long lines at the front desk.  Staff knowledge and helpfulness was uneven at the front desk (Luciana was great, her male colleagues less so).  The beach bag is disappointing for the resort fee -- beach towels were not replenished on a daily basis.  Beach umbrellas provided by the front desk were broken; beach chairs are not available.  I used a confirmable suite upgrade for a loft suite.  As others point out in their loft suite reviews, Room 116 felt humid and musty, and the bathrooms have not been updated and do not look like the ones in the marketing photos.  Many of the windows have an opaque white privacy film on them.  The ground floor pool is very small.  Rooftop pool bar and food coverage was short-staffed and not always immediately available.  Wine hour was difficult to find and sometimes did not start on-time; it was sometimes hosted on the sidewalk.  Staff acknowledged room maintenance issues had been previously reported but not addressed, including a broken cabinet door that had caused floor damage and shower drainage issues in Room 309.  Of the two rooms, 309 was brighter and felt more spacious.  Loft suite 116 felt dark and the layout felt cramped.  There was also no power outlet within phone charger length of the bed in 116.  The elevator in the Seawell Fish & Oyster building went down during our stay.  Guest services responded to text message requests, although sometimes reminders were needed and it took more than an hour or two for things that were desired quickly, (e.g. ice).  We requested several times an in-room coffee machine.  When delivered, it was broken.  There were no personalized welcome amenities or in-room surprise gestures for Inner Circle membership during the stay beyond the standard points and a bar credit.

Other reviewers have pointed out that the new building is in better shape than the loft suites or the rooms located in the Seawell Fish & Oyster building.  Common spaces and elevators in the new building did appear to be nicer; we did not have guest rooms in the new building.  I've stayed several times at nearby Local House and would probably opt to stay there for a future stay.","Well-situated, high-traffic, understaffed"

649833,HOTEL,Kimpton Angler's Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/05/79/41/9f/entrance-the-angler-boutique-reso.jpg,[],35,$$$$,$214 - $402,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13055349600,"660 Washington Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6208",talktous@anglershotelmiami.com,[],132,[],25.776522,-80.13404,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d649833-Reviews-Kimpton_Angler_s_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.anglershotelmiami.com/?cm_mmc=YextLocal-_-cp-_-US-_-ANGL,#35 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2430,"I travel very often and am relatively unproblematic. In fact, I have never had such a bad experience at any property before that I felt the need to write a review. Now on to my experience... it started off bad and just continued to go downhill. 

I was flying in on a red eye so I called the hotel well in advance to say I would be arriving at 4AM and would very much appreciate if a room could be arranged at the time. I was told that the arrangements would be made. I reached the hotel at 5AM and was told by the guy at the front desk that there are no rooms available and all the rooms are booked.  He said the best he could do was put my room in front of the housekeeping queue who come in at 9AM so a room could be arranged by 11AM at the earliest. I was not offered any water or any advice on where I, a solo girl, could wait in peace for the next 6 hours. 

I took it in my stride and waited in the lobby until their restaurant next door opens at 8AM.   11AM comes around and I head back to the front desk to get an update on my room. I am now told by two different people that check out barely begins at 2PM so the earliest a room could be ready for me would be 4PM (apparently the housekeeping who come in at 9AM takes 7 hours to prep rooms for new guests). They offer no apology and just claim that this is the best they can do. OK - I decide to just hang out at the beach until 4PM.

I come back at 4PM finally exhausted from waiting for a room for 12 hours now and am told the room I booked is unavailable but they will try to find me an available room. While I am waiting for an available room, two couples come and check in, and are led to their rooms. Finally, a ""suite"" is made available for me and I am ready to just put all of this behind me. It is not a ""Suite"" by any standards - in fact just a normal king room that is also grossly old looking. This room was in the building next door so I am not sure if the rooms in the actual hotel are better.

I get to this so-called suite, and the floor is all scratched up. The room does not look remotely luxurious or clean, you would think Kimpton has a certain standard. 

I just didn't want to engage and go back to the front desk so I decide to keep this room. The hotel is in a great location and as a solo girl, I did not feel unsafe at any time. However, the pros stop right there. Even though they offer free coffee/tea in the morning and a wine bar in the evening, what is the point if the service is so terrible and the room is of a 2 star quality. I really do hope the rooms in the main building are nicer.

Finally my stay comes to an end and the vendor I booked through included a $150 credit as part of my stay. I confirm this at check out. Yet one week later, I see three different charges on my credit card. I called the hotel to see why I was charged when these three would easily be covered under the $150 credit. I'm told by Anthony that he sees a credit on their end and that my credit card should show a charge and then a credit. I told him in many different ways that all I see are charges and no credit. He simply does not understand so I am now forced to dispute this through my credit card company. Staying at this hotel has been an exhausting experience both during my stay and now even after.  I am swearing off all Kimpton properties in the future.

",Just terrible..

649833,HOTEL,Kimpton Angler's Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/05/79/41/9f/entrance-the-angler-boutique-reso.jpg,[],35,$$$$,$214 - $402,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13055349600,"660 Washington Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6208",talktous@anglershotelmiami.com,[],132,[],25.776522,-80.13404,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d649833-Reviews-Kimpton_Angler_s_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.anglershotelmiami.com/?cm_mmc=YextLocal-_-cp-_-US-_-ANGL,#35 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2430,"Reading the reviews of the Kimpton Anglers, they are mostly positive. It's such a shame that this wasn't our experience. 
We booked in for the night in February and like other travellers have commented, the location to Miami Beach is fantastic. Within a few minutes walk you're on Ocean Drive. 

Unfortunately that's where the positives ended. Check-in was chaotic with one person on reception attempting to be both check-in clerk and concierge, wrong keys for bike hire locks, guests taking out their luggage from storage and a queue to check in. After a long drive it was truly awful. 

The hotel is styled with a designer first / customer experience second, so the whole of the ground floor reception / bar & hallway inexplicably under lit to the point of darkness. Missing the mark of subtle, soft or kind lighting and sadly ending up just creepy. 

We had a room on the 5th floor and the air-con in the hallway from the elevator was set to Arctic - people were actively shivering. 

The room itself was pleasantly laid out and decorated well. It was such a shame that it was so dirty. Again design led and practicalities last. You'll see from the photos that the dust on the whicker lights and chairs was pretty gross. 

Personally I have a hatred for sliding barn style bathroom doors. This one was made worse by not staying in place once you shut it. I had to use a towel to jam it shut. The amount of dust, hair and shower splash back on it was disgusting (see photo). 

Plus the pillows are cheap and thin. 

Lastly, breakfast... This really is a bit of a comedy. It's served from 8 in the building next door. Service was slow and begrudging. (there's no coffee facilities in the room).

Not much was offered at this hotel in the way of charm, information or hospitality. 
However, if you do stay: 

My top tip is to use the parking garage on 7th Street. $20 flat rate overnight. The Kimpton offers valet only for $40. 

",Could have been so much better.

It's 4 blocks to the beach like .3 of a mile. The staff  here is fabulous and helpful.  Luciana  at the front desk  truly goes above and beyond. we got to the hotel early after getting off a cruise. She did everything she could for our early check in and we chilled on the beautiful outdoor pool area while our upgraded suite was getting ready.  we were in our room at 1:45pm.  Next we meet the outgoing truly helpful Madeline  whom served wine during wine hour from 5pm to 6pm outside in the court  area. She gave a wonderful recommendation  on where to eat.   Another  2 amazing front desk people whom assisted as I remembered the secert passpord so I got to spin the wheel was Cornelius  and Hussein.Lastly another awesome person  was Christopher R my spouse contacted the hotel for my birthday and i received a special surprise. I truly loved this place. The room we got upgraded due to our status was  beautiful  with a nice cozy balcony.  The room was huge,  bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean and massive with tub and shower.They do have a safe, a beach bag with 2 towels, robes, umbrella, iron and iron board and yoga mat in the closet. The free wine hour was 5pm to 6pm in the area right outside the hotel. They had 4 choices here which were amazing 2 whites pinot grigio borghi ad est, a chardonnay  can't remember  the name,and 2 reds: badger hound red blend, and Turning Leaf pinot Noir. All were wondderful choices. This area has wonderful  seating a big size Jenga. My only 2 negatives is its hard to tell this is a hotel because the name is hidden. Also the elevators  need fixing one of them the door closes right on you and the other had a strange smell  and was hot. Otherwise it was amazing. We took lyft from the cruise port it costed $25 and took 23 mins. We took the 150 bus to Miami Airport for $2.25 each it is located across the street infront of the CVS on Washington  and 5th st. Lastly the bar attached the hotel has good specials but they do include gratuity to check. Also if you have a shellfish allergy no fried food options.  The free breakfest option for diamond plus members  is at the restaurants  next door its a $50 cap and it is actually  brunch. But seriously I can't wait to come back here. Amazing must stay at in Miami Beach.","Must stay in Miami Beach location, service and Wine."

From our initial excitement of the upgrade we noticed the room smelt really really damp and seemed to be a little dingy as if it had stood empty for a long time, we went outside to use the hot tub and on lifting the cover it was so full of leaves it was obvious it had not been cleaned for a while.  The patio loungers and furniture were also full of dirt and leaves. So we decided to head for dinner and forget about using it.  Also the dressing gowns in the room were quite shabby looking and really smelt oddly 'sweaty' on opening one :-(

On returning to the room we noticed that it looked like the door had been tried to be forcefully opened in the past and as this was the last ground floor room on the end we were quite nervous of this all night, as the area is behind a bus stop and not really a nice area!  

The next morning after returning from a walk to the beach we noticed the gate had been left open and there was water all over the patio, the leaves were still there all over the floor, side of the tub and steps up to it, but the hot tub looked to have been cleaned inside at least.  However we never used it as it still didn't appear 'clean'.

The reception and pool area was beautiful and we relaxed by the pool for a few hours before check out.

Unfortunately our room key had stopped working on return to the room at 1pm and it took a couple of trips to reception and 20 mins later to get back in.

The staff are really lovely and helpful, however on returning to the UK i have now had an odd charge added to my CC on the day after check out! I settled my bill in full, and housekeeping were radioed to check we had not had anything out of the room (which we hadn't) so i am still waiting for a response to my email to see what this is as its not anything i authorised! 

I wanted to love this place but the room given (albeit an upgrade) and the amount i paid for room only, i wish we had gone elsewhere.  I would not return.  If you pay for a spa suite, try and avoid 112 or at least make sure its cleaned outside.",A little bit let down even with a surprise upgrade!

The Savoy is a boutique hotel, but it is first and foremost a building listed as a historic building in the USA. It was recently reopened after a renovation that made it more modern and comfortable while leaving intact the refined and magical atmosphere of art deco style hotel. The lobby and rooms are tastefully decorated with great attention to detail. Excellent quality of sleep thanks to good beds and soundproofing. The garden and pool are a very inviting place to spend a relaxing day. In addition there is also a nice beach club. The location is great because it is in a very quiet corner of Ocean Drive, close to bars and restaurants. The manager Olivia perfectly reflects all the merits of this hotel and was very helpful in solving some small problems or simply making our stay more pleasant. Her attention to detail and service brings added value to this hotel.",Something special

217385,HOTEL,The Savoy Hotel & Beach Club,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/23/51/2b/e7/the-savoy-hotel-beach.jpg,[],1,$$$$,$378 - $497,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13059281835,"425 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6613",reservations@savoymiami.com,[],31,[],25.773748,-80.13191,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d217385-Reviews-The_Savoy_Hotel_Beach_Club-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.savoymiami.com/,#1 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2714,"First impressions…stunning boutique hotel on Ocean Drive, South Beach. 
Beautiful huge room with balcony and lovely bed. Right on the beach with two nice pools. 
Negatives…no restaurant on site, all the food during the day comes from the cafe opposite!  No bar/drinks or food after 7/8pm when they lock the pool area off!
Very slow service round the pool and food left around uncollected for literally hours, unless you’re fortunate enough to get the blonde lady poolside, who was exemplary at her job. 
No checks coming into the pool area from either the hotel front entrance or the beach entrance…and at weekend it was chaos, with an overcrowded, noisy crowd who were clearly not staying at the hotel!
Whether they were just wandering in at will for the day or they had some sort of membership to the pool area…it needs sorting because it will put customers off coming here again. 
To say it was rowdy would be an understatement! 

Also special mention to the room cleaners,quality!

Reception…need to cheer up and be a bit more engaging with your customers, make them feel remotely welcome!!!

To sum up, great hotel, great location, great rooms but seriously lacking from a food, drink and customer care perspective.","Fantastic hotel on South Beach,however…."

My sister was in one room,and my daughter and I in the other. There were a few stand out staff that were great. David at the desk was very helpful and microwaved our food that we brought back from restaurants. The beach crew was perfect. Bill was great! He checked back with us frequently and met all our requests. We asked to be in his section of the beach. Rico and Phillip set up our chairs and were very friendly. The only thing that we noticed that we didn’t like was the decor. They changed the lobby and pool area . It looked less art deco even though the Savoy is an art deco hotel. The pillows at the pool looked like they were from Target and they removed the cool art deco desk from the lobby and the sofas look pretty ordinary. And the pool area used to be painted with flowers and they were painted over with a drab green. But because of the location and they haven’t changed the room decor. 217385,HOTEL,The Savoy Hotel & Beach Club,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/23/51/2b/e7/the-savoy-hotel-beach.jpg,[],1,$$$$,$378 - $497,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13059281835,"425 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6613",reservations@savoymiami.com,[],31,[],25.773748,-80.13191,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d217385-Reviews-The_Savoy_Hotel_Beach_Club-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.savoymiami.com/,#1 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2714,"Welcome to Fawlty Towers South Beach! The hotel may be situated in a prime area of party-ism Miami (aka SoBe) however it's really well trodden - aka totally worn down. 

Keep in mind almost 100% of the SoBe hotels were in its prime back in the 1950s when rooms cost $50/night. Now some 70 years later, it's literally the same exact properties with a fresh coat of paint and perhaps a new floor and that about it. The Savoy fits that model exactly. If you are looking for a good spring break hotel room to party on - then this is your place. Otherwise the room is in really basic form cheaply appointed with IKEA furnishings complete with random questionable stains. 

The room was pretty filthy including water marks from beverages from the previous guests. The pool area is narrow and questionable. The bar food & beverage looked absolutely disgusting. They have a decent section of the public beach but who cares - literally everyone does on SoBe. 

I'd never stay at this place again - wish the owner actually took pride in keeping it a property worthy of its historic status given by the city, I'm guessing instead they jockeyed for that rating just so they could avoid updating anything, Walls are super thin as are the windows so you hear everything and everyone.

The one positive is that they feature Elemis products from the UK although the soap is mounted to the wall.",Don't believe the photos

I purchased the day pass online at Resort Passes for $95. On top of the excellent service, the package included:

-1 reserved a poolside chaise lounge chair with an umbrella
-1 reserved VIP beach lounge chair with umbrella
-Towel service
-Outdoor showers
-Food and drinks were available for purchase from the Sand Bar.
-10% discount on food and beverage
-Complimentary welcome cocktail
-Complimentary bottled water (1)
-Complimentary book rental from Lobby Library

217385,HOTEL,The Savoy Hotel & Beach Club,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/23/51/2b/e7/the-savoy-hotel-beach.jpg,[],1,$$$$,$378 - $497,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13059281835,"425 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6613",reservations@savoymiami.com,[],31,[],25.773748,-80.13191,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d217385-Reviews-The_Savoy_Hotel_Beach_Club-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.savoymiami.com/,#1 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2714,"Overall our stay at the hotel was nice. 

Room decor, especially the sitting area of our queen suite, was super cute. Unfortunately a lot of the pictures of common spaces on their website are not current. The lobby furniture is a little more basic, without all the cute rattan boho vibes. The pool area is very nice but the beautiful mural in the pictures has been painted over. 

We didn't have hand soap when we arrived. One day water wasn't restocked, and the beers from the mini bar weren't restocked. Daily cleaning was good though.

The biggest room issue was that the mattress was broken when we arrived. They tried to find one to replace it but couldn't. They had one other room to offer us, but it was on the ground floor facing the parking lot and didn't have a rug, so we decided to just keep the broken mattress and my very kind husband agreed to sleep on the fallen side. If you are picky about mattresses and pillows, be warned that the beds are VERY soft, and the pillows very thick.

Bathrooms were standard but the shower design needed work. The open glass door/wall concept was a little too open and we were left with a soaked bath mat and puddle to avoid every time we showered.

Many reviews mentioned complimentary coffee in the lobby, but apparently they do not have this service any more. The free coffee pods provided in the room are not good.  

Staff were very friendly, and the beach and pool services were good. Room service took a while, but maybe that's normal.

I saw many rave reviews about the food, but we felt it was mediocre. Drinks were pretty good, not amazing.

We don't usually do vacations like this so maybe our expectations were higher than they should be. Overall we really did enjoy the hotel and the ambiance was very nice. We appreciated having the option of a smaller, boutique hotel. Just several little disappointments throughout the stay.","Good stay, but some disappointments"

15346944,HOTEL,"Life House, South of Fifth",https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/6f/5a/02/front.jpg,[],158,$$$,$194 - $397,hotel,4.0,1.5,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 866-466-7534,"321 Collins St, Miami Beach, FL 33139",stay@lifehousehotels.com,[],26,[],25.772577,-80.13312,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d15346944-Reviews-Life_House_South_of_Fifth-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.lifehousehotels.com/hotels/miami-beach/south-of-fifth,#158 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,40,"Staff regularly goes above and beyond to cater to your needs. Our flight was slightly delayed, causing us to arrive 40+ minutes after the 11pm check-in time. I informed them, and they assured someone would be on site to check us in. Even after hours, the staff was kind and welcoming.

The entire place was tastefully decorated, with the front patio area very aesthetic and comfortable. The music choice is fire, as the staff is all relatively young.

The location is great, as it allows you to go in one direction and hit all the places you're looking to visit while also not being overly crowded or noisy. The walk to Ocean Dr (5-15th St) is quick and painless, with many shops/things to see. The walk to the beach is <5 min.

At the time of this review, Life House, South of Fifth just opened up (~2 weeks ago), this could play a role of why everything from their website matching the in person vibe. If in 6+ months the online to in person vibe is the same, I would be very impressed and would highly recommend.

One thing to note, we booked the Standard Queen - but a week prior to our stay they called to inform us the AC unit was broken and being fixed. They offered us Deluxe Artist's Loft, or a couple of other nearby hotels that they would accommodate us at no extra charge. It was appreciated.

In the end, we chose the Deluxe Artist's Loft, and had a wonderful experience.",Website and in person is exactly what you'd expect

120332,HOTEL,Marriott Stanton South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/25/3e/53/91/south-beach-aerial-view.jpg,[],17,$$$$,$299 - $524,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18446310595,"161 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139-7212",,[],226,[],25.770445,-80.13245,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d120332-Reviews-Marriott_Stanton_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/miamb-marriott-stanton-south-beach/overview/?scid=45f93f1b-bd77-45c9-8dab-83b6a417f6fe&y_source=1_MjA5Mzk2MC03NjktbG9jYXRpb24ud2Vic2l0ZQ%3D%3D,#17 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,4377,"The Stanton is located south of 5th ave in South Beach so the neighborhood is quieter, cleaner, and a little less extra than everything north of it.  Yet you are still easy walking distance (or ride share) to all that you want from SoBe. It's also right on the beach. And when you leave an almost straight shot to the airport or Port of Miami. 

The rooms are clean, sleek, well appointed, spacious, and updated. And while some have ocean views, even the city views are worth it. 

Caryn at the front desk was a delight and very helpful. Outside there are two infinity edge pools with a hot tub in between.  The pool deck is surrounded by ample chairs and day beds as well as umbrellas, with a dedicated towel station. Across the walkway is a stretch of some of the best beach in Miami with hotel beach attendants and food and beverage service. Again, the hotel offers plenty of chairs, umbrellas and day beds. 

Service is above average and everyone is friendly and ready to assist. 

This hotel charges a resort fee. Normally not a fan because these are typically just money grabs used by hotels to show a lower rate online compared to its competitors. The value is usually not there, and it leaves a bad taste. However this hotel offers enough extra amenities to make it more palatable starting with two complimentary margaritas in their bar, 

INCLUDES:
* Enhanced High Speed WiFi this is not use for Titanium Members like my self 
* Two welcome Lolo's Frozen House Margaritas per stay
* Two beach chairs daily
* Bike rental (up to two hours daily, 2 bikes per room)
* One fitness class per day, per room
* 2 boogie boards per room, per day for 1.5 hours complimentary
* One complimentary specialty salt scrub sachet (one piece per room, need  visit the spa on the Lobby level to retrieve your sachet)
Amenities are based on availability and are subject to change without notice.
Cheers",One of my  Favorite

120332,HOTEL,Marriott Stanton South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/25/3e/53/91/south-beach-aerial-view.jpg,[],17,$$$$,$299 - $524,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18446310595,"161 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139-7212",,[],226,[],25.770445,-80.13245,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d120332-Reviews-Marriott_Stanton_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/miamb-marriott-stanton-south-beach/overview/?scid=45f93f1b-bd77-45c9-8dab-83b6a417f6fe&y_source=1_MjA5Mzk2MC03NjktbG9jYXRpb24ud2Vic2l0ZQ%3D%3D,#17 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,4377,"The Stanton has a great location if you like to be in the heart of things right on the main drag by nicely-designed walking and biking paths and the wide sandy beach and near the lovely pier for morning or evening strolls. All staff were helpful. Beach staff set you up with towels, chairs, umbrellas, food, etc. (Rinaldo, Gianluca, Luke and Jalen and all of them from other days). Cleaning staff gave extra supplies as needed. Front desk printed out documents for me a number of times. Floride handled our room during a long stay. Lolo's Surfside Cantina breakfasts and lunches were easy and affordable and the Big Pink diner is only a block away, with giant portions of every kind of food you could order. The pools were too small for lap swimming but okay for dips, but we spent every day at the beach and didn't mind this. The facilities were a bit limited for a luxury hotel, e.g. small indoor public spaces, no business center (perhaps there is for conference-goers), and a small gym with only one stationary bike, Peleton, etc (I suggest the hotel put a sign up, saying ""please limit equipment use to half an hour if others are waiting""), and not a single work-out mat so you had to stretch on a towel on the floor. The hotel room's tv and remote were slow and our door lock repeatedly jammed until finally replaced, however the engineers resolved these minor issues. One nit to pick: The hotel's Starbucks refused to honor the free birthday coffee promised through their own app, despite accepting payment via the app all month. I mean, c'mon. We've stayed at the Stanton on several trips and will be back there in the future as it's great for a Florida vacation.",Nice South Beach vacation

I was able to check in online. Not sure if that sped up the process in person, but check-in was pretty quick on site. I purchased the last parking pass which was great because parking is expensive and limited in the area. The room was a good size and to my surprise had two bathrooms! Didn’t remember seeing that in the room description. The only negative was that we found a few strands of hair wrapped up in a bath towel and the sink wasn’t rinsed well. We got more towels and I rinsed the sink - problem solved. 

Exercise room has a variety of equipment for vacation workouts. We didn’t use the pool. It was always crowded and closed at 8. The rear of the bldg has an exit to the beach. Wasn’t able to rent chairs when I went and didn’t ask about it, but they were locked up on the beach so I guess renting is an option.  There’s also a walking trail between the hotel and beach to walk, run, ride bikes, etc. There are several food options nearby. Wasn’t super impressed with the ones in walking distance. There’s a CVS across the street. There was a road detour and that was inconvenient and created a lot of traffic. 

Staff were helpful. I would definitely stay again.",Holiday weekend with the kids

224009,HOTEL,Best Western Plus Atlantic Beach Resort,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1d/15/84/3f/exterior.jpg,[],151,$$$,$167 - $267,hotel,3.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18005688520,"4101 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140-3210",,[],186,[],25.813334,-80.122505,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d224009-Reviews-Best_Western_Plus_Atlantic_Beach_Resort-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.bestwestern.com/de_DE/book/hotel-rooms.10366.html?iata=00171890&ssob=BLBWI0003G&cid=BLBWI0003G:yext:website:10366,#151 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2793,"We had a bit of a mixup at check-in. The receptionist told me I was staying for two nights when I had reserved four nights. I showed him my copy of the reservation confirmation that I received from Best Western, and the staff managed to fix my reservation on their end. 

I had reserved a king bed that was not facing the ocean. I had thought that it would be a small room with a king bed and not much else. I walked into the room on the second level mezzanine with a balcony style hallway that overlooked the lobby. I was very pleasantly surprised that not only was the room a good-sized room, but it also led into another room, which had a sofa, a TV, a refrigerator, and another bathroom. That made both my husband and me very happy.

I would like to comment to the management about our bathroom next to the bedroom. While I believe the maids did a great job with our room while we were at the hotel, I did find a piece of dark hair in the bathtub upon my arrival in the room. I do not have dark hair and my husband’s head is shaven, so I know it was not ours. When I went to use the toilet for the first time, it looked as if tiny pieces of ripped up paper were in the toilet.

The bed was comfortable enough. There was a double sheet on the bed. There were plenty of places to plug in electronics. There were also lots of lights. The closet was a lit closet and was very spacious.

We used the gym. It had two treadmills, an elliptical machine, and a bicycle. If you want to lift weights, they have free weights. One problem we had with the gym was the temperature. It was 77° in the gym and that’s not a good temperature for exercising.

We had some trouble with the keys for the room after we first checked in. Neither one of them worked, so I told Erik at the front desk that they didn’t work, and he immediately brought up two more keys. It seems to me as if they need new door locks, since one of our remade keys had trouble opening the door.

The people in the hotel, were very friendly, helpful, and courteous. They seemed to enjoy their job. 

The hotel had a large and spacious lobby. It is an older hotel with a small, swimming pool, and no hot tub.  The pool water approached out of bath water. It was so comfortable I didn’t want to get out of it. It was just a few steps away from the pool deck to the beach. 

CVS was across the street, and that came in handy. We bought milk, Cheerios, and other food items.  I got a blister on my toe while walking on the beach, so I was very happy that it was there so we could get Band-Aids.

One very important detail is to be careful when you walk through the gate to the beach. There is a walkway immediately outside of the gate. You will have to look left and right because bicycle riders treat this walkway as if it is a highway,  Don’t get hit by a speeding bicycle! 

I was fine with the hotel and already have my reservation for my January visit.",Mostly pleasant experience
