120415,HOTEL,Penguin Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/12/01/37/d7/the-penguin-hotel.jpg,[],103,$$$,$161 - $288,hotel,3.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-534-9334,"1418 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4108",reservations@penguinhotel.com,[],43,[],25.785835,-80.12975,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d120415-Reviews-Penguin_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.penguinhotel.com,#103 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1657,"We booked a one night stay before our cruise out of Port Miami, so we didn’t do a lot of research before booking. 
Lovely location on Ocean drive,  walked along boardwalk in the evening and towards the shopping area of Miami Beach in the morning before we left the hotel.
We enjoyed the free drinks next door, even though they wouldn’t let us have a table and had to sit at the bar. But the bartender was friendly and it was fun watching him make drinks for the 15 mins we were there.
Breakfast was slow and it was very sunny and hot right on the sidewalk where we were sat. Wouldn’t pay money to eat there again but it tided us over until we got on the Disney Dream ship.
Pool is down the adjacent alley, at the President Hotel. Small area on The fifth floor roof,  we shared a lounge chair as it was almost full. It was very sunny and there was an employee present, not sure if he was a lifeguard or not.
Hotel had a nice retro vibe, front desk girls were professional but not overly warm. 
You get what you pay for - lots of hotels within 500 feet that go for quadruple the price. Maybe there are cheaper places not right across from the beach eg on Collins.  There’s no car traffic allowed in front, so we had to walk a couple of blocks from our Uber, not a problem but be aware that you won’t get dropped off at their doorstep.
Worst part of our stay were the scratchy sheets, it was bearable for 1 night but I wouldn’t want to sleep a second night on them! Other than that, room was standard size, bathroom was clean, ice machine is in the lobby.","Cheap and cheerful, good for pre cruise one nighter"

120415,HOTEL,Penguin Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/12/01/37/d7/the-penguin-hotel.jpg,[],103,$$$,$161 - $288,hotel,3.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-534-9334,"1418 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4108",reservations@penguinhotel.com,[],43,[],25.785835,-80.12975,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d120415-Reviews-Penguin_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.penguinhotel.com,#103 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1657,"Our family of 4 stayed here one night on our way to a cruise Jan 1, 2023

We booked a couple of months ago and the only reason I did’t leave a 5-star review is that the cancellation policy isn’t flexible, I suggest you make sure you are aware of this before booking.

Having said that, our expectations were met and exceeded with the great staff including the wonderful Carmen at the front desk who was happy to print our our cruise boarding passes for us and check our luggage behind the counter until we were ready to collect it on our way to the port.  This allowed us to check out at 11am and hang out in South Beach for a couple hours more.

The included breakfast at Havana 1957 restaurant was good as were the beer/margaritas at Oh Mexico next door.  Both were included as part of the resort fee and I consider fair value for the fee of $33 per room ( 2 adults and 2 kids in our case.  We didn’t get a chance to try the pool.

Room and grounds were very clean, comfortable beds and pillows.  We were on the ground floor, and quite near the front desk, which we expected to be loud but it was fine.

I would stay here again, and next time would try to book a room at the front of the hotel with a view of the strip.

There are more and less expensive hotels in south beach, if you want to stay on the strip and have the full experience I would consider this one to be excellent value.",Great Stay at the Penguin!  Jan 2023.

11680856,HOTEL,Nobu Hotel Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/25/92/36/fb/nobu-villa-king.jpg,[],102,$$$$,$339 - $593,hotel,4.0,5.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-531-0000,"4525 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140-3226",customercare@nobuedenroc.com,[],206,[],25.819561,-80.122375,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d11680856-Reviews-Nobu_Hotel_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://miamibeach.nobuhotels.com,#102 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1563,"Having traveled to thousands of hotels in my lifetime, I am quite knowledgeable regarding the services provided by 5 star hotel, and what qualities are necessary for that label. This hotel, unfortunately, is not one. This is in no way a bad hotel, and I would still advise travelers to stay here. However, the price point is overpriced by around $75-100 a night, and in reality it is a solid 4 star facility. The issues listed in this review may not seem like a big deal for most people, and they were not a big deal to us, but as a labeled 5 star hotel, these things matter. 

Airport transportation is not included or even offered prior to your arrival. When you reach the hotel, several staff members will be there to open doors and direct arriving vehicles, but that’s about it. None of these staff members helped us take our luggage out of the car, or carry it up the stairs into the lobby. We were assisted in bringing our luggage up to our room. And on departure the same situation happened in reverse. We received no help with luggage, and when we called down to the desk to ask for luggage assistance the phone continually rang (another common problem we faced in this hotel daily).

Upon check in, we were not offered any warm towels, any water or beverage. We were not given a tour or even an overview of the resort. When we inquired about our complimentary room upgrade as Expedia VIP Gold members, we were told no other rooms were available. We did state that online, other rooms were available to book, so that was untrue, she stated we would have to pay for an upgrade. We were then told to take a left to the elevator to get up to our room, again with no tour or luggage assist. 

When we got up to the room, it was very spacious, clean, well decorated. Lovely room with the Japanese style decor. We were given new bottled waters and nespresso pods daily. Housekeeping did a lovely job of cleaning the room daily. One thing to note, when we checked in, I went to put the waters in the fridge only to notice it was actually a minibar, but was missing several items in different slots. I tried to call downstairs to every number listed on the phone and not a single line answered. On our way out an hour later, we stopped at the desk to inform them the minibar was not stocked, which was fine, but we didn’t want to be charged for the items. She pulled up our account, and we had actually already been charged for them…. Within ONE hour of checking in. They did remove this from our billing but then it was later put back on and had to be removed again, after we asked them to please just come empty the minibar since we don’t need it. We would rather have an empty fridge. They did not empty it rather they brought an extra mini fridge. 

The multiple pools and pool areas are nice, also clean. Kimberly at the Nobu pool, however, was always lovely. Attentive, hard working, and friendly. She was a pleasure. However Not nearly enough servers for each area given the business of the hotel this time of year. They would run out of lounge chair covers by 12pm…. Not even sure how this happens.. Food constantly taking an average of 1.5 hours. Bartenders at the ocean social bar and the other pool bar were not friendly and attentive despite the added service. Before you would order food they would tell you how long the wait for it would be in a manner that sounded almost discouraging. The food, expensive but considering the area is expected, was average. Not good, not bad. 

Perhaps our biggest issue with the hotel, and this we feel is an important issue to note, is that on the beach, lounge chairs are complimentary but the umbrellas are not. Despite being a guest of this supposed 5 star hotel, an umbrella was $35 a day. We picked this hotel because we wanted to be directly on the beach. We paid close to $500 a night at a “5 star hotel” with beach facilities, only to be told we would have to pay every single day for a week, $35 for an umbrella. This unfortunately left us at the pool every day, a complete bummer since we came down to Miami specifically for Miami Beach. Absolutely ridiculous. 

We reviewed our check in as we were emailed to do within the first 24 hours of stay, and no one from management reached out to us. When we inquired we were told they were unavailable. 

Staff here seems to be a bit flustered, it almost functions like the hotel opened last month. Chaotic, unorganized, overwhelmed. 

Would we stay here again? Yes. For this price? No.",Most certainly not a 5 star hotel.

The hotel was doing some construction on a garden area which was very noisy at times. And one morning for an unknown reason we weren’t able to eat at the ocean view restaurant. There was a buffet instead near the pool which was decent, but not what we were hoping for.

I feel a bit weird splashing this out on the internet for complete strangers to read, but it’s relevant to this review…. My partner and I were finally able to take our vacation together in April - it was also the first vacation that I had been able to take in almost a year, due to my mom’s illness and eventual passing. 2023 started as the worst year of my life, no exaggeration, and I was really looking forward to a vacation. 

When we checked in, Sabrina took exceptionally great care of us. I cannot say enough about the level of care and service she provided. When we checked in, she had asked if we were celebrating anything, and I really couldn’t come up with words to say to someone I’d never met before what the trip actually meant to me. Maybe there was a note on the reservation from our previous request to move the dates, or maybe she read something in my face, but either way, she went above and beyond to make our stay special, with a generous upgrade to an astoundingly beautiful room, and a room drop with a very kind note welcoming me back to the property. 

I was already a loyal Nobu Miami guest, but Sabrina’s extra attentive service on this particular trip has really cemented a special kind of love for this place. I’ve been fortunate to stay at some really nice hotels worldwide, but none of them have come close to this level of genuine hospitality. I am truly grateful for the Nobu Miami, and particularly for Sabrina’s empathy and care. Domo arigatou gozaimasu! ",Above and Beyond

11680856,HOTEL,Nobu Hotel Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/25/92/36/fb/nobu-villa-king.jpg,[],102,$$$$,$339 - $593,hotel,4.0,5.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-531-0000,"4525 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140-3226",customercare@nobuedenroc.com,[],206,[],25.819561,-80.122375,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d11680856-Reviews-Nobu_Hotel_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://miamibeach.nobuhotels.com,#102 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1563,"There are some other hotels on Miami beach that may be nicer, but for the price, I think Nobu is my top pick. 

When we arrived, we were greeted by the valet service, which was efficient, though not necessarily anything special or friendly. The shining stars of our trip were Chemise and David who greeted us at check in. They were incredibly polite, warm kind while still being very professional. They upgraded us (without asking) to an amazing room with gorgeous ocean view on the eleventh floor. They gave us all kinds of information about the property and continued to be valuable sources of assistance throughout our stay. They greeted us repeatedly, by name when we ran into them on property, and both called to check on us during our stay. The customer service felt customized and meticulous without being intrusive. They made our experience so wonderful, we extended our stay at the property by a day. All of our interactions with the front desk staff were excellent.

We also visited the spa during our stay. Kris walked us through the whole facility and was extremely kind. She was another stand out during our visit.

We were not without a few hiccups - The phones were rarely answered after long ring times, and when they were most of the time, we were hung up on. Phone service is very poor. Fortunately, we were able to go by the front desk and the staff there was always super helpful. It just would have been nice to not have to go to the front desk every time we needed something. Eventually, they shared a text service they offer, and I would recommend using it for small service requests during your stay. We used it when the battery in our TV remote control died and they dispatched someone right away.

The pool was a little lightly staffed (one waitress for the whole Nobu Pool both days), and the hostess was a bit dishonest when discussing gratuities. As I was closing my tab the first day, I asked if gratuity was included, and she said only 10%, so I tipped more. Upon reviewing my emailed receipt, this was essentially a lie. 20% (maybe a bit more?) was already added to the bill. I could've got it, in fairness, but the iPad in the bright sun made reading the charges difficult, and again, she shouldn't be dishonest. 

The room was beautiful, but there were stains on some of the furniture, though daily housekeeping was immaculate, and our interactions with housekeeping staff we always excellent.

We will stay again, and let David and Chemise know we are coming!",The best value I have found on Miami Beach

606726,HOTEL,Suites on South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/26/97/67/a3/suites-on-south-beach.jpg,[],105,$$$,$158 - $283,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-604-9926,"1330 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4209",sales@suitesonsouthbeach.com,[],19,[],25.784609,-80.13107,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d606726-Reviews-Suites_on_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.suitesonsouthbeach.com/,#105 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,539,"Arriving at the accommodation I wasnt sure where reception was as it looked like a real estate or trip booking office but once sorted that we were in the correct place check in was smooth and efficient.

The room was beyond our expectations, with all the facilities needed from AC to a microwave, a small convenience store is less than 5 minutes walk away to get provisions needed for drinks and a few snacks.  The beds were the most comfortable that we have stayed in for a very long time and were very much appreciated following a fairly chaotic trip from Honduras.  Lots of bathroom freebies and a great shower added to the comfort of of our stay.  

The room had been cleaned to a high standard when we entered it although we were a little frustrated that the beds werent made or towels changed on a daily basis but this could be due to our understanding of the accommodation we booked and not a fault of the hotel.

On check out we were able to store our luggage securely, we were issued with a ticket for our luggage and were able to take advantage of an extra few hours in South Beach before our evening flight.  This was an added bonus and really appreciated.

Staff were friendly and welcoming as well as efficient, it takes good staff to make a hotel great and both could not be faulted.

The location of the hotel was great with easy access to everything we wanted to visit and as its the second road back from the beach it is easily accessible for Ubers or taxis to get around.  

However the location was fairly noisy with the revving of high performance cars and bikes that we presumed had been hired by those on Spring Break.  

Spring Break isnt something we encounter in the UK so it was an experience to say the least.  If you arent familiar with Spring Break and booking to visit the States research the dates so you dont clash with what is really a party week that may spoil your experience.

The noise was less on the second couple of nights stay and so was the amount of young adults out and about so think it was the end of SB which made moving around easier and less frantic. 

We would stay at Suites on South Beach again and would recommend it for anyone looking for a great hotel in a good location.

","First time visit to Miami, in fact first time visit to USA"

Much to our delight, a room was available and we were able to get in right away. The hotel is a little older, we expected that. The room was clean and we did not hear much outside noise (we were in 216). The air conditioners are loud, there are two and they kick on and off alternately all night. There is a kitchenette with a microwave, coffee maker, fridge, and a toaster. Bring a dish rag/towel if you plan on washing your dishes. Breakfast was nice. Continental with a waffle maker. Beach towels were available, as were nice chairs at the beach. This was our first trip to Miami Beach so I don’t have anything to compare it to, but we did feel it was a good value/location, and would stay there again.
Happy to answer any questions you may have!","Good Location with decent amenities, not disappointed."

1231038,HOTEL,Ocean Reef Suites,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/25/08/7e/70/ocean-reef-suites.jpg,[],110,$$$,$182 - $287,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-538-1970,"1130 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4624",info@theoceanreef.com,[],36,[],25.7824,-80.13153,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1231038-Reviews-Ocean_Reef_Suites-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.theoceanreef.com/,#110 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,868,"The 150 airport express bus takes you right to this street and you have to walk a little bit, but SO much cheaper (at my time of travel it was free, but they're stopping that soon). The front door of the hotel is through an Italian restaurant (which is awesome, by the way).
  Pedro checked me in. I extended my trip so I had back to back reservations. Pedro fixed it so I can do everything just once, not have to check in again, or change rooms, which I am forever grateful. (I HATE changing rooms).
    The pictures on here don't do the place justice. The rooms are so nice, big, and comfortable.  I LOVED having a suite. The kitchenette has a fridge, microwave, flatware and plates. So it's good to re-heat food, but not to cook from scratch.
  The area is right in the heart of party central, which can be fun, but I came right at the tail end of spring break. So it can be fun, but also can be dangerous if you're not careful.  I never felt unsafe,
   The hotel is a block away from the beach.  With your room you get 2 lounge chairs. But all the rest (umbrellas, etc.) are extra. The Bouchon Brothers (company that rents the chairs) has a team captain who really acted like he couldn't be bothered with people. His attitude kept me away from getting any more chairs, and just laying on my towel.
   Usually the hotel itself is pretty nice, but late at night (especially on the weekends), you hear drunk people screaming, cars revving their engines, or loud ""thump thump"" music coming from somewhere. If you're looking for a quiet getaway, this area may not be for you. Further north might be your speed.
   Because of the covid, they don't offer daily housekeeping. But if you need something just ask. Which was totally fine by me.
   Most of the hotel noise came from the hallway, which mostly had families with kids. But my last night there, I thought Wrestlemania was going on in the room above me. Constant thumping, stomping on the floor, everything you could think of. I thought it was a family with toddlers, but apparently they were 4 girls, maybe high school or college. Mmmmm, great. 
    Checking out was easy. I had a later flight, so they let me check my bags and walk around until I was able to take the bus back.  
   Despite the spring break craziness, I was able to really enjoy my sweet suite!  Thank you, Pedro, for making my stay comfortable.",Right in the Heart of EVERYTHING!!

240165,HOTEL,Sagamore Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1b/c1/95/22/the-sagamore-hotel-south.jpg,[],107,$$$$,$243 - $447,hotel,4.0,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13055749097,"1671 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139",reservations@sagamorehotel.com,[],101,[],25.791603,-80.12929,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d240165-Reviews-Sagamore_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.sagamoresouthbeach.com/,#107 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2933,"We must have looked at 30 or more hotels for our trip to South Beach and finally settled on The Sagamore. To be honest, we picked it because it had less bad reviews than their competitors. This hotel has much more going for it than that!
   The folks at the front desk regardless of who’s there are always polite, helpful and ready to help where they can. 
   Our room, the ocean side King suite was big enough for a family of four with an 18 and 20 year old. We loved the balcony. 
   At the pool, Jessica will keep you happy and well hydrated. She is ALWAYS running with a smile here and there. She serves guests both at the pool and even on the beach. 
   While on the beach, check out Andre. He mans a kiosk for chairs and towels. He too is ALWAYS smiling, helpful and will do what he can to make your Beach experience wonderful. We saw him take pictures and videos for guests. He’s also great just to talk with and will answer any questions about South Beach.

240165,HOTEL,Sagamore Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1b/c1/95/22/the-sagamore-hotel-south.jpg,[],107,$$$$,$243 - $447,hotel,4.0,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13055749097,"1671 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139",reservations@sagamorehotel.com,[],101,[],25.791603,-80.12929,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d240165-Reviews-Sagamore_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.sagamoresouthbeach.com/,#107 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2933,"5 stars for the lobby bar. Unassuming little gem of a place. They should advertise it more. 

Property is full of colorful art and is kept very clean. Spotless really. Everything was functional. Some areas show a little wear but overall it was a good property. Gym got a little water in it during a heavy rain. 
At check-in we were upgraded to a larger room when i asked for a desk or a table in the room which was wonderful. The room was huge and we spread out. 

Staff was attentive an made sure our stay was great. Barista staff was very friendly. The attendants on the beach and the pool work themselves to the bone. Honestly they were outstanding.  We got some food as well from the kitchen while near the pool and it was great. Just took a little while and they comped it for us because of the wait. 

The one gripe I had was how loud the music was. I wish that was advertised a bit more clearly that there was a DJ at the pool every day. We were looking for a quieter experience. It wasn't the end of the world as our room was far enough away from the pool area but the bass does travel and it would have been nice to lay by the pool in a bit more of a relaxing atmosphere. We booked a bit late and maybe i missed it somewhere but it would be helpful if that was listed on the 'events'.  We checked ahead of time and found nothing. 

Wifi was a bit unreliable which i only noticed because I had to work from the room while my wife explored the area. 

I'd recommend it for a younger crowd looking cut loose to have a great time. The location is awesome and there's a ton of great restaurants and bars nearby. You're right near the beach as well. 
",Nice place to launch a high energy Miami vacation

240165,HOTEL,Sagamore Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1b/c1/95/22/the-sagamore-hotel-south.jpg,[],107,$$$$,$243 - $447,hotel,4.0,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13055749097,"1671 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139",reservations@sagamorehotel.com,[],101,[],25.791603,-80.12929,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d240165-Reviews-Sagamore_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.sagamoresouthbeach.com/,#107 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2933,"We just spent another glorious 9 days at the artsy, elegant Sagamore Hotel, our hands-down, two-thumbs- up favorite place on Miami Beach! As longtime visitors to South Beach, we have stayed in nearly half the hotels there, but were never quite satisfied until we finally found it -- one that actually exceeded our expectations. Our lavish king suite (all of the accommodations are multi-room) was eminently comfortable and remarkably spacious, including a vast living room equipped with a pull-out sofa, full fridge and freezer, and microwave. The large swimming pool was well-heated, inviting, and almost never overcrowded. The location, directly on the beach and only half a block from the outdoor cafes and shops on lively Lincoln Road, could simply not be beat. But best of all -- and the key to truly making our stay a restful delight -- was the incomparably upbeat, kind, and keenly attentive staff, including bartender Vito (what a sweetheart!) at the pool, Delroy at the door, cheery waitress Muchi, Melody at the front desk, and charming young general manager Jordan Gvili, who often greeted us graciously and warmly. We also highly recommend the luscious frozen pina coladas served poolside in fresh coconut shells, although the Sagamore is not a wild singles scene by any means. The other guests were all pleasant and civilized, and families with babies, toddlers, and young children were prevalent and clearly felt welcome on the premises. Add it all together and you have a perfect recipe for a restful stay. We plan to book for same time next year, and could not recommend it more highly. Wish we were still there now!",Our Longtime Favorite Hotel on South Beach!
240165,HOTEL,Sagamore Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1b/c1/95/22/the-sagamore-hotel-south.jpg,[],107,$$$$,$243 - $447,hotel,4.0,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13055749097,"1671 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139",reservations@sagamorehotel.com,[],101,[],25.791603,-80.12929,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d240165-Reviews-Sagamore_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.sagamoresouthbeach.com/,#107 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2933,"We just returned from a four-night stay at The Sagamore, and contrary to having some reservations based on reading previous reviews, our family just did not have as great of an experience as usual at other nearby properties. We were traveling with our toddler son, and required a version of a suite so he'd have a quiet place to sleep that could be closed off, which is why we chose this hotel. One thing that upset me straight away is three days before we were set to arrive, I noticed that the hotel's rates for the exact same suite for the exact same dates were now approx. $1000 cheaper total than when I had reserved a month prior. I emailed back and forth several times with their front desk asking for a simple rate adjustment and they kept giving me the runaround (different answers each time I replied). I was well within the three day requirement to cancel, and when I tried to do so and just re-book at the better rate, they stopped responding. I want to preface this review by saying by and large, the staff here were some of the friendliest I've ever seen in 9 years of going to Miami for trips, ESPECIALLY the bellhops who couldn't have been more amazing (always opening the door, greeting us, being pro-active about getting our bas, being sweet to our son....A+++ to them!). As other have stated, the rooms here look NOTHING like the photos online. I'd be as brazen to say they verge on the line of being down-right unethical in their representation. They must have styled one or two suites for website photos, because what we saw were outdated with little to no color and mismatched, super cheap furniture. The pocket doors to divide the bedroom and living room are frosted glass, so it was hard to make the room dark for our son to sleep. I had called ahead and confirmed to get a crib, so when we got there, Marvin at the front said it was, indeed, in the room. It was not. We were told it was on its way, which didn't happen. We went out and he acted completely surprised it wasn't there, but it was brought up by the time we came back from the pool. Here are a few of our biggest issues with The Sagamore:
1. Wifi is absolutely DREADFUL. In 2023, there is no reason to have such spotty service. Even the servers by the pool agreed it was pitiful as they have issues putting in orders on their handheld devices. It cut in and out constantly, which made getting some work done challenging. Of course, as with other issues, the front desk acted surprised each time it was brought up.
2. I know most people don't care about TV when on vacation, but our unique jobs make some viewing a necessity. Several of the main network channels had no audio the entire time we were there. We brought it up on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday—again, each time, the front desk acted like it was the first time hearing about it. We were even told via text, ""it would be escalated to the owner"" (whatever that means). It was soon clear this is a permanent issue that they just kept passing the buck on. 
3. Thermostat in the room would constantly change on its own. I'd wake up in the middle of the night hot and surprised to see it had gone from 68 preset to 71. 
4. Pool area was not at all enjoyable. The water is warmer than a typical bath. Gross! Not at all relaxing or refreshing. It's also a super tiny pool. Music around the pool was good, though. While they were nice, I did find the employees around the pool to be a tad less proactive than other resorts (you have to put your own towels on the chairs, move the umbrella, actually hunt out a server for food/drink, etc.). However, I will say they have WAY more options for food than other nearby properties. Their cocktails were pretty bad, though. We ordered several and they had no ice in them at all. 
5. We also found it bizarre there was no place to sit and order a hot breakfast each day. Although, later in the week, we noticed the poolside restaurant may have had breakfast, but I'm confused about exactly where/how. 
Again, we 100% would not stay here again. It was WAY overpriced for what you get.",Such a very tired property that looks nothing like online

And would not move me to another room.  Apparently there was no maintenance and staff at night. I don’t think the manager was ever called or if he was, he provided them with no solution. And they had no replacement batteries on site.  Initially, the front desk representative would not even provide me with a ladder or steptool to take out the defective battery. The lift (elevator) was dark, dingy, smelly, filthy & creaky. The corridors equally dark & dingy. Our room was surprisingly clean, but rather small. However, we reported the fact that our shower had no hot water as we left for breakfast. Upon our return at 5pm, nothing had been done about it. We went down to the foyer and reported it again. This time, two different “maintenance guys” were sent. It took them approximately an hour and a half to fix it. Why was this not done whilst we were out ?

217415,HOTEL,Red South Beach Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/95/56/66/exterior.jpg,[],108,$$,$123 - $235,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-531-7742,"3010 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4107",,[],100,[],25.80619,-80.12457,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d217415-Reviews-Red_South_Beach_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://redsouthbeach.com/,#108 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3070,"Strongly advise against booking this hotel. We stayed for five days in February and unfortunately this was the worst hotel we’ve ever stayed in! We didn’t expect anything amazing as the price was lower than other hotels in the area. For the sake of a fair review I’ll make sure to list the positives!

Positives:
- The hotel is a few minutes walk from the beach 
- They provide beach towels and sun loungers on the beach (though this does not include a shade - that costa $25 per day. The guys on the beach take card which was helpful)
- Lourdes in Reception helped us out when we asked to move rooms and she seemed to sympathise with our complaints. 
- We asked to change rooms (cockroach was the final straw) and were lucky there was a free room
- Comfy bed
- Some lovely restaurants just down the road. One Mexican in the Generator hotel (which we looked at online - similar price as Red so check that out if you’re looking for somewhere to stay!) Another called The Tavern, who do lovely food and amazing frozen cocktails! Crema is a short walk away, who do a lovely breakfast! 
- Bus stops, Trolley stops and CitiBikes very close by for easy access to south and north beach. Worth noting that whilst it’s called ‘Red South Beach’, this is definitely mid beach not south! 

Negatives:
- Cockroaches in our room…!
- My husbands wedding ring vanished from our room after he left it on the bedside table. We’re absolutely gutted about this and asked every day for help checking cctv/speaking to cleaning staff and security etc and not a single member of staff was interested in helping us 
- A very loud air con unit in our first room - too noisy so had to turn it off at night which meant sleeping in a very hot room! Our second room had built in aircon which couldn’t be turned off and was still ridiculously noisy. If we didn’t have earplugs, we would’ve had no sleep!
- Rooms not cleaned properly - lots of dust, stains etc and we even found old bits of food from previous guests on the floor 
- The water pressure on the fourth floor made it difficult to wash hands, let alone have a good shower.
- The shower got to lukewarm at best - no hot water 
- Furniture was basically falling apart. Wardrobe door hanging off, random bits of carpet in the hallway 
- The fridge in our second room was tucked into a wardrobe so didn’t have room to open! 
- We asked the hotel to book a taxi for our trip back to the airport. They tried three times and no taxi turned up. We got an Uber to avoid being late for our flight and would advise arranging your own transport! 
- No restaurant. This didn’t bother us as we wouldn’t have dared risk eating in this hotel if they did offer food, but worth knowing if you’re expecting something!
- Every time we spoke to reception, there were other guests making complaints about various things. Sadly, staff seemed to be quite stressed by this and we witnessed staff snapping/shouting at other guests who were making reasonable requests/complaints. ",Strongly advise against staying here!!

217415,HOTEL,Red South Beach Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/95/56/66/exterior.jpg,[],108,$$,$123 - $235,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-531-7742,"3010 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4107",,[],100,[],25.80619,-80.12457,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d217415-Reviews-Red_South_Beach_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://redsouthbeach.com/,#108 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3070,"I made the mistake of booking this hotel. Superficially, it looked like a good hotel at a good price. When I arrived, I was told I had to pay a ""resort fee"" of $13/night. I booked through Beds on Line which is a site for Canadian Travel agents. No where did it mention a ""resort fee"". I was told that the agent should have told me about it. I am the agent! When I got home, I checked all the paperwork and read all the small print. No mention of ""resort fee"". On top of that, there is a notice that ""due to the pandemic"" there will only be maid service if you ask for it. Funny, no maid service is the only pandemic protecol in effect. This hotel is very old and they have done a very superficial update. The hallway is lumpy. They just laid a carpet over the damaged floor! The rooms are tiny and the air conditioning failed both nights I stayed there. When we were trying to check in, the clerk kept walking away from us to microwave food for people walking up to the desk. Don't book tours with them. The tours are the ones you can book on Expedia, they just add $20 to the price. Save the money and book it yourself. There are lots of hotels on Miami Beach. If you want to have an enjoyable vacation, pick a different hotel.","There are lots of hotels on Miami Beach. If you want an enjoyable vacation, pick another hotel."

Very clean, comfortable beds, very modern, great staff. Pool, 2 restaurants on site and a full bar at the entrance. I shared it was our anniversary and they went out of their way to write on our mirror and decorate the room with some balloons! We truly appreciate it! 

Cons: tv didn’t work, checking was confusing (no signs for main lobby), pool floor dirty (lots of hair around the pool-outer area).

Additional info: We are BonVoy members. Price was about $500 per night. We got 2 complimentary drinks,  guacamole and chips card to redeem  at one of the restaurants ( Serena), free coffee  & tea for 2 hrs in the am. Grab and go breakfast for a charge. We wanted to extend our stay to an extra night, but it was $905 for Saturday into Sunday and there was no availability. 

We would def return. You can’t beat the location. Away from the noise but also close enough to walk to (saving lots of money in Ubers). Miami airport is about 35 mins away. Uber is the cheapest way. We paid about $44 one way for 2 adults.",Our first Moxy experience!

If you’re going to Miami, one of the best places to stay is in South Beach. With this hotel, you’re paying for the location and scene. 

Yes, the rooms are small. Don’t go with someone you’re not very comfortable with. But the hotel taco bar is delicious, and the the location is walkable to the beach, boardwalk, and fun bars and restaurants. 

Someone told me that South Beach is getting less safe but it didn’t feel unsafe in this area at all honestly.  

I recommend this hotel if you’re staying by yourself, with someone you feel very comfortable with, especially if you’re planning to spend more time enjoying Miami than in the room itself.

Very convenient to South Beach night life and the airport. The 150 bus from the airport drops you right across the street from the hotel.

I've stayed in several Moxy properties. This one is particularly great. First off, it's in the heart of South Beach, very conveniently located to the beach (1.5 blocks), restaurants, shopping and clubs. The pool deck -- and even moreso -- the roof deck are amazing amenities. The roof deck is huge with multiple seating areas and a plunge pool -- all with ocean views on one side and bay/sunset views on the other. As with all Moxy properties, the rooms aren't huge and don't have a desk or seating area, so if you're coming for business, just be prepared to use one of the many public areas in the hotel. I and my wife - who used to work for Starwood’s Preferred Guest rewards program including mystery shopping hotel brands - 100 percent agree with the other negative reviews on this property.
This is a $700/night hotel with cartoonishly  small rooms and a front desk staff and manager that seem more interested in projecting a cool, hip vibe  then treating their guests with courtesy and kindness. 
If you are a Marriott member accustomed to how other Marriott brands - including the “Trendy  bit still does service right W” - does things - BEWARE! This boutique hotel does should not  be affiliated with the Marriott Bonvoy program - and I checked my family out 3 hours after checking in and movedwork

With limited property availability in South Beachduring New Year’s week- we picked the Moxie which had pictures of a beautiful roof top pool, a good location, and beach access (while not directly on the beach).  I booked the room on points (which was probably mistake #1)

We checked in after a rough travel experience getting there.  The check in process was uncomfortable.  I am used to “Welcome to our property, thank you for your status, insert warm smile here”.  What i got was cold - think dealing with the bouncer at the velvet rope of a NYC  hot spot. Despite the fact there were 3 people at the desk and no one else in line - i was made to feel like i was bothering my check in agent by asking questions about the property.  

After check in we saw the room which was supposed to accommodate 4.  This is the one me of the smallest hotel rooms i have ever been in. There is no desk, no drawers, no chair and no closet.  You have cubbies under the bed (kind of), and a metal thing to put a couple of hangers on.  There is certainly not room for luggage.  And the room like a lot of places in Miami has no heat so it was freezing cold on this Dec day.

We dropped the bags off and decided to go out for lunch. On the way out my wife asked some questions and was treated rudely 
When asking some questions. She ended up speaking with the manager.  At that point i called Marriott, and found another property in South Beach to check in to.  Marriott said they would work with the Moxy to check me out, release the points, and check me in.   The process to release the points from the Moxy took too long and in that > 45 min process we lost the room at the other hotel. So we will spend our vacation in a downtown Miami hotel vs South Beach. While we are disappointed to not be in South Beach, and frustrated at the Moxy for adding insult to injury, our new hotel has great rooms and treats us the way Marriott members should be treated, and we are grateful for that.",Terrible Attitudes and Tiny Rooms at the Moxy South Beach

247105,HOTEL,Clinton Hotel South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/91/5f/4f/exterior.jpg,[],151,$$,$116 - $233,hotel,3.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-938-4040,"825 Washington Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-5802",reservations@clintonsouthbeach.com,[],88,[],25.778782,-80.13307,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d247105-Reviews-Clinton_Hotel_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.clintonsouthbeach.com/?utm_source=local-directories&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=travelclick-localconnect,#151 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,436,"We booked this hotel for 3 nights on Booking.com, where it was advertised as a 4 star hotel. The hotel itself is ok but it is definitely not 4 star.

Location is pretty good and is close enough to walk to South Beach and Ocean Drive. The reception area is pleasant enough and the staff were ok (they were a little blunt but we found a lot of people on Miami Beach to be like that). Beware that they take a $100 deposit for the minibar in your room, which should be returned within 5 working days if you don't use it. We only checked out today so I'm hoping this will be the case.

The pool was the smallest I've ever seen and always seemed to be in the shade (it's in a quadrangle within the hotel). We never went there and spent the days by the beach instead, which is only a few minutes walk away.

The restaurant and bar area looks very nice, but in the 3 days we were there we didn't see one person in there. It was dead!

The rooms were of a good size and the beds were comfy. The finish of the rooms wasn't great and definitely not what you'd see in a 4 star hotel, but everything worked just fine. There is a safe in the room but it is not secured to anything, which made it feel a little less safe! The bathroom was fine and had a decent shower.

If you're looking for somewhere cheaper close to South Beach and you only plan on showering and sleeping there then I would recommend. However, if you want a 4 star hotel and plan on staying there all day to use the pool and bar/restaurant, I would probably avoid.",Ok but definitely not a 4 star hotel

For some reason, I just got used to the fact that in hotels where you pay a thousand dollars per night, the service is of a completely different level. Although it is possible that America has become just a very expensive country, and the pandemic has completely destroyed the local service. 
Next time I will definitely stay at the Ritz on Miami Beach - what if I'm wrong, and chain hotels still maintain a normal level of service.

Just a few interesting examples:
1) We paid for a room with two rooms (so that out child gets a separate room). We  asked to make a bed for the child in advance. Upon arrival we found that in the room for the child there was a folding sofa with an insanely old poor quality mattress, and the bed has not been made. We had to request a bed linen for this bed from the hotel managers twice. And  to make the bed ourselves,  as nobody from the hotel was willing to do it.

2) If you call reception, you simply won't get through. They just don't pick up the phone or even call back. In general, they work at the reception in a very relaxed manner, with a clear misunderstanding that improving the comfort of residents is a clear part of their work. You can see a man near retirement age at one table, and a young lady chatting nicely with him sitting at another table. And at the same time they don't pick up the phone at all.

3) If you want your room to be made up while you are on the beach (when you have a kid, it's a common request), and on the way to the beach you tell the manager downstairs about it (remember, it is impossible to get through by landline), then upon returning in an hour and a half from the beach your room will still not be cleaned . The cleaning lady will appear exactly when she wants to - while she will comment that yes, she received an instruction from the manager, but she was very busy all this time. And this story will repeat itself day after day. And exactly the same cleaning lady will keep saying about the same thing. Even there is a feeling that no one except her can appear and clean your room, when you request it.

4) After you complain to the manager about this, he/she will apologize and offer to agree on a specific time for tomorrow so that this situation does not happen again. You agree on 9.30am (although it can be inconvenient with a child to fix the time in advance). The next day, returning at 10.40am from the beach, your room will still be cleaned.

5) You come to the beach at 9 am. There's a bunch of young guys arranging sunbeds s on the beach. But no one will help you with opening of a sun tent (it is not easy to open - of course I tried it myself), since the beach officially opens at 9.30am in the morning. You will have to remind them of this at least four times.

6) If you received a package from Amazon, it will be delivered to the permanent resident building opposite. And a relaxed manager will gladly inform you about it. But it won’t lift a finger for someone to deliver your package from the building opposite to your building.

7) Yes, checking out of course here at 11 o'clock in the afternoon

Perhaps this is a great hotel for yoga and Pilates. Near the elevator, an extensive list of group activities is displayed on the screen. There is some rare hyperallergenic yoga mat in the room. But it apperently lacks the basic level of service of a five-star hotel.
",Next time I will definitely choose Ritz for this money

538182,HOTEL,Carillon Miami Wellness Resort,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/21/a4/06/60/sunrise-pool.jpg,[],34,$$$$,$382 - $769,hotel,4.5,5.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18335411398,"6801 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33141-3243",miamistayspecialists@carillonhotel.com,[],150,[],25.852982,-80.12018,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d538182-Reviews-Carillon_Miami_Wellness_Resort-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.carillonhotel.com,#34 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1852,"Our experience started off delightful and went downhill from there unfortunately. Check in was quick and the staff was friendly and helpful. Overall impression of the hotel was slightly surprising because the lobby is a little lackluster and dated, but there are nice amenities like a cute cafe, the spa of course, pools and beach front areas. It is also nice to have an adults only pool available by the spa if you'd like some quiet time. 

We were pleased with our room but quickly realized the bedroom circuit board was glitchy and none of the outlets or lights in the bedroom worked. The toilet in the bathroom was also not working and the door didn't close. We contacted the front desk who said they would fix everything so went out to lunch and for a long walk and came back... and things were still not working. We contacted the front desk again who didn't seem to understand the issue and said it had already been fixed (which it was not). We flagged again that we had dinner very soon and we'd prefer to just move rooms. 

We were promised that someone would come up and address the issue. Maintenance came up and reset the circuit breaker and then left. Then we realized every time we plugged anything all of the outlets in the bedroom would go out and it still seemed like the front desk didn't understand the extent of the issue (or how DANGEROUS IT IS!?). Talking sparks flying when you plug in the iron and all the lights going out. They said they would send someone up to move us and after waiting an hour we just went down to the front desk and grabbed keys for the new rooms ourselves. They continually acted like we were a nuisance and asking for something unreasonable when we made it clear we didn't care where our new room was or what it was or if it was facing an alley - we just wanted to be able to plug things in without the lights going out. It was all incredibly incredibly frustrating. 

The restaurant experience inside the hotel was also so disappointing. I was really excited to have food at a restaurant that is all part of a wellness and spa experience, but it was SO lackluster. Totally overpriced for absolutely mediocre food and it felt like nothing was seasoned. I was dousing everything in salt and pepper and hot sauce. My breakfast was possibly the saddest breakfast I've eaten of all the breakfasts I'd had - and I will say this was absolutely our mistake for not reading the reviews and feedback about the restaurant. I will say the food available at the pool and beach was much much more delightful with solid snacks items that actually felt fresh and things seemed delivered quickly. 

The cafe was a delightful amenity that also had ready to go snacks and drinks as well as smoothies, juices, coffee and non coffee drinks as well as sandwiches and such. It was so convenient to have it inside the hotel (and there is a grocery store across the street - which is extra convenient), but every single morning it seemed to have an almost borderline absurd wait. It took me 30 minutes to get my coffee on the first day and the second day I just gave up after waiting and it was faster to walk to a cafe near by - which we should have done in the first place. It just felt so convenient to stumble out of bed grab a coffee before you head out to whatever the activity of the day is. I will say the staff was always incredible nice and apologetic, it just seemed like they could never manage this rush. 

The spa and wellness and fitness services were the absolute highlight of the experience. The gym and studios are all super nice. We did a beach yoga class on our second day and it was so delightful and it seemed like all the other guests were enjoying their fitness classes and activities. The spa is area is accessible by room key so you have access to the various steam and sauna rooms, hot tub and relaxation areas which we were able to use before we had our respective treatments. The spa attendants were lovely and really making an effort to make sure everyone had what they needed. The spa tour was also 10/10. The one issue we faced is that it can get incredibly crowded. When we went to the relaxation area after the treatment check in - every single chair was full and everyone was chatting at full volume - making it completely not relaxing. It's also not fun being in a sauna with a crowd of people. 

The beach and pool amenities were also when things went absolutely awry. We had a day where we woke up particularly early and went wandering to the beach and the first floor pool, but chairs were still stacked and there were no towels around so we went to ask the front desk who said that things aren't typically set up until around 9:30 - hm okay. We went up to the pool by the spa thinking we could then just dash into the spa and dry off while we waited for the beach set up. Luckily there was someone stocking towels and chair covers at the spa pool! We were delighted thinking we could grab these the head down, but the staff member told us we couldn't remove them from the area and the downstairs pool should be set up (news flash it was not - since we just came from here). He seemed absolutely incredulous and acted like we were lying. Not wanting to cause issues or remove the towels (which look the same as all the other towels) we just sat down. Around 9:30 am we went down to the beach to enjoy the sand and the ocean and wandered to all the little booths looking for towels. We saw a staff member setting chairs up and asked if we could also get set up and he said he had just grabbed these from the pool since someone asked him and the beach wasn't set up. This all made me feel absolutely insane. I stomped over to the pool and found a nearby bin of towels and we set our chairs and pitched our umbrellas and then about 30 minutes later saw someone starting to set up the chairs. 

After some beach time we asked if we could extend our check out even by 15 or 30 minutes so we could have just a little bit of extra time to get cleaned up and explained we totally understood if they couldn't do it and then had the most patronizing experience with front desk staff telling us it was super tight and it would be really really hard to do and a burden but maybe they could make it work. I was absolutely baffled because a - sorry we can't extend check out today would have been totally fine? 

Overall an absolutely mediocre hotel experience with a blissful spa experience. The hotel is still dated even though it has been updated and while the rooms were find - I'd frankly even have accepted rooms that were not ""luxury apartments"" and just a standard nice hotel room! I do not understand how this is at an 800-1000 dollar per night price point - it just does not live up to that. I would seriously considering staying at a different hotel and visiting the spa and scheduling some treatments. I do not understand these reviews. I seriously do not. I also would have totally let it all slide if it has just been one thing, or a small thing, or an issue that had been solved, but it felt like every day was another thing that compounded on top of a bunch of other small things. Do not eat at the restaurant - just don't do it - you will be sad and there is so so much good food in Miami.",Spa Experience is Incredible - Hotel is Okay

9458885,HOTEL,Kasa El Paseo Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/10/d3/5c/b6/the-library--v17382268.jpg,[],37,$$,$130 - $229,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,16504513444,"405 Espanola Way, Miami Beach, FL 33139-8152",reservations@kasa.com,[],71,[],25.7871,-80.13201,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d9458885-Reviews-Kasa_El_Paseo_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://kasa.com/properties/kasa-el-paseo-miami-beach?utm_source=Tripadvisor&utm_medium=nonpaid&utm_campaign=BusinessAdvantage&utm_term=VisitHotelWebsiteButton&utm_content=PAS,#37 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,858,"We checked into the hotel on a Wednesday and checked out on Friday. We did not get as much street noise as others may have experienced. The room did not have a balcony and was not on the street side. 

The Good 

Room size 

Space was large.  Had a one bdrm. with two queen beds, living space included vinyl futon, vinyl chair and small kitchen table with two plastic chairs, Floor was painted battleship grey surrounded by a Spanish tile 

Room location 

The hotel is located on a small pedestrian street with a couple of good restaurants. Hotel provides a card to get 15% discounts for restaurants located on the street 

Beach is located 2 blocks away. 

Reasonable price 

Decent price for the area. EST ~$139.00 per night 

The Not so Good 

No Cable TV 

Instructions was provided in the room on how to connect your personal device to the tv, but I was not successful, so we watched TV in the evening gathered around a personal laptop 

Slow Internet access 

The internet was not consistent. Frequently experienced delays while streaming on the laptop 

Furniture outdated -See Room size 

Virtual Check in process 

The hotel provided the address of the main hotel instead of the actual building where I had reserved a room.  After dragging the luggage upstairs (no elevators in the first building) I found an employee who said I was in the wrong building. The person called someone else, and they came over and helped us find the location/room. He provided instruction /and the combination to get the room key and explained how to open the doors. 

The second night we found someone standing outside the door who was also struggling to check in. We showed him how to open the box to get the envelope for the room key.  There are no names on the envelope just numbers.  Nothing is provided by the hotel to let you know which envelopes is associated with each guests The man took all the envelopes out of the box and wandered off to find his family.  If anyone tried to check in, they would have not found their keys.  

Parking 

Valet Parking is $35.00 per day. We opted to park at 16th/Washington Street, two blocks away for $20.00 per night. The parking garage does not offer in and out service like the valet. 

 

What would I do differently. 

 Pay more for a hotel on Ocean Center Drive or Collins that offered parking, tv, internet, front desk  with a slightly better location.",The Good. The  Not So Good. What I would have done differently.

First, location is absolutely perfect. It is in the core of south beach, next to public transportation (going to airport or downtown in about 25 min), two corners away from the beach, directly next to the best restaurants with highest reviews of all south beach. 
Despite the fact it is so close to everything, the rooms are surprizingly quiet, probably because many face some kind of inner courtyard, so you don't hear much from the street. Price are really low compared to the other hotels and this is probably because they removed all unnecessary things that are costly: you don't have a person in the lobby 24 /7, they don't have room service, housekeeping etc. However, if you need anything, they are incredible and will help you - they answer emails within the hour, when you arrive it takes less than 2 min to have the door open to check in, and there are plently of little things that make the stay perfect - you will have earplugs by the bed, all toileteries necessary, access to yoga mats, beach towels, etc. You can go change towels or get extra shampoo and other things yourself. They even give you a card that give you 15% off a dozen of restaurants on Espanola way. I even had a birthday cake in the room upon arrival!!! So their service is still amazing and personalised despite a virtual lobby.
The only thing to know is that their beach club is actually run by another company, and the hotel arranged that you will have two chairs at the beach, but it does not include the umbrella. We did not know this and came with no money to the beach, and because we did not have 20$ to rent the umbrella, the guy from beach club removed the umbrella where we sat, so it was annoying and we would have wanted to know before. It can also become pricey if you just want to spent like one hour in morning and one in the afternoon and do activities in between to have to pay for shade (which is necessary for my poor canadian skin at +40 degrees celcius). Other than that (and beach club is actually run by another company) the stay was absolutely perfect. I recommend this hotel 100% and if i ever come back to Miami beach, it will be at Kasa El Paseo. Thank you for everything!",Amazing stay at Kasa El Paseo

My room was a beautifully appointed  one-bedroom suite with 4 Juliet balconies exposing the excitement on both Espanola Way and Drexel Avenue.  Each balcony is large enough for standing.  I loved the daytime and night life on Espanola Way.  

My suite kitchen was ready to prepare a meal that would please any gastronome.  It included a full refrigerator, stove, sink, microwave and coffee maker w/coffee. However, it didn't get used much due to the great restaurants on Espanola Way.  I did, however, make use of the microwave to heat my daily leftovers.  :)   

The bathroom is nearly as large as the bedroom.  With state of the art fixtures, plenty of towels and toiletries.  The huge closet at the entry of the bathroom housed personal robes.  What a nice touch...

I loved the living room with the leather futon and matching chair surrounding a rounded glass coffee table...perfect for entertaining yourself or your friends that reside locally.  But, I spent most of my time in the bedroom relaxing on the king bed while viewing the large mounted television.  Two balconies are in the bedroom.  I'm telling you, this was a perfect room. 

Did I mention that El Paseo's main building was an art gallery, which converted to a hotel in 2015.  I was amazed at the transformation from gallery to hotel.  

I walked to the beach on Saturday.  It's about 1.5 blocks away.  El Paseo provides beach chairs, complimentary, upon your arrival to the beach.  That was nice.  The beach towels were in the room.  There are so many shops to explore on the walk.  You don't have to leave this area for anything.  Oh, how I can't wait to return.

Khalil,  Daniel and Katherine provided outstanding customer service.  They made sure everything was in place whenever and wherever I needed help or had questions.  From assisting with luggage,  showing me around Espanola Way to calling a cab upon departure.  I felt special.   

I love El Paseo and can't wait to return.  This is the place to be in Miami!  It has just the right amount of sophistication, excitement and entertainment.  It's walking distance to the Convention Center, Jackie Gleason Theater and more, too.",Beauty and the Beach!

9458885,HOTEL,Kasa El Paseo Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/10/d3/5c/b6/the-library--v17382268.jpg,[],37,$$,$130 - $229,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,16504513444,"405 Espanola Way, Miami Beach, FL 33139-8152",reservations@kasa.com,[],71,[],25.7871,-80.13201,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d9458885-Reviews-Kasa_El_Paseo_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://kasa.com/properties/kasa-el-paseo-miami-beach?utm_source=Tripadvisor&utm_medium=nonpaid&utm_campaign=BusinessAdvantage&utm_term=VisitHotelWebsiteButton&utm_content=PAS,#37 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,858,"I have used the El Paseo for self and visiting friends and family frequently in recent years - with great success.  In universally expensive South Beach, it is good value.  It was chosen for this trip - as in the past - for its safe and central location on Espanola Way.

As in the past, the room was spacious, clean and comfortable - the expected lodging satisfier.  The 3rd floor rear was quiet and highly recommended.  The comp coffee in the common sitting room is a very nice touch. And, the front desk staff was very obliging - courteously insistent in bringing our luggage up the 3rd floor in this elevator-less hotel.

But, this stay sadly, had the same flaw as many hotels exhibit in the past year.  The Pandemic Cost-Cutting Syndrome, as I call it, has infected the El Paseo as well.  Not the virus - the business attitude.  Specifically, they are continuing to use the virus as an excuse for NO or severely reduced and erratic room services.

Upon check-in, we were advised that normal room service was not available.  But -fresh towels would ""..be placed in our room each "". This did not happen.  To be fair, a short supply was provided once during our four-night stay.

It has become obvious that this hotel is using the pandemic for an excuse to not hire replacement housekeeping staff following illness and normal attrition losses.  The nation is now past a critical labor shortage.  This hotel, as many around the U.S., is now using the virus as an excuse to curtail labor costs.

All of the 6 daily itemized charges appeared on our final bill: Room-Taxable, Resort fee, State Sales Tax (twice), Tax-Room (twice). But service - Poor.  If they want to cut staff, don't continue to charge double and triple the room price for a weekend stay.","Good lodging value, but even basic room service is non-existent...."

9458885,HOTEL,Kasa El Paseo Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/10/d3/5c/b6/the-library--v17382268.jpg,[],37,$$,$130 - $229,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,16504513444,"405 Espanola Way, Miami Beach, FL 33139-8152",reservations@kasa.com,[],71,[],25.7871,-80.13201,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d9458885-Reviews-Kasa_El_Paseo_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://kasa.com/properties/kasa-el-paseo-miami-beach?utm_source=Tripadvisor&utm_medium=nonpaid&utm_campaign=BusinessAdvantage&utm_term=VisitHotelWebsiteButton&utm_content=PAS,#37 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,858,"Our travel agent booked our trip to Miami and booked the El Paseo for us for 3 nights over new year. Sadly we were very disappointed with what we experienced.  

Upon arrival at the reception, we checked in at the main reception only to be informed that our studio was in a building further down the road -  a bit like a an overspill car park.  

We are a family of 5 including three adult size teenagers. Our agent booked this hotel on the basis that the studio  slept 5-6. On arrival, there were only 2 double beds. We raised this directly  with the hotel and they made up a sofa bed in the very small lounge. This meant that there was nowhere to relax or store clothes. It was also not suitable for purpose as had a large dip down the middle that didn’t make for restful sleep. 

The fully equipped kitchen that was described was absolutely not so. Despite apparently being suitable for 5-6 people, there was cutlery, crockery etc for 4 people. The very small lounge also doubled up as a dining area - with 4 plastic chairs. There wasn’t a knife suitable for cutting and the oven was fitted so close to the wall that the door barely opened. 

There were also only 4 towels and 4 beach towels, another indicator that the room was intended for 4 people. 

The photos of a typical room shown online of the El Paseo are not accurate. Our studio was dark throughout, the windows looked out onto the back of another building and the air conditioning units below our window that ran all night made it very noisy also. 

In terms of location, the El Paseo is good for accessing the beach and Ocean Drive area and Espanola Way is lovely at night. 

The studio was clean and the beds made daily.

Unfortunately our overall experience of their hotel was disappointing.",Disappointing

209406,HOTEL,"The Ritz-Carlton, South Beach",https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/b3/57/27/outdoor-pool.jpg,[],39,$$$$,$448 - $838,hotel,4.5,5.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18446310595,"1 Lincoln Road, Miami Beach, FL 33139-2000",,[],376,[],25.790937,-80.12918,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d209406-Reviews-The_Ritz_Carlton_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.ritzcarlton.com/en/hotels/miami/south-beach,#39 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,716,"Absolutely outstanding visit, even in lousy weather!  We enjoyed the pool and the beach on the two short days of Florida sunshine but even when the weather turned lousy, the hotel provided excellent accommodations.  The room was pristine and gorgeous; the cleaning was meticulous, and our children enjoyed the chocolate with turn down service (the maids were super sweet to the kids - they work extremely hard).  Cuban coffee in the lobby during the downpour was a nice touch, and we enjoyed a glass of champagne at night.  The concierge recommended great rainy day activities that we took advantage of using our rental car - Puttshack, an indoor mini golf venue at Brickell City Centre, shopping at the Shops at Bel Harbour, a tour of Little Havana and The Frost Science Museum (our kids were a little too old for it, but the planetarium show was nice).   Beachside service was outstanding as well.  We were able to enjoy delicious lunch on the beach on a sunny day.

The only disadvantages of our stay have been the cost of the hotel restaurants - for the price, there are better restaurants around.  Instead of spending $45/person at the overpriced buffet, we headed down the road to Paul for authentic French pastries, cafe au lait and flavorful omelets, and we took advantage of exploring the restaurants all around South Beach for dinner.  The hotel concierge made several great recommendations there as well, but we only had two meals on the hotel property.  Both were delicious but extremely expensive.  Lots of homelessness and vagrants all around the property outside, but that's part of being in any big city.

We would definitely return!  ",Excellent vacation stay

The pros - (1) great location, right on beach walk, right in center of great restaurants and nightlife, (2) great pool area, excellent staff working it, excellent food and drink poolside (tuna poke bowl and shrimp aguachile real winners), (3) very comfortable room. We had a poolside balcony room and I really liked this category. The poolside rooms flank out on either side of the pool and are in 3 story building. I hate being in a skyscraper on a beach vacation, I liked being able to use stairs or just short elevator to get to pool area, Also bed insanely comfortable, felt too soft at first, but I fell asleep instantly and woke up refreshed (4) all staff we encountered from valets to front desk to bar staff to pool staff and housekeeping were excellent. 

The con - we were there during spring break and the pool club next door was shockingly loud. It drowned out the music the Ritz was playing poolside starting every day at noon and continued well into night. Now my husband and I sleep just fine through anything so the noise didn't disturb us, but we could hear it and feel vibrations even in our room. I overheard literally dozens of people commenting on the disturbance during our stay - families in the morning at breakfast talking about their kids not being able to sleep, people poolside talking about their room locations and if they could find better placement to avoid the noise, even a few people who were working to get into other Marriott properties. I'd happily return, I can sleep through anything, but if I'd been there back when my kids were younger, I would have had a much different experience.",Right in the middle of everything (the good and the bad)

209406,HOTEL,"The Ritz-Carlton, South Beach",https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/b3/57/27/outdoor-pool.jpg,[],39,$$$$,$448 - $838,hotel,4.5,5.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18446310595,"1 Lincoln Road, Miami Beach, FL 33139-2000",,[],376,[],25.790937,-80.12918,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d209406-Reviews-The_Ritz_Carlton_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.ritzcarlton.com/en/hotels/miami/south-beach,#39 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,716,"What an absolutely unbelievable stay, from start to finish. Though the rooms, shared spaces, pool, beach and amenities are first-rate, the excellent service really takes this hotel to the next level. 

My wife and I took our 16 month old daughter here for her first long-distance vacation. We carefully pored over hotel reviews (e.g. location, amenities, family-friendly, etc.) before finally deciding on the Ritz and we are so glad that we did. 

At check-in, bellhop Xavier brought our daughter a little RC rubber ducky to play with. Veronica at the front desk completely changed the course of entire stay with the incredible room she selected and her exceptional service and courtesy. We were off to a great start. 

The breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious and full of every option imaginable. The hostesses were always pleasant and accommodating every morning. We had a different server each day, but all were so attentive, courteous and, above all else, sweet to our little girl. Thank you all!

The pool area was the highlight of our trip. Plenty of chairs, plenty of umbrellas (though we always made sure to reserve our chairs right after breakfast). Attentive staff clear empty cups, etc. and makes sure you’re never hungry or thirsty. ALL of the staff were great but Alfredo, Jennifer, and Yoni were fantastic. Also Kelly was very helpful each morning to help us grab some chairs. Staff comes around a few times a day with complimentary juices or snacks, and everything on the pool menu was delicious. 

The beach is also wonderful, though we never spent a full day. We’d walk to the shore to collect shells and come back up to the pool a few times a day. Same setup on the beach, though—chairs, umbrellas and staff.

Also a shout out to the valet guys. We never had to wait for our car even once. It usually came around in 10 minutes or less. 

I really cannot recommend this hotel enough. We 100% plan to be back.",Excellent family-friendly hotel with even better service

Even gave us extras to make up for the issues. She was amazing. In general i think the rooms need a big refresh. The room felt very worn in, bathroom needs recaulked, furniture getting dingy, etc. I hope housekeeping gets better training on cleaning the rooms.

The pool is nice, beach area was too although I didn't find the attendants on the beach to be overly friendly.
