1161109,HOTEL,W South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/bd/c5/ab/w-south-beach.jpg,[],19,$$$$,"$664 - $1,146",hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18446310595,"2201 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139",,[],347,[],25.79738,-80.12719,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1161109-Reviews-W_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/miaws-w-south-beach/overview/?scid=45f93f1b-bd77-45c9-8dab-83b6a417f6fe&y_source=1_MTUwMjcyNS03NjktbG9jYXRpb24ud2Vic2l0ZQ%3D%3D,#19 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,5045,"The following email was submitted to the manager of the hotel. I received a ""We're sorry we didn't please you, we take this as a learning experience and hope you'll come back again"" . Just disgraceful....

""I would like to share my experience and EXTREME displeasure with my stay at W South Beach. But I will start with the highlights...

Our room was lovely and our W Insider Ashley Klassen was wonderful. She took the time to come to our room with an extra robe and slippers for our 3rd guest (though I had called the hotel ahead and requested that with a concierge prior to our arrival) and made us feel very welcomed and offered her assistance for anything.

On our final day (2/23) we finally received some excellent service from the three female servers at the pool area; they were sweet and attentive.

Now, on to EVERYTHING else that did go wrong:

On Tuesday morning we reserved our chairs at the pool. We ventured down to the beach for about an hour to stand at the ocean and sit for a drink. When we returned my bag was missing as were some of our belongings, and people were in our chairs. I panicked and immediately went to the service stand where I saw my bag jammed onto a shelf and was told, ""You only have 45 minutes until we give you chairs to other guests"". First of all, this is a policy I have never encountered at any of the other fine hotels I have stayed at in my MANY visits to South Beach. Second, this policy was never explained to us after we received our chairs and proceeded to tip our attendants. Third, Not only were some of my belongings missing, they were later found underneath the chairs, but I had also acquired other items that were not even mine within my bag. I was then told that I could be placed on a waiting list for chairs as they became available. I was livid. I immediately went to the front  desk inside and asked for a manager. I spoke with a Rachel who accompanied me to the pool and was able to secure our chairs. She stated that someone should have told us of the policy and that this would be a training issue they would reinforce. (In the subsequent days none of the attendants who set up our chairs informed us, so nothing implemented as expressed). At this point it had been an hour process, an hour of my vacation time spent in a stressful situation. Just extremely unsettling.

The pool and beach service was the absolute worst I have ever encountered. The pool personnel stand around in groups by the towel check- in or back at the left corner of the bar area and talk and ignore guests. The food and beverage service takes forever from chairs, forever to find someone to take your order, and forever to receive your order, if at all. On one of the afternoons we gave up on our guac and drinks ever arriving after and hour and canceled the order, and the beach service was pathetic. On Tuesday we gave up on the pool chairs and sat at the table at the bar area waiting for service, alerting the girl who sat us several times that we needed a server, after 30 minutes we gave up. Horrendous.

The elevator situation is absurd. On most days 3/4 elevators were out of service. I spoke with a frequent business traveler guest who said it has been like that for months of his stays there.

And this brings me to check out day. I awoke yesterday to see a bill for $9,000  in my email, knowing in my head that this was about $4-5,000 more than it should have been. I jumped out of bed at 7:00am and ran to the front desk. The gentlemen reviewed his records and told me that when I checked in I never presented my AAA card for the discounted rate I had booked, so instead of being charged $1,450 a night I was just converted to a $2,250 a night charge. Now mind you, I was never asked to present my AAA card, as is usually the case with other hotels. So instead of asking me for this it was just converted?? I was assured at that time that it would be changed back to the original rate and that I would receive a credit confirmation within the 1/2 hour. An hour came and went and I went back to the front desk and asked for a manager. I was greeted by a Ruth who attempted to change the rate and show me the breakdown of fees, which from the print outs was completely confusing. She printed out a new copy which I knew was still too much and then she said ""Oh , I forgot to change the last day"". Another printout. Then I asked if the taxes had also been modified. Another reprint. At this point in time I am still seeing over $5,000 in charges pending when in reality as I figured out, and your manager confirmed, should only be $1,300 after my initial payment in October of $4,500. I am watching my Capital One card online to see if those ""pending charges"" become charges at which time I will put an immediate dispute and hold on them. So this was how I spent my last morning of my vacation, at your understaffed front desk, begging for my bill to be accurate.""

I returned to my room in tears from the stress of our stay that had just been piling on from one issue to the next. 
Absolutely the WORST experience in South Beach ever. I travel A LOT. DO NOT STAY HERE.",Heed the latest reviews - DO NOT STAY HERE

There is a huge JPM convention on the beach directly to the right of the property. Additionally, the hotel seemed to be performing repairs to the balconies, resulting in loud drilling throughout the day. 

Pros:
- Very large room
- Nice shower with Davines products 
- Great location 

Cons:
- No one at check-in told us anything about the property, daily events and offerings, etc. Due to this, we missed out on a lot.
- Our room was dirty upon entry. It hadn’t been vacuumed or mopped. There was a finger nail clipping on the bathroom counter, a contact lense by the bed on the floor and hair throughout the bathroom that was not mine. Vacuuming is so simple. I don’t understand how this was missed.
- Our first day at the pool, approximately 15 minutes after being sat, a pool attendant told us we needed to move to a different area due to an event that was taking place later that they needed to setup for. He said it was originally scheduled for 5pm but they pushed the time up to 3pm. Embarrassed to be delivering this request, he told me this sort of thing happens all the time. Basically, myself and half the guests at the pool had to pack up and relocate.
-  That evening at 1am, the hotel had two workers power wash the entire pool deck until 3am. It awoke me from my sleep and kept me up. This should have been scheduled for 8 or 9pm or early early morning. Common sense was not used here. I complained to the front desk the next morning and he acted annoyed by me. He said they wouldn’t be doing it again the following night but if they did, to let him know! Gee thanksssss!
- Food & bev is overpriced and subpar at best
- You could tell that nearly everyone that worked for this property generally didn’t care about their guests’ experience. It was a mix between a snobby and ignorant attitude. 

I couldn’t overlook almost of these items if I didn’t pay close $2k for two nights.","Nice property, great location but poor customer service"

It was on a side street, but well isolated (we are very sensitive to noise, but we did not change room - just used earplugs as we always do everywhere). The room is sufficiently large, very clean. Personnel is responsive and cleaning ladies are very efficient. No carpet (béton ciré), so no allergies and no dirt. The bed is good (a bit hard, but that's ok). The shower and toilets are separated. TV is large and channels are diversified and good. The amenities in the room are good and well thought. We did not use the swimming pool as the beach is 5-7 mn on foot. The hotel has a deal to get chairs (parasol is an extra charge). We did not use the complimentary light breakfast, nor the bar or restaurant, but this looked very nice and welcoming. Overall, a great experience - I would definitely go again to this hotel. I just hope that future guests will not ruin it, as often happens.",Excellent on all counts

Greystone is a well situated art deco boutique hotel in the heart of South Beach. Many restaurants, bars in the vicinity and just one block from an amazing beach. Less than 10 minute walk to Ocean Drive. There is a pool and a nice rooftop setting but the pool is quite small and basically just for wading. 

Where the hotel really excels is its employees. The staff in the cafe so bubbly and positive first thing in the morning, every day. The front desk staff, particularly Jordan and Leah were nothing short of amazing throughout our stay. No matter the issue it was always a “can do” attitude with a smile on their faces. Always so accommodating and it was much appreciated. It’s one of the reason we will be staying at Greystone again on our next visit!!

For those complaining of noise, you’re in South Beach, it comes with the vibrant territory and it’s part of the charm. I have to note though that we had a room on th second floor overlooking the street and fond the noise to never be a problem.

275378,HOTEL,Hotel Greystone,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/9a/0a/a1/greystone-hotel-south.jpg,[],18,$$$,$224 - $351,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17867517790,"1920 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-1912",info@greystonemiamibeach.com,[],91,[],25.79558,-80.12948,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d275378-Reviews-Hotel_Greystone-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://greystonehotel.com,#18 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,205,"My spouse and I stayed at the Greystone over Christmas as we were visiting family and we had a lovely time, although we wish we had a chance to enjoy the hotel's excellent beach & pool amenities. 

We arrived around 2 AM after some flight delays, and Castro gave us an extremely warm welcome. He was very helpful and polite, and the team had made sure to reserve our nice King room facing north towards 20th Street. 

The view and room were great. The only knocks were that there was only a bench against the wall and no armchair or ancillary seating, but for this price and in this type of hotel, it's hot a huge surprise or downside. I liked that they had Malin & Goetz products in the shower with big pump bottles - no wasteful plastic use! I enjoyed the use of Google Chromecast on the hotel TV's seamlessly watching Netflix from my iPhone on the big screen. 

The rooftop pool deck was awesome, and the beach access is easy enough. Just cross Collins and walk to the water - less than 5 minutes. What you save being across the street from the beach can be spent on expensive drinks on the sand! 

We could have done with an extra set of towels in the room - two bath towels isn't really enough for two adults with long hair, so we wish they could have stocked us up a bit more as a default. Also, they give you two complementary bottles of boxed water on check-in, but I feel as though these should be re-stocked every day, and not an additional charge. If we're paying for four nights, why do we get the same amount of water as someone staying for only one? Seems odd....but I'm fine with tap anyway. 

Lastly, big shout out to Tonya who takes care of the complimentary coffee and pastries in the morning. She's chipper, friendly, and the coffee is excellent! Even better than coffee we would up paying for at the 1 Hotel nearby one morning. 

Overall - 5 stars. Great hotel in a great location with friendly staff and modern/stylish rooms!",Excellent Value in Miami Beach

Basic comes in the form of a tiny room outside the main building that is frankly a pretty long walk from the lobby and up and down several sets of stairs; in the room, there is no closet to speak of, but a curtain (not a door) hung over a tiny area facing the bedroom; no desk at all, no work area, no chair or any seating area, no tissues to be found anywhere, TV service that is extremely minimal in terms of channel choices (and quality); when I asked for access to a private space in the hotel with a chair to conduct a business meeting by Zoom on one occasion, I was told the hotel has no private space in which I could sit, not a single conference room or even an office where I could sit and have a Zoom meeting.  This is basic accommodations in the extreme.  On the plus side, the staff was generally pretty friendly, especially the daytime staff, with staff service trailing off in the later hours; and the restaurant was beautiful and quite good, although wildly overpriced.  On the whole, pretty disappointing.",Pretty disappointing

The front desk staff was outstanding. Very helpful and accommodating. 
Check-in/ Check-out  - 5 stars 
AM Coffee - 5 Stars 
Rooms - Clean and Kept - 5 Stars 
Bar Downstairs - Bartenders knowledgable and fun 
CVS - on the corner across the Street 
Beach - One short block distance
Lincoln Road - Restaurants short walking distance 
Bodega around the corner where you can get affordable take out / authentic Latin food  (lunch) 
I've been to Miami over 50 times over the years and this was one of my favs. 
I also love that this is an adults only hotel. 
Also, know ahead of time that you will be paying for resort fees. Don't give the front desk a hard time for something you should know when booking.

And then we woke up to news of a shooting down the street. 503070,HOTEL,Setai Hotel Miami,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/6b/56/c7/k-hayden-setai-room-penthouse.jpg,[],15,$$$$,"$692 - $1,231",hotel,4.5,5.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13057280484,"2001 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139",reservations@thesetaihotel.com,[],140,[],25.795895,-80.128845,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d503070-Reviews-Setai_Hotel_Miami-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.thesetaihotels.com/en-us/hotels/miami-beach?utm_medium=organic&utm_source=yext&utm_campaign=website-link,#15 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1678,"I always wanted to check out this place but wondered if it would be too shishi and minimalist for my taste, so I finally stayed for a night to find out and was surprised at how good it actually was. The doorman might have been alerted to my visit because i had a suite, but he escorted me to the room and gave me a tour of the property. The hotel's website does not do justice to the property. It's really gorgeous with a beautiful interior courtyard and pool area. 
I was upgraded to the Tower rooms and I had a ocenview suite which had good wow factor. It's a good thing because I saw the room i was supposed to have in the Art Deco building and this was much better. You got to like having a bathtub right in front of your bed, and the toilet and shower on opposite sides of the room if you are in the Art Deco building with a suite, and the ""partial ocean views"" are pretty awful compared to the Tower. I liked having the northern view rather than the southern view. From 31 floors up, Miami Beach looking north from this point is beautiful.
The gym is good; it's not heavy on various exercise stations and is more toward free weights but it does have a technogym multi-use station and all the amenities you need in a gym. The spa was quite nice with relaxation and treatment rooms on the 18th floor of the tower building although I was disappointed that there was no steam room in the spa; I don't like saunas and I do like a steam room to hydrate after a flight. I hope they'll have one in their new digs when they finish the new spa.
I really liked the pool concept with 3 pools at various temperatures. I'd say most people were in the middle one at 85 degrees. It did not feel crowded at the pool which was laid out in a way to give you a tranquil feeling and they did not have loud music at the pool which was good. They have a nice setup at the beach and the beach is very nice with a lifeguard station not far away at the public beach next door.
Dinner at the Ocean Grill was excellent; I ordered lots of food and everything was great. Breakfast buffet was also excellent and probably one of the best in town; you could stay here several days and be happy with breakfast. Some of the items on the buffet were cold but if you told a waiter they would offer to bring you a hot version of that dish.
My suite was furnished really nicely with lots of places to sit; i liked the balcony furniture; air conditioning, shower and other things worked well. There were chocolates, fruits and champagne upon arrival in the room. I did not like their choice of bathroom sinks having found it hard to wash your face without sticking it and your hands into the small sink. I also did not like the bed duvets; they were hot to the touch and it was not a great night's sleep for me with them on me. I really think that in a good hotel you want a top sheet on your bed and shouldn't have to ask for it at midnight when you realize you're hot in your bed. This is definitely something they ought to consider.
The hotel was good about giving me a later checkout due to a delayed flight and I found staff uniformly friendly and professional. Elevators worked pretty well getting me to the 31st floor of the tower; they put in enough elevators to handle lots of guests and there was a convention there at the time. That's important because a lot of hotels fail on this.
Definitely this place is pricey; my suite was $2,200 for the night (although a week later without the convention being in town the rate would be considerably lower) and a salad with a piece of fish on it for lunch was $45 with tax and mandatory 20% tip at the Ocean Grill. But they are delivering good quality and the hotel has a resort feeling for a Miami Beach hotel and getting to 20th and Collins is actually a relatively convenient part of town to reach and there are plenty of amenities on the street close to the hotel. You can also walk a few blocks and reach Lincoln Road or the Convention Center. 
There are two-bedroom suites here for families in the tower section and I would return with mine. The Setai also has a hotel in Tel Aviv; i wonder if it is as good. 

 
",Surprisingly excellent -- tower rooms recommended

503070,HOTEL,Setai Hotel Miami,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/6b/56/c7/k-hayden-setai-room-penthouse.jpg,[],15,$$$$,"$692 - $1,231",hotel,4.5,5.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13057280484,"2001 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139",reservations@thesetaihotel.com,[],140,[],25.795895,-80.128845,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d503070-Reviews-Setai_Hotel_Miami-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.thesetaihotels.com/en-us/hotels/miami-beach?utm_medium=organic&utm_source=yext&utm_campaign=website-link,#15 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,1678,"We stayed at the Setai for the last 4 nights of a 10 day trip to Florida. We hoped/expected it would be the best of the 3 hotels we stayed at (given the higher cost to stay) and we were not let down. We stayed in their ‘cheapest’ room which was a city view suite. Even at this level the room was fantastic….a large room with booth type seating under the 3  large windows, a super-king size bed that was extremely comfortable and a his and hers bathroom with a fantastic rainfall shower, well separated sinks and storage areas. All other amenities as expected, safe, fully stocked minibar, robes, ample storage and wardrobe space, flip flops and slippers. We felt very much at home.

Downstairs, the atmosphere is one of dark luxury, you know you’re experiencing the best there is. The Jaya restaurant is extraordinary….booths and tables around a low level pool with lit trees, looks amazing at night. It gets very busy at weekends as it’s the restaurant to go to so book when you arrive. 

Outside, they have another fabulous restaurant called the Ocean Grill which overlooks the beach and serves more casual fare but served in a high end way….great for lunch or dinner as the sun goes down. 

They have 3 pools, all at different temperatures and depths…a cool deep one at 75 degrees, a warmer one at chest height depth at 85 degrees and a low height 90 degree one which is ideal for kids. The service around the pool is excellent, beers, cocktails and snacks. All towels are provided and laid out for you, plenty of umbrellas as required, it’s paradise on earth.

Any downsides, no, not really…..it’s not cheap but you aren’t there for a bargain. For a visiting Brit the food is exquisite but pricey, $200 for breakfast (for us both), $300 for lunch and $400+ for dinner depending on wine choices. But you’ll feel like a million dollars.

Thanks to all the staff for their unlimited help. If you’ve looking for the best hotel in Miami, book the Setai, you’ll have a great time","A romantic stay at the Setai, Miami"

115181,HOTEL,Impala Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/66/ae/a6/grand-suite.jpg,[],60,$$,$108 - $186,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-673-2021,"1228 Collins Ave., Miami Beach, FL 33139-4607",,[],1,[],25.783422,-80.13135,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d115181-Reviews-Impala_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://miamihotelresort.com/impala-hotel/,#60 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,927,"I do not take giving a one star lightly.  If you are the owner of this property, I hope you find my comments helpful and can improve on them.

Without a car, I would probably give this a review of 4 or 5 stars.  First the good:

The room itself is very nice.  We have a suite, with 2 very big TVs, although we are not there to watch TV.  The bed is very comfortable, and the room has central air/heat so it's very quiet.  What our room lacks in views is made up for by being very quiet in a very bustling South Miami Beach neighborhood. Yes, I like quiet rooms.

A couple dings:  The couch was broken (I think it's a hide-a-bed mechanism), and the ice maker was broken. The shower is very nice, but confusing to operate.  

Now getting to the bad, the parking:

It's valet parking, 30 minutes off site and $30/day.  Once we got the hang of it, it was OK, you just plan for not coming and going frequently. Tt takes 30 minutes advance notice to get the car. Valet staff was polite and professional

Note:  that after talking to people, the city of Miami Beach put up special barricades that blocked off any turns on or off Collins St this year for spring break. This is not something they do every year.  Not the best, but it gets worse.

Yesterday we came back to the hotel about 6 pm, and the streets were barricaded. We drove by the one parking spot for valet and there was a car in it.  My wife called the hotel to get instructions and no one answered the phone.  It took 45 minutes to get off Collins Ave. We found a place to eat a couple miles away in a non-barricaded part of the city and had a nice meal. My wife was shaking she was so mad. I dropped my wife off on the next block and she went in to the hotel.
 
We are now getting to the 1 star part.  My wife found out that the hotel clerk parked in the one and only valet parting spot, and told my wife that we should part on 16th street, 4 blocks away!  This clerk needs to be fired,.  The next clerk got the first clerk to leave and we finally parked in the valet spot 4 hours late after our first attempt.

We found out later that we could have parted in any of the valet parking spots for the restaurant or hotels on the block.  It's the same Valet service.  It would have been nice to be told that up front.

Part 2 of the 1 star rating:  The second clerk, that was so helpful, gave me the phone number of the property management company, so I could tell them about our experience.  I tried calling that number and the mail box was full.  Major red flag.  So I'm sharing my experience here. You need to train and screen your staff.  I would be very reluctant to stay at any of their properties.",!

The staff was nice and friendly, and I was especially grateful for the stash of sunblock they had behind the desk (my stay was short so I was grateful to be able to borrow a bottle for the day). They also allow you to borrow beach towels. 
The hotel is no frills but clean with a very charming decor. In this COVID world there was some slight wear and tear, but nothing that would deter me from staying there again. I personally didn't go to Miami to sit around my hotel all day :). 
There's only 17 rooms or so across two floors and there is no elevator, so be sure to ask for the ground floor if you have an issue with stairs. Also, probably due to staff shortages, there was no one on site at the Impala. 85050,HOTEL,Shelborne South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1a/16/13/16/shelborne-south-beach.jpg,[],54,$$$$,$246 - $399,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-531-1271,"1801 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-7414",shelbornereservations@meninhospitality.com,[],200,[],25.794188,-80.129105,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d85050-Reviews-Shelborne_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.shelborne.com/,#54 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,4719,"Shelborne Hotel in South Beach Miami is conveniently located approximately 35 minutes away from either Miami or Fort Lat Lauderdale airports. It was opened in 1940 and last November the owner spend $20 million dollars to renovate the place. Reading bad reviews made me nervous because at the time of booking, the hotel had solid ratings and price was not too outrages. I am not sure who was upset and why these reviews were written but they are not accurate. We stayed for 5 days and during that time not once we have experienced anyone being rude to customers. At the desk we were checked immediately and when I inquired on the upgrade we were offered a nice ocean view room on the high floor. The room was not big but it had a nice size walking closet – much bigger than you would get at any standard hotel. The room had a coffee maker and a small size fridge. With an upgrade we got an ocean view with a balcony and enjoyed having a cup of coffee in the morning. The room was not renovated but it was clean and it is important to us to stay in the clean room. You do have to ask for your room to be cleaned. It is a new normal in most of the hotels post pandemic, so please do not anticipate the cleaning service if you did not ask for it.
There is a coffee shop at the lobby of the hotel and you can get food/drinks at the pool. The pool area was always nicely looked after and we never had to wait to get towels neither at the pool or at the beach area. The hotel offers several poolside cabanas and they were booked by guests daily. There is a place by the pool that you can play ping pong or cornhole, or simply enjoy the sun. The access to the beach is gated and opens with a room key. At night the hotel locks the door with an access to the beach. I would assume for the security reasons. In some of the reviews I read about the construction site next door being unbearably loud, so yes there is a construction going on and some noise associated with it, but it was not distractive at all. We saw a lot of families with children at the pool, so I would say it is a family friendly resort.
There is not much going on at the hotel at night, even though they had some music playing at the lobby. I think most people like to go and explore the city of Miami and everything that Collins Avenue has to offer. There are so many good places to eat and enjoy the nightlife in the walking destination.
We rented a car at the airport, so we used the parking/valet services. I was provided with the QR code which was very convenient; by accessing a code the request for your car is being made and the text message send you stating that the request was received, approximate time of waiting and the next text will arrive in about 2 minutes before the car is ready. The waiting period was never more than 15 minutes or so.

 ",Miami hotel on South Beach

85050,HOTEL,Shelborne South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1a/16/13/16/shelborne-south-beach.jpg,[],54,$$$$,$246 - $399,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-531-1271,"1801 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-7414",shelbornereservations@meninhospitality.com,[],200,[],25.794188,-80.129105,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d85050-Reviews-Shelborne_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.shelborne.com/,#54 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,4719,"Review based on a one-night stay pre cruise and two nights post cruise.

The location is great, the lobby and other public spaces are attractive and well maintained. The bar serves great wine and food, and Jasmine was friendly and very pleasant to speak to. The Mojitos at the pool bar are fantastic.

On our pre cruise night we arrived late due to a delay to our flight from London. Check in was ok but not particularly welcoming.  We had booked a partial sea view room which turned out to be an accessible room on the 9th floor.  The safe box was not working, there was no door on the bathroom and overall, the room was shabby, dirty and in need of a makeover.

For our post cruise stay we had an issue at check in as they had no record of our reservation which was made at the same time as our first night reservation.  As a result, we had a 5-hour delay in being “granted” a room despite the numerous emails and conversations between the hotel front desk, reservations team and our TA in the UK. Overall, the reception staff were very poor and unhelpful and need service skills training. No apologies were given for their error or our inconvenience, no courtesy refreshments were offered but they appeared to make up for this by upgrading us to a sea view balcony room. This came with no chairs on the balcony and was overlooking the Aircon units.  Despite the view of the sea the room again was very shabby and dirty. The carpet and furniture were stained but at least safe was working this time. It all felt very nasty but at least we had a place to stay.

Despite the Shelborne being recommended to us I would not recommend until a number of failings in staff training and maintenance/cleaning of rooms is addressed.
",Two stars at the best

85050,HOTEL,Shelborne South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1a/16/13/16/shelborne-south-beach.jpg,[],54,$$$$,$246 - $399,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-531-1271,"1801 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-7414",shelbornereservations@meninhospitality.com,[],200,[],25.794188,-80.129105,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d85050-Reviews-Shelborne_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.shelborne.com/,#54 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,4719,"We vacation in Florida every January, splitting our time between staying with family and at the Shelborne. We have stayed there 4x within the last 5 years (skipping one year in SoBe). We just love the cozy feeling of the boutique hotel which provides us with everything we need and want for a relaxing and enjoyable vacation. From the valet to the front desk to the wait staff at breakfast and pool to the housekeeping personnel, everyone makes it their mission to make your stay as successful as possible. The food at breakfast and available poolside is delicious and plentiful. Special shout outs and appreciation to hotel managers Armando, Ibrahim, Delisa and Andrea (front desk) and Anthony at the poolside restaurant. 

In addition, the Shelborne is the perfect location for SoBe as you are walking distance to Lincoln Road and a short uber drive to Espanola Way Wynwood (if you're in town on the weekends, check out Smorgasbord Miami) and Miami city centre. 

We just left this morning and are already looking forward to our return January 2024!",The place to stay in SoBe

Very quick walk to the beach, and beautiful modern rooms. There were three staff members this most recent stay who were warm, caring, helpful and willing to go out of their way. 

There isn't an obvious ice machine, and over text, I inquired about how to get ice, and the next thing I know, they are delivering it to my door!

 Both of my visits this past year, unfortunately, had neighbors with voices and TV from 3-5am each night, but it's not the fault of the mgmt.  They offer noise machines and earplugs I understand. The construction of the rooms, connecting door and wall materials lends to this, but I do not blame the wonderful people who work there. Even a TV at moderate volume next door will be very audible to the neighboring room. This is minor when considering all the positives of this hotel.

The lobby of this hotel is decorated just adorably with vintage decor, furniture, and beautiful original floors. The tables, microwave area, coffee/tea/water in lobby are wonderful.

The staff is so welcoming and gracious as well in even allowing guests who have checked out to return and use the lobby and restrooms for changing. Everything in the rooms and lobby is always very clean and lovely.

1699819,HOTEL,Dream South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/6b/32/0c/aerial-image.jpg,[],22,$$$,$169 - $287,hotel,4.5,3.5,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-673-4747,"1111 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4604",reservations@dreamsouthbeach.com,[],107,[],25.782179,-80.131226,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1699819-Reviews-Dream_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.dreamhotels.com/south-beach,#22 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3271,"We (adult couple) stayed at Dream for 3 nights over new years eve for our 20th anniversary and had truly the worst experience we've ever had in a hotel (we have travelled extensively).

Arrived late in evening on Fri 30th Jan and started out okay, staff were friendly and we were quickly checked in. We did have to circle the block a few times in order to stop and unload the car/hand off to the valet but understandable on a Friday in South Beach.
The receptionist explained the hotel has two buildings and we had been allocated a room in the other building (separated from reception by a courtyard) and directly above a club/bar called Naked Taco. We did extensive research before booking and nowhere on the website does it mention that some of the rooms are above a club/bar - something which would definitely have prevented me from booking but we tred to be open minded and hoped for some solid sound proofing.
The room was directly above the club/bar and two rooms down from the doubles doors which allowed access to the club/bar - these doors were never locked, meaning bar patrons were able to wander freely in the hotel corridors.
Everything was dreadful - the bed was agonising to sleep on, the sliding doors to the toilet did not meet with a gap of approx 1 inch (a rubber bumper was missing) and the biggest issues, noise was AWFUL. Absolutely zero sound proofing.
The club/bar was very loud and the noise carried on until approx. 3 am despite advertising closing at 1am. Thought we may finally get some sleep then, even with the painful bed but at 5am, banging started in the bar below again as the staff started arriving for the breakfast service - in no way were they quiet, lots of banging and crashing!! To add insult to injury, one of the staff wandered out of the afore mentioned double doors and had a long, loud conversation on her phone - walking up and down outside the room.
After this terrible night, we approached reception indicating our dissatisfaction - given that this room cost $500 per night. The receptionist gave a half hearted apology and moved our room to the main building. No compensation was offered but mainly we were keen to just have a good nights sleep, we were not looking for ""extras"". We packed up our cases and moved over, hoping for the best as the toilet doors closed and the bed did not feel like it was made from barb wire.
Later that day after a shower and nap - trying to recuperate from the sleepless night and prepare for new years eve (also our anniversary), we woke to a water leak from the air conditioning. The leak was a HUGE puddle, right in the middle room - completely unavoidable and very slippery. Maintenance took one look and said it could not be quickly resolved and we'd need to move room again. This would be our 3rd room in less than 24 hours.
Reception did not bother to apologise this time and tried to give us a room in the other building again, we refused and we was given a room on the 2nd floor of the main building where we were met with familiar issues....the toilet doors did not close and the bed was actively painful.
We asked to speak to a manager and was advised someone would be available in the morning. We had another sleepless night courtesy of the terrible bed and incessant noise from the bar - it did not close until 330/4am. 
On new years day, we were able to speak to a manager (Antz Augustin) who was the only shining star of this horror show. He was very understanding and apologetic and was (rightly) appalled at the receptionist attitude and our treatment/experience. He did his best to mitigate our experience and compensate us but sadly there is no way to make up for no sleep, stress, panful backs and lost time packing/moving rooms on our special new years anniversary. We arrived here blissed out from a week in Jamaica and left haggard and baggy eye'd.
I do expect a certain amount of noise during the evening/nights in South Beach, we have visited before. However, researching hotels with good reviews and no noise complaints should have led to a decent stay and it did not.  
The hotel website should be transparent about the potential for being issued a room directly above a bar and definitely should consider some sound proofing between floor and the halls. 
The hotel appears to have valued style over substance, it looks quite cool in the pics online but in real life was small and dark. The clock/phone charger did not work, no room to unpack etc. a myriad of small issues.
On reflection, there are a large number of positive 5* reviews for this hotel which are written by ""users"" who never wrote a review before or after the ones completed for Dream South Beach. Users who do not have a genuine photo (vague landscape pics typically), name drop specific staff, the same ones mentioned over and over. You may note, the reviews written by genuine, regular users do not routinely name drop in the way. Interesting I think and a little suspicious. 
Anyhoo, we would recommend you select any other hotel and give this one a miss - unless you want to have zero sleep and a bad back.",Worst hotel we have ever stayed in.....

- First when we arrived, we were charged extra mandatory 20 USD fee for every night to cover beach towels and beach chairs that we were not interested in buying, we were forced to pay the resort fee to be able to check in.

- Internet is for additional 20 USD per night! We stayed for 10 days which added 200 USD additional cost to an already awfully overpriced hotel.

- Shower - did not have pressure at all. Impossible to wash long hair. It was dripping down from the shower head. No hand-hold shower. 

- The corridor smelled like weed or cat piss.

- No water boiler in the room - no coffee, no tea in the morning.

- The worst was loud music that came from their own nightclub on the first floor. 
The glasses on the windows were vibrating and it felt like we were in the middle of the nightclub with our bed. We measured the loudness of the music in silence and it was 54 dB. That was unbearable! We wanted to move out and contacted the hotel manager but he could not care less, they had our money and they just half laughingly said that ""you already got the quietest room"". It ruined literally our stay in Miami. 

- We were handed out an info sheet that said that beach towels can be used only starting from 9 o'clock. So we waited until 9AM to take our morning swim in the sea, we get to beach and the guys on the beach said, ""No no, towels are available only from 10 AM"". We swam and went back to the hotel soaking wet, letting them know that even the simplest information they cannot get straight. 

- We went to the beach another day to use the chairs that we were forced to pay 20 USD for every single day, and then we get to know that we only chairs, the umbrella that was above every chair couple was not included and that cost additional 21 USD. What a rip-off.

- Questionable fire safety - the green EXIT sign was literally pointing into our room (nr 264)

- The light from the corridor was shining straight into our bed because the door had big cap around the door frame. We heard everything from other rooms. 

- You cannot go to the restroom in peace because it sounds like your partner is right next to you. Closing slide doors are just to cover the sight into the toilet. No privacy.

- The elevator in the hotel takes 15 seconds to move from 1st floor to 2nd floor. It is officially the slowest elevator I have ever experienced.

- The pictures about this hotel are a scam - it is unbelievable that it is allowed. It was an old worn down smelly hotel but those pictures left totally different impression. 

It is honestly the worst hotel experience I've ever had and I have traveled through the US, Europe, and recently Thailand.","Horrible, horrible, horrible!"

1699819,HOTEL,Dream South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/6b/32/0c/aerial-image.jpg,[],22,$$$,$169 - $287,hotel,4.5,3.5,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-673-4747,"1111 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4604",reservations@dreamsouthbeach.com,[],107,[],25.782179,-80.131226,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1699819-Reviews-Dream_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.dreamhotels.com/south-beach,#22 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3271,"We stayed for one night at Dream South Beach and it was a nice, boutique hotel. Rooms were cozy, with a large, comfortable bed, steam shower, and nice decorations. The room was clean, as were the hallways and lobby. There happened to be some kind of water leak on the ground floor that reached to the lobby when we stayed, but that, I'd assume, was a one-time issue. The issue we had with the room was the shower - the water was steaming hot regardless of how the knob was turned. We asked the front desk how to remedy the situation and they only suggested to press the button on the shower knob (which did not work). We had to take showers lasting only a few seconds before the water became dangerously hot. Also, be sure to be good friends with the folks you travel with - the bathroom and shower doors were glass and completely transparent.

Parking was expensive - the two parking lots nearby charged $20 per day (October 2022 prices), with the hotel's valet charging $42/day. Luckily, everything was in walking distance (GREAT location!), so we never had to move our car once it was in the lot. Beach chairs and towels were included in the 'resort fee', but umbrellas were an extra charge ($20). All of these extra (hidden?) fees made it a bit frustrating. We did not purchase the breakfast; instead, we went around the corner to a nice bakery (Bettant Bakery & Cafe).",Boutique hotel in a perfect location

I have been in Miami South Beach many times and this time I would like to stay away from crowded areas at Ocean Drive, where Kimpton Palomare South Beach is a great alternative. It is a really cosy hotel with amazing service located in a relaxing area  The hotel has a great pool at the rooftop. I will com back to the Kimpton Palomar South Beach next time, I visit Miami South Beach.

Review:
I stayed 5 night at Kimpton Palomar South Beach in February. The hotel is located 30-40 min away from the airport. An Uber is about USD 30 and taxi can easy become much more expensive. 

The hotel is located in the western part of the South Beach, but the hotel offers a free shuttle to the beach, if you wanna go there. The neighborhood is very relaxing, where you also find some local restaurants, bars and shops. Lincoln Avenue is only 10 min walk away. 

I arrived late at the hotel due to a delayed flight, so the room was ready. The checkin was fast and service was really great. I also got a late check out due to a very late flight from Miami.

I have booked a room with a small balcony - the room was really great. From the balcony I had a amazing view at the sea between South Beach and Miami. The room was clean and the size of the room was ok. 

At Kimpton hotels they always has a social hour in the afternoon, where the serve red and white wine. Not many used this option at Palomar South Beach. It was possible to be seated outside in the sun during the social hour - which is from 5 pm to 6 pm.

I had breakfast at the restaurant every day. The food was really good and the service was amazing. There was 2 menus for breakfast - one for weekday and one for weekends. The restaurant was really busy in the weekend. 

The pool is located at the top of the hotel. in the afternoon there was a lot of people in and around the pool. The pool bar was open some days. When the poolbar was closed you can order food and drinks via your mobilephone, but it did not work really well. 

You can borrow bikes at the hotel. ",Great alternative to Ocean Drive.

Our room was a good size, spotlessly clean and had everything that we required.  We loved the wine hour and used it both nights of our stay. 

The location was great, close to the Lincoln Road Mall and several good restaurants.  The harbour was close by and we enjoyed walking around there.
Although we didn’t use it ourselves, we kept seeing the hotel shuttle running guests around, it seemed to run throughout the day and we were told it would take us anywhere on Miami Beach.

The hotels Italian restaurant looked very nice but was very quiet on both the nights we stayed so we ate elsewhere.  For breakfast we popped to Trader Joes which was very close by and bought juice, fruit etc and got coffee from the hotel lobby and ate on our balcony.

My only complaint was that I had paid extra for a ‘Harbour View Room’.  I quite expected to see boats bobbing about in the harbour from our balcony.  Instead our room overlooked a storage facility.  I immediately went down and queried this with reception, expecting them to say that we had been given the wrong room, only to be told that no, that was a harbour facing room.  The room did face the harbour but the view was obliterated by two large apartment blocks.  Very misleading.
Since otherwise we were happy with the room, I let it go, but if you are expecting to see the harbour, I wouldn’t bother paying extra for one of these rooms because you won’t see it.   They are however possibly a bit quieter than the ones on the other side of the building, and the balcony was useful.

Other than that, we had a very enjoyable stay.","Lovely stay, but no view of the harbour."

19625115,HOTEL,Kimpton Hotel Palomar South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-m/1280/1c/41/09/33/rooftop-pool.jpg,[],23,$$$,$218 - $365,hotel,4.5,0.0,,17866282000,"1750 Alton Road, Miami Beach, FL 33139",info@hotelpalomar-southbeach.com,[],96,[],25.792938,-80.14148,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d19625115-Reviews-Kimpton_Hotel_Palomar_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.ihg.com/kimptonhotels/hotels/us/en/hotel-palomar-south-beach-fl/miapa/hoteldetail?cm_mmc=YextLocal-_-KI-_-US-_-MIAPA,#23 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,387,"I used IHG points to book a getaway with my honorary nieces, an 11-year-old and a 21-year-old. I’m 42, and we all three found many things to love! 

The great
The housekeeping staff was excellent—room was not only exquisitely clean each day, but they did sweet touches like spread our blanket from home on the bed with the younger girl’s stuffed animal resting cutely on the pillow. 

Daytime desk staff were great and the restaurant is, hands-down, the best hotel/hotel-adjacent restaurant I’ve ever dined at, both in terms of food and service. Free bikes? Yes, please! 

The roof was more expansive than photos indicated; we would’ve spent more daytime there if we’d not been out being tourists! There are a variety of places to lounge, and we had a great afternoon nap on one of the large bed loungers.

The not-terrible-but-not-great
None of the roof games were available to play, and no one was up there to ask. We’d looked forward to getting a poolside meal but, when we scanned the QR code for the menu, everything was marked “unavailable.” 

Though reviews indicate the pool is “heated,” I’d interpret that more as “pool is not ice water, but you’d never call it ‘warm.’” 

I wish we’d been offered bike helmets and a bike map (different from a regular map), but I only thought of that once we were biking and I realized it was a more daunting ride than I’d expected. 

Getting in and out of the hotel on foot is a little confusing. We ended up walking through the parking garage, either bc it was the only way or the better way wasn’t at all clear. 

Though the front desk gave us a map and explained where to get beach access, a color photo of the correct area showing the beach setup and umbrella colors would be great (even if it’s just kept at the desk) and clearer instructions would’ve been helpful. 
The hall carpet was seriously stained on our floor, which was okay but not typical of a Kimpton. 

Night and very early morning desk staff were not as helpful or knowledgeable as daytime staff. Not bad, just not as open, confident, and competent-seeming. 

We had to wake at 4am Sunday so on Saturday night asked if we could get a coffee maker in the room. They delivered, but we realized at 4am Sunday that only decaf packets were available. 

Overall I would stay there again, but only if I got a great deal again! It may be because we were there off-season, but the hotel just didn’t seem 100% up to speed on all it’s advertised perks.","Cool building, rad roof, & free bikes!"

So bad that we checked out after one night.

The front desk was friendly enough, but the real stand out was the incredibly helpful bellman.   The hallways are tight and there are a lot of turns (and not good signs) to the rooms and elevators so we were glad he helped us with our bags.  There was also an area where housekeeping was gathered with their carts all talking and laughing, they seemed like we were a burden trying to get to our room.

Upon entering the room we were very disappointed with our view, we had paid for a ""King Premium Terrace Sunset Harbour view"".  There is no water view and it was VERY LOUD.  We were on the side of a very busy intersection and it was endless hour honking at 6pm. When we went to the patio we found one of the outdoor chairs to be covered in dirt and mold.  So we went to the phone to call about switching it out and discovered our room didn't work.  

We went to the front desk and told them about our disappointment.  They tried to switch our room, but nothing was comparable to what we had paid for so we agreed that while we went to dinner that they would change out the chair. and the manager would call while we were getting ready (which he never did).

There is a restaurant next door, where you get 15% off your meal if you are a hotel guest.  We were very surprised that the Breakfast amenity is not offered to Diamond Elites and substituted with 1k points (which is not comparable).  It's tiresome hearing from the front desk things like ""we are a newer property"" and  ""because of the pandemic"".  We stay at a lot of Kimpton properties and have not encountered this before.  And on top of that this property has a steep amenity fee.  

In general the management at this property is lacking.  Staff is not properly trained (which I don't blame on them as they were nice), but they don't know to to handle customer service issues.  The rooms are not sound proof and are very deceiving in the pictures in regards to furniture and views you get.

Later the manager said he had called our room but couldn't reach us.  Of course he couldn't reach us, we were in a room with a phone that didn't work.  He had my email and cell number.  After we checked out, approx. 3 days later he reached out to me via email to ""discuss what had happened"".  

There are too many hotels in Miami that are in better locations, provide strong customer service, and do not lie to guests.","A very disappointing stay, do not recommend"

They also have bikes, beach chairs, and beach towels for your daily use. It’s also 2 blocks away from the Metro Bus Route #150 (9th & Washington) which is a $5 round trip cost per person from the airport. The a/c kept the room cool. The mini fridge in the room kept my beverages chilled. The pool is nice and private. Your room card will allow you to obtain 10-20% off in discounts for various restaurants near the hotel. The location is ideal, in the heart of the Art Deco district, right across the street from the Beach and Lummi Park.  A wide range of restaurants are just a few steps away.  Ocean Drive is bustling and, especially on the weekend, it's noisy, but even though our room was right at the front of the hotel, it was quiet and well-soundproofed.  Additionally, the rooms are spotlessly clean and well-maintained.

This is an older hotel and we did have some issues with the hot water in our original room.  However, Lily resolved the issue quickly by moving us to an even nicer room with a better view (and lots of hot water).  She even sent us a bottle of sparkling wine to thank us for our patience.  All the front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful, but Lily was a real stand-out and sincerely cared that guests were comfortable and happy.

Overall, I would definitely recommend The Breakwater for anyone wanting to stay in the classic Art Deco South Beach area.",An excellent choice in the heart of the Art Deco District

1787787,HOTEL,Hotel Breakwater South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/13/64/35/20/hotel-exterior.jpg,[],15,$$$,$164 - $276,hotel,4.0,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13056142963,"940 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-5013",info@breakwatersouthbeach.com,[],99,[],25.77999,-80.13108,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1787787-Reviews-Hotel_Breakwater_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://breakwatersouthbeach.com,#15 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,3136,"I only give this hotel a 2 because of the friendliness of the front desk staff and the location to the beach. 

Lily and Kai were excellent! Lily got us into our room earlier than the 4 p.m. check-in and they helped us find our way around. She pointed us to MamaMia, gelato and coffee place connected to hotel, which was lovely! Even the night front desk staff was great, though I never got their names. And as far as location, it was close to the beach, which is what we wanted. They offered us towels and chairs if we wanted them and we were at the beach in 5 minutes.

That is where the good experience stopped. 
1) I reserved an ocean view room (more expensive) and you can see the picture from our room, you have to look to see about an inch of the ocean. I paid extra for an ocean view and I might as well have saved my money.
2) The room carpet was damp when we got into the room. Okay, we figured they just cleaned it and it wasn't dry yet. Over that day and the next, the room got mustier and mustier and smelled of mold. It was almost unbearable when we left the 3rd morning. When they did clean, they could have something about that.
3) The maids took one of our hand towels and didn't replace it or the ""free coffee"" pods in the room. We drank 2 and they didn't replace them, nor did they replace the condiment package (creamer & sugar). 
4) The cleaning crew arrived at 9:30 a.m. on the day of our checkout - checkout is at 11!

All in all, I would definitely not stay there again.
Elizabeth C",Don't waste your money

Lily at the front desk was wonderful!  A pleasure when checking out bikes, asking for beach towels, etc. Nice Ocean View if requested when booking.  Recommended that if you rent the bikes, then use them for your bike ride and return them as you will be charged if they are stolen.  Or take your own bike lock if you plan to use them for shopping or all day.
The Breakwater and Edison hotels are one U-shaped building and you might stay in one or the other, but both are very nicely centralized to anything you wish to do in Miami Beach.  One block away there was a restaurant that played very loud music every second they were open, but in the room, you could barely hear the music.  Everything was pretty silent by midnight, so if you can last that long you will be fine.  At least in the Edison, where we stayed with a room facing Ocean Drive, the room was very soundproof and quiet.  Worth the price given the location and amenities.",Great location!

We asked about the beach club and we're given two towels as they only had two left and were informed that there is no beach club as such. 
The room lifting and broken newer floor, appalling bathroom with constantly running toilet, jammed door that couldn't be shut, rusted fittings. And the hand sink (about 9"" round) hanging off the wall. Absolutely no hanging space as it was taken up by other stuff

256986,HOTEL,Loews Miami Beach Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/c4/81/43/loews-miami-exterior.jpg,[],57,$$$$,$329 - $616,hotel,4.0,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18778767871,"1601 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-3112",loewshotelsreservations@loewshotels.com,[],790,[],25.789436,-80.12973,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d256986-Reviews-Loews_Miami_Beach_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.loewshotels.com/miami-beach,#57 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,10276,"We had booked a room through Fine Hotels and Resorts which according to our confirmation had a balcony and we were eligible for an upgrade (upon availability of course)
During the check in we were told that there were no upgrades available from the next level, so if we wanted an upgrade there was one 2 levels above so we could pay the difference, we didn't do that since we were not planning to spend much time in the hotel anyways, check-in was pretty basic and rushed.
We reached our room and noticed that we didn't even have the balcony we had booked, no balcony at all, so we were actually downgraded at no cost from our original booking.
We got right away a text message from the concierge team asking if we needed anything and if everything was ok, ""great service"" we thought, it seemed like the perfect opportunity to inquire about our downgrade, we replied right away, the response came hours later that they were sorry and were going to look into it, the response never came even after a second message being sent later during the day...
Pool was extremely crowded and the fake grass around the pool heats up a lot, one of the disadvantages of using plastic around the pool, so we had to run to our chairs burning our feet or leaving our sandals next to hundreds of other sandals around the pool.
Pool service was good and drinks were ok but pricy.
We instead had a couple drinks in the bar of the hotel which is a really nice bar with great drinks, shoutout to Louis and Luciano.

Overall the only good thing was the bar of the hotel also it is not a bad location but its definitely not the service I was expecting to have from a Loews hotel.","Bad service, good location."
256986,HOTEL,Loews Miami Beach Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/c4/81/43/loews-miami-exterior.jpg,[],57,$$$$,$329 - $616,hotel,4.0,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18778767871,"1601 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-3112",loewshotelsreservations@loewshotels.com,[],790,[],25.789436,-80.12973,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d256986-Reviews-Loews_Miami_Beach_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.loewshotels.com/miami-beach,#57 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,10276,"Stay away unless you are ok with 

1. A front desk staff that is just pushing through the LONG line of guests in this 790-room hotel, not caring about accuracy.  

2. A hotel that doesn't care about the comfort of its guests. In the pool area, they pack you in right against the next chair with zero space between while in the mean time, they have taken away pool space for TWO pay areas They have clearly decided to sacrifice the comfort of the guests for additional revenue streams. This is all despite the fact in the two days I was there, a Tuesday and Wednesday the entire Pay section right up against the pool, not a single person rented anything but the pool area was absolutely packed. On our 1st day there we couldn't find a seat until 245pm. On the 2nd day, we went to the pool at 730am to grab seats before breakfast to only have a few available. When we got back 45 minutes later every chair was claimed. It was well into the late afternoon that chairs started to become available.

3. This hotel doesn't provide VIP service in any way. I booked my stay through the American Express Fine Hotel and Resorts program. I admit that from my first interaction with the hotel, I had very high hopes. The day before my stay, I received a call from the VIP department introducing themselves to me and asking if there was anything I may need during the stay. My only ask was for 2 additional pillows. They were not in the room, so that was ignored. I was also asked what time I would be arriving, I said approximately 11 am. Part of the Amex program is a 12-noon check-in when available. I use this program a lot, although most are available at the time there are times when rarely we wait at the most an hour. This room wasn't ready until about 215pm even after checking back at the desk at 1pm, 130pm, and 2pm. I understand this is not a guaranteed part of the program but waiting almost 3 hours is disappointing.

4. A staff that is not thorough in making sure of accuracy or handling situations. Upon arriving, I gave my credit card for incidentals and was given a packet to use the facilities. I went to the pool, and ordered a drink at the pool. Upon giving my name for payment I was told I was not in the system. The bartender called the front desk who also couldn't find me! He hung up and said I am not registered. A guest sitting at the bar even made a very embarrassing comment towards me. The bartender then called the manager over who repeated with the exact same result, I couldn't be found. Once again feeling embarrassed I had no other form of payment since my wallet was in my luggage at the bell desk I said I would go to the front desk. It turned out my name was listed by my middle initial for some reason. Regardless of how that happened the front desk at check in should have had that and corrected but once again I was just one of a long line of people to move through. It took them almost 20 minutes to find a manager to correct may name.

5. Don’t expect high level of housekeeping service. The hotel doesn't have a turn down service, this is the 1st hotel in the Fine Hotel and Resorts program I have ever stayed in that didn't have this service. 

There are so many hotel options in the Miami area if after reading this you are for some reason on the fence I will mention a couple of positive points. 

The food quality was above expectations. The hotel itself was extremely clean and well-maintained. These really are the only positives I can say about the hotel. 

In no way is this hotel living up to the expectations of a Fine Hotel and Resort.  

",Stay away unless you are ok with a really bad experience!

The restaurant staff, Beach and pool staff, valet, bellman, and restaurant staff are great.  Everyone made us feel like family and was very helpful, courteous, and accommodating. The bad: Housekeeping staff, condition of rooms, lack of attention to cleanliness and minor details.  We stayed 3 nights overall and the housekeeping service rating was 2 out of 5 from my perspective.  Coffee was not refilled each day, charged for overpriced water bottles we didn't use, the adequate number of towels and toiletries were not provided (had to ask for them), the room was not made after calling housekeeping 3 times in a single day, the refrigerator/mini bar was not clean (sticky residue maybe from the previous guest). My observation and interaction with  3-4 of them did not impress. I felt like I was a burden to them if I asked anything. And when we complained about the above-mentioned items to two different people the response was plain and simple... We're sorry. That's it?... That statement needs to be followed up by...We're sorry and we're going to make it right for you by x,y,z.  We're going to take your feedback and make sure we improve. None of that happened. That's the difference between a good experience and a great experience.  Unfortunately, Lowes Miami you fell short.",Good but not great.

256986,HOTEL,Loews Miami Beach Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/c4/81/43/loews-miami-exterior.jpg,[],57,$$$$,$329 - $616,hotel,4.0,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,18778767871,"1601 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-3112",loewshotelsreservations@loewshotels.com,[],790,[],25.789436,-80.12973,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d256986-Reviews-Loews_Miami_Beach_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.loewshotels.com/miami-beach,#57 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,10276,"Fantastic location on South Beach, close to the bars and restaurants of Ocean Road and the shopping hub of Lincoln Road. It is certainly one of the most attractive hotels along this famous beach. Very handy if you want to watch the sunrise or sunset (see photo). Room on a high floor was spacious and immaculately clean. View was lovely, a partial view of the beach (see photo), but a highlight was a small balcony where you could gaze at the flocks of pelicans flying by (see photo). 
Dislikes? Very few. The coffee bar in the lobby of the hotel could be improved, bland coffee and slow service. The hotel could really profit by having a much better coffee bar as all the nearby Starbucks had massive queues all the time especially in the mornings.

Loews have their own beach area, towels and chairs are free, you only pay for umbrellas if needed. Beach staff are very helpful. There is also a large pool at the hotel. Generally it was exceptionally busy, and unfortunately there was the selfish habit of people leaving private items on sun loungers so they could keep them all day though they frequently left the area, people will be people. Would be good if the hotel had a policy to cut down on this type of selfish behaviour.

In these large hotel chains the lifts (elevators) can often be slow or too few for the large occupancy, but this was not the case here.

Overall, we had an enjoyable stay and would recommend the hotel with enthusiasm. ",Enjoying the High Life at Loews

Perfect for spring break getaway with teens. 

POOL
Had sunblock and aloe available. Plenty of water stations. There were plenty of kids in the pool throwing balls and on floats/noodles. You can also buy balls at the pool shop. Pool was kept super clean and food at Nautilus was great. Rec room was also good for playing video games per my son. 

I did notice chairs by pool did need to be reserved early in order to get. By 8am they were mostly taken. 

ROOM
We were given a lovely upgrade -1657 Ocean Front. We had originally booked ocean view double on a high floor but to our surprised it was ocean front. 
We did not get to check in early as requested which wasn’t too fun. Room was ready after 4. The beds are super comfortable and linens clean and soft. Service was fast when asking for fridge/microwave to be brought up. Housekeeping was always working and friendly. 
*at check-in, we weren’t told about any of the services offered or restaurants on site. I am still not sure what time the pool closes. 

Quick walk to Starbucks on the cement path and Ocean Drive. However-highly recommend Miami Joe in the hotel. Amazing pastries and the pop tart was so good! Preston’s was also great for breakfast and pastries/muffins seems to be the same as Miami Joes. Buffet for kids was $19 each. 

BEACH
as mentioned chairs are not close to water but plenty of them and the beach is maintained and clean. However we experienced tons of seaweed. We took advantage of the free banana boat ride and boogie boards. Waves were small but water is clear minus seaweed. 

Overall this hotel felt like a resort and was super happy it was kid friendly. Can’t wait to return.",Great Family- Friendly hotel with a resort feel

1188680,HOTEL,The Fritz Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/07/7d/a9/d8/lobby--v5676217.jpg,[],56,$$$,$168 - $293,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17862506681,"524 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6616",info@thefritzhotel.com,[],22,[],25.775229,-80.13195,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1188680-Reviews-The_Fritz_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.thefritzhotel.com,#56 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,580,"This hotel was a surprise ... I had business meetings in Miami Beach and wanted to stay in the heart of the action. I have a business and don't always like to be spendy to stay at top of the line places when doing deals, which may not yield results. I knew I'd be dropping some coin at Joe's Stone Crab (within walking distance) so I wanted a budget hotel. There were a few about a mile away but I wanted one close enough to walk to the restaurants and beach.

First off ... this is not a luxury hotel. It's a basic hotel. But it's cleaner and the rooms are bigger than a lot of the Art Deco dumps which look great on the outside but are grimy on the inside. If money was no object, let's be honest, I'm not staying here. But on a budget, this is better than what you'll find at 90% of other SOBE hotels.

The staff is great here. Both the manager and the owner are fantastic. I was upgraded upon arrival to a full apartment from a studio suite. The manager gave me both keys to check out each room before committing to one, which I actually loved! I travel a lot and often 'upgrades' sometimes don't always mean a better room.

The studio suite I booked, I expected to be tiny and closet-sized as it was the lowest category of room. It was  actually 350 sq feet and bigger than my room at the airport Marriott I stayed in the night before! The apartment was ridiculously big. 750 square feet and perfect to walk around in.

The rooms had bad views and I had to keep the drapes closed the whole time, or neighbors could stare in ... but who cares because the beach was literally across the street! Trust me ... if you are in Miami, you want to stay in this area. At night, you can walk up and down the strip to many bars and restaurants and it always feels safe. Other parts of Miami ... good luck to you.

The hotel has valet parking. (Which is rare in SOBE) It's $35, which is about on par. I paid $30 for a spothero at the Target garage, which was a short walk (10 min.) or 5-6 blocks. I did so because the hotel resets the clock at 11 a.m. and I got a few extra hours of beach time by using spothero. A lot of hotels had no valet parking, so it's nice if you are in a rush.

The top floor pool was completely closed during my stay, which is a bummer. However, when open, this will be a huge perk to guests. Although the pool is small the views of the ocean are great ... and there would be a lot of space to relax. I can't wait to return when the pool is open. Overall, I was very surprised and pleased with my stay here and would stay again. Budget hotels can be scary in Miami. This one is a gem.",Surprise gem in the heart of it all!

1188680,HOTEL,The Fritz Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/07/7d/a9/d8/lobby--v5676217.jpg,[],56,$$$,$168 - $293,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17862506681,"524 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6616",info@thefritzhotel.com,[],22,[],25.775229,-80.13195,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1188680-Reviews-The_Fritz_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.thefritzhotel.com,#56 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,580,"We had high hopes but were terribly misled by the glowing reviews. I simply can't reconcile those reviews with our unfortunate experience. It is painfully obvious that ownership has set up their staff to fail, leaving them with no resources, inadequate amenities, and not nearly enough staff.

We booked an Ocean View Suite with 1 bedroom and kitchen and looked forward to our winter getaway vacation. Upon checking in, however, our hearts instantly dropped. 

The ""cleaning"" standards for housekeeping are disturbingly low. The kitchen, dishes, utensils, bathroom, floors, and seating furniture were all uncleaned. No sweeping, no vacuuming, certainly no scouring...not even light wiping with a damp rag. If you want more details, you can view photos or read extended comments further below.

There were also lots of unkempt things about the room's functionality (e.g. no hangers in the closets, several light bulbs burned out, a single dead cockroach on the floor of the closet, top sheets with cigarette burns used for fitted sheets, key cards needed to be reprogrammed five times the first night alone, etc.) In all, it painted a rather clear picture that no one was really paying any level of attention to details and had never considered the guest experience as a whole.

There was a single employee on staff from 5pm until the next morning. She was nice, but spoke only limited english. She really tried to help, but was obviously overwhelmed, under-supplied, under-trained, unsupported and simply unable to provide even basic customer service. I honestly felt sorry for her. The other dissatisfied guests (and there were a lot of them!) were far less patient or understanding of her constraints.

In short, The Frtiz Hotel was just an all-around disappointment and it almost ruined our trip to South Beach. The only reason I'm giving two stars is that the manager was genuinely concerned for our negative experience and sympathetic to our situation. He helped us find a hotel more to our liking, allowed us out of the rest of our reservation, and was extremely apologetic for the divergent standards in cleanliness. I do wish him well and hope that ownership supplies him with adequate staff and resources to make the hotel more successful in the future.

EXTENDED DETAILS:

The bathroom tub had hair stuck on the wall and half-used soap and shampoo left on the tile. Only one washcloth and two towels were provided; the towels were wet but had been refolded and hung to imply ""unused,"" which they were not. Both the sink and tub drains were clogged with debris and there was only 1/2 roll of toilet paper to be found.

The kitchen was an utter disgrace. Everything was grimy and unwashed: cabinets, coffeemaker, utensils, dishes, fridge handle, you name it. No dish soap, no dish rag (we had to use our only washcloth) no paper towels, no cleaning supplies at all. Only odds and ends for dishes and cutlery: a single spoon, two salad forks, two different sized bowls, mismatched pots and lids, etc. Certainly not even close to a basically functional kitchen. Coffee grounds (no filter) were left in the coffee maker. Huge smears of chocolate (we hope) on a ""clean"" coffee cup in the cupboard...you get the idea.

When we asked the desk worker for clean (and dry) towels she said there were none and we'd have to wait until tomorrow. When I asked for some coat hangers, she came back with a mixture of random ones she had hastily grabbed from down in the restaurant. When we asked for a vacuum to clean our floors, she said the hotel didn't have one. And upon our return from the store (to buy cleaning supplies), our key cards stopped working and I stood waiting at the empty lobby desk for 45 minutes (along with four other guests) until she returned from wherever she was.

Living room chairs were covered in stains and felt grimy and/or sticky. Floor was unswept and so walking with bare feet picked up grit and debris with each step. We spent the first night of our vacation scrubbing cabinets, cleaning sinks and dishes, scouring the disgusting tub, replacing lightbulbs, and searching the hotel's linen closets for a new set of unstained sheets.

There's really So much more, but I think I've painted an adequate picture already demonstrating The Fritz Hotel simply isn't ready to adequately serve its guests.",Room was truly disgusting. Woefully understaffed and under-maintained.

The clarity was amazing. Our balcony view of the pool and ocean made our daily views spectacular. Beach access steps away from the pool. Pool area was fantastic and the addition of the poolside bar(currently under construction) will be quite convenient, although expect the drink prices to be quite high as they add gratuity and resort fees to every drink purchased. Breakfast available daily but was pricey as well. Resort fees cover pool/beach towels, ice buckets, and 2 beach chairs and umbrella. Don’t let the smaller sized building fool you into thinking it isn’t a nice place. It allows more personalized service! Plus it is part of the Wyndham hotel group so you add points with each stay. We were pleasantly surprised with the ease of our last minute trip reservation and highly recommended this facility.",MB TRADEMARK is a wonderful facility
