558250,HOTEL,"MB Hotel, Trademark Collection by Wyndham",https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/22/62/f4/7d/exterior.jpg,[],157,$$$,$165 - $265,hotel,3.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 305-376-0359,"6525 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33141-4755",,[],80,[],25.848673,-80.120155,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d558250-Reviews-MB_Hotel_Trademark_Collection_by_Wyndham-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.wyndhamhotels.com/hotel/48182,#157 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,628,"A surprising gem in Miami Beach‼️

First of all: I travel extensively & have stayed at hotels all across the world. I have stayed at several of Miami’s most famous hotels: The Setai, the Ritz-Carlton, the Fontainebleau, Loews. I had never stayed in a 3 stars hotels before & this hotel is better than some of the 4 stars hotels I have patronized.

My boyfriend chose it & it’s perfectly located near our friends who live a few blocks south on Collins Avenue. 
It is extremely easy to get to South Beach, Coral Gables & Little Havana, places where we like to eat. It has also an easy access Key Biscayne where I also regularly visit friends.

The Wyndham MB Trademark is so much better than we expected!
The staff is amazing: 
ALOIS took over 30 minutes to answer my call & address all my questions before we decided to finalize our booking. 
Alois, JAVIER & ADRIANA are all at the front desk & they go above & beyond to be helpful, are extremely accommodating, pleasant, nice & professional. 
OSCAR & ACHILLES at the restaurant are also amazing. Oscar just brings a smile on your face anytime you see him because he is so sweet, friendly & always smiling & trues his best to make you feel like you are home.

Based on other reviews it seems like some of the rooms need to be updated. I cannot speak about those rooms. 
We stayed in an updated room and everything was great: the bathroom & the bedroom are big.  The only issue for us: there was not enough closet space & no drawers. We were staying for a long time and needed more storage place but guests who come for a weekend or a few days will be absolutely fine.

The hotel is located right on the beach.
The beach access is easy. Between the hotel and the beach there is a beautiful pool area that is gorgeous & well maintained with daily morning clean up. The pool is also much larger than expected.
 I don’t think the hotel’s online pictures showcase how great the hotel is.

Working on the beach you have: Leo & Santiago who are also extremely accommodating & nice.

For the price, this is definitely a fantastic deal! 
I don’t have a reason to stay in a hotel in Miami unless I am there with friends celebrating a bachelorette party, a special birthday, a girls’ weekend and so forth. 
But I know that this is a place I want to come back to very soon…. Mainly for the wonderful staff but also because of the beautiful place & the small scale of the hotel. I do not like large 
hotels. This is a small boutique hotel that I 
think Wyndham will keep on improving & hopefully get all the stars it deserves. 

We were there while they were actually redoing the fifth floor restaurant and we could only enjoy it for a few days but they did a fantastic job. The view is  unbelievable and once again the restaurant staff is just beyond kind, accommodating and fun and it does make a difference when you are on vacation.
The hotel is conveniently located near a lot of very good restaurants such as one of my favorite Miami restaurant, the Peruvian gem Locura  Marina. 
The hotel is also very accessible by public transportation, is on the route of the free Miami trolley (we took it once & it was great) and it also offers a parking right across the street for a dayly $20 fee. 

I wish I could have stayed there a full month. I know I will be visiting them soon enough & I even joined the Wyndham hotel Rewards Loyalty program because I know I will be a regular guest to this property.",A wonderful stay!

115184,HOTEL,The Marlin Hotel,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/09/32/c0/fa/the-marlin-hotel.jpg,[],36,$$$,$230 - $363,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17869334820,"1200 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4607",concierge@themarlinhotel.com,[],33,[],25.783003,-80.13151,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d115184-Reviews-The_Marlin_Hotel-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.themarlinhotel.com,#36 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,929,"Had a reservation at Loews for a 3 night stay before a cruise.   A week prior I cancelled it and booked The Marlin given the reviews and ranking.   We've stayed at Loews, The Betsy and Ritz Carlton previously.   Regretted that decision and surprised this property it ranks as high as it does.

Pros
- beautifulyl designed lobby.   our room (corner suite) was lovely, in great condition and well appointed.  Very clean
- wifi was really good overall 
- i noticed mostly families - which is great as its quiet in the evening and night, but starting fairly early in the morning, we heard alot of doors and kids in the hall.  Its not the best for sound proofing

Cons
- the service is underwhelming at best.   a very low energy vibe - lacking hospitality and engagement.   Especially the two ladies overseeing the breakfast service (perhaps less engaged on a personal cell phone will on the job might help - especially when there are empty tables that need to be cleared).  The service we experienced at breakfast didn't encourage us to have dinner at the restaurant - we went elsewhere.
- breakfast offering was b.a.s.i.c.   We came down at 9:30 and barely anything left - they replenished very slowly (a reflection of the lack of attentiveness by the staff).
- when we checked in, we were explained the resort fee - which we were told included beach chairs, breakfast and use of the bathrobes !?! 
- there is a scent that is pumped throughout the lobby, hall and rooms.   I found it quite strong and unpleasant.    it certainly wasn't subtle.
- the lobby reception staff just sit there - not once did i see them get up and assist guests.    when we checked out, there was no one waiting behind me, and the young fella watched my husband get all our bags out and down the front stairs, and after we settled our room and i turned to leave, he sat there and asked ""do you want some help?"" ... after we got everything out - how helpful. My son was blown away by the Murphy bed but more importantly, the 2-room suite was clean, roomy, and quiet.  There was refrigerator space for some essentials, comfortable bedding and good drawer and hanging space.  We were in the main building-- there's a small but beautiful roof deck that was easy to access, and we spent lots of time in the pool in the building next door.  The pool was quiet, mostly adults lounging in the sun, but it was perfect for my son, who was just learning to swim.  The 3-4 foot depth was ideal for a kid, and there were some nice shady areas to relax.  The location was great-- 2 blocks from the pool, quick walk to shops on Lincoln Road, a few kid-friendly restaurants (take out from Taco Taco, take out or eat in at Time Out Miami market). 87000,HOTEL,Uma House by Yurbban,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1d/c3/13/e9/miscellaneous.jpg,[],16,$$$,$194 - $328,hotel,4.5,4.0,This property is classified according to Accor Hotels.,3053901184,"1775 James Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139",southbeach@umahouse.com,[],136,[],25.793676,-80.13067,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d87000-Reviews-Uma_House_by_Yurbban-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.umahousesouthbeach.com/?utm_source=tripadvisor&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=perfilplus,#16 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2141,"This tres chic boutique hotel with a retro/bohemian vibe proved to be nothing short of an amazing 2 day getaway in South Beach.  The hotel's entrance is on a side street - which is a much more zen welcome than arriving at a hotel on the bustling main drag of Collins Avenue.  

I was met by the two receptionists who quickly checked me in and I was escorted to my room by a lovely bellman.  The king size room was very spacious, and sun drenched, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in, in quite some time.  The  neutral tones of the decor kept with the very zen vibe I was hoping for.

What a treat to have an old record player, in the room, where I listened to Marvin Gay while getting dressed for a delicious cocktail downstairs at Cafe Americano.

The rooftop pool was clean and relaxing and the delicious Aperol Spritz whipped up  the by bartender was refreshing and delicious.

The complimentary coffee and biscotti in the lobby was perfection.

I will come back again and again.  This is my new favorite spot in South Beach.   I highly  recommend this great newcomer!","Relaxing, Zen retreat"

1449858,HOTEL,The Local House,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1a/23/db/b3/rooftop-pool-and-lounge.jpg,[],46,$$$,$211 - $382,hotel,4.5,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,13055385529,"400 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-6614",info@localhouse.com,[],18,[],25.773394,-80.13237,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d1449858-Reviews-The_Local_House-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://localhouse.com,#46 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,782,"Believe everything you read from other reviews about the room, the location and the staff. All great.

It's expensive staying anywhere decent in South Miami, but here you are paying for a great boutique hotel with breakfast included. Other reviews may have mentioned the coffee, which is Julius Meinl. But it helps that it's served with the help of a pro coffee machine run by an expert. This was the best coffee on an entire vacation in Florida. If I was out for a walk on South Beach, I'd seriously stop just for that. 

The only downside to this place is that some of the breakfast items were cooked early in the morning, a common practice, but the restaurant does not seem to have a very good warmer. However the coffee and excellent home fries recipe made up for it. 

Noise can be an issue in this very busy part of Miami, but this is a pretty good spot for that, it just has regular city traffic, there are no booming clubs super close. The doors to the rooms are average, so if anyone else on your floor arrives back at the hotel at a late hour, talking up a storm...well..you may hear that. But that can happen pretty much anywhere I suppose.

The rooftop pool may be a bit chilly for people from the warmer states, but for us, it was perfect, we had the entire roof to ourselves, with local beer that is just an elevator ride away. Pretty great, we may well be back.","Great Location, Great Staff"

It's in an excellent position with the road outside pedestrian only so relatively quiet for central South Beach!
The breakfast was fine  - eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast, or other choices and tea or coffee.

However, we booked  a classic room, and it had a few issues.
The room looked cool with exposed brickwork and wooden blinds.
But the bathroom had a sliding door right opposite the end of the bed; the door  was not even long enough to completely cover the door gap so no privacy whatsoever. The bathroom had nowhere to put anything. Only 2 large towels were provided, and there's no extractor fan in the bathroom.
The fixed shower door is 6"" too short so water just cascades onto the floor.
The bed was very small, I think it was smaller than a standard double, and the pillows were very lumpy. Nowhere to put your suitcase
There is no sound proofing so you can hear the people in the next room even talking.
We did ask if we could move on the first night but were told there was nothing else available except a smaller room with 2 beds.

111876,HOTEL,Cavalier Hotel South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/33/87/ac/cavalier-south-beach.jpg,[],101,$$$,$191 - $350,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17867131749,"1320 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4210",reservations@cavaliersouthbeach.com,[],46,[],25.784355,-80.130196,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d111876-Reviews-Cavalier_Hotel_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.cavaliersouthbeach.com,#101 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,454,"Stayed here for one night only. We had the suite on the second floor, their ""best room"" as the person at check in told me. I have stayed at ""boutique"" hotels before in South Beach, and was not sure what to expect. I have seen some cruddy rooms. However, this room was VERY nice and roomy. Living room with pull put couch, a seprate bedroom, and washroom that's accessible from both rooms. A small hallway when you enter. Nice big windows overlooking Ocean Drive and the beach.

The room is comfy, modern, and lots of room. Nice washroom. However, two small things would make this room much better.

There are no locks on the washroom doors, and there are doors on two sides -- from the living room and the bedroom. I am sure many people have been ""walked into"" while in the washroom. Even some small cheap eye and socket locks from a hardware store would work. 

Also, the bedroom should have a door to separate it from the rest of the suite. This would also be a fairly simple addition. There is not a lot of privacy if you are two couples, or even a family, in the suite.

Reception was very nice nice and helpful. The location is superb of course, right on Ocean Drive. Breakfast was slow service, but it was busy, and the food was good. A full hot breakfast was included for all 4 of us. There was a festival on the beach that blocked our access to the water, which kind of sucked. We had to walk up to 10th St (3 blocks) to get to the beach. Not the hotel's fault of course. The Irish Pub beside the hotel was very fun, although my memory there is a bit hazy for some reason.

Overall a very nice stay and experience at this hotel.",Very nice boutique hotel -- try to get the suite

111876,HOTEL,Cavalier Hotel South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/33/87/ac/cavalier-south-beach.jpg,[],101,$$$,$191 - $350,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17867131749,"1320 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4210",reservations@cavaliersouthbeach.com,[],46,[],25.784355,-80.130196,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d111876-Reviews-Cavalier_Hotel_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.cavaliersouthbeach.com,#101 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,454,Cavalier South Beach Hotel on Ocean Drive in Miami Beach has everything that you need in a place to stay. 111876,HOTEL,Cavalier Hotel South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/33/87/ac/cavalier-south-beach.jpg,[],101,$$$,$191 - $350,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17867131749,"1320 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4210",reservations@cavaliersouthbeach.com,[],46,[],25.784355,-80.130196,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d111876-Reviews-Cavalier_Hotel_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.cavaliersouthbeach.com,#101 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,454,"If I'm honest this was not the hotel I intended to book for this trip, but the ones I know were either full or ridiculously priced, and the Cavalier seemed to offer a decent location/amenities/price combination for the couple of nights I was here. 

Well, forget my initial doubts, I was in fact really impressed by the hotel and will come back with some enthusiasm. 

The location is excellent, in the art deco area of South Beach, directly on Ocean drive. This is one of the prettiest parts of Miami beach to walk around and one very well equiped in small hotels, restaurants, bars, etc. 

My room was beautifully decorated, with a tropical feel, dark woods, and colourful highlights due to contemporary colourful reinterpretations of classic portraits. Bed was very comfortable, and whilst I usually prefer rooms with bathtubs, the showerroom was very nice with dark woods and golden mosaic highlights and a very good shower. Toiletries were good quality and generously stocked and towels were fluffy and nice.  There is an empty mini fridge which was great as I was there during very rough weather and this allowed me to stock up on food till tropical storm Nicole moved away (the restaurant was closed for lunch and dinner for a couple of days as a result of the weather). 

Like many (most?) Miami beach hotels, the Cavalier charges an annoying resort fee (around $25/day I think), I hate those, but at least in this case, you know what you are paying for: you get a simple but nice breakfast every morning: a choice of one dish (fried or scrambled eggs with one meat, scrambled eggs with vegetables, pancakes, or yoghurt and fruit, alongside coffee or tea). You get access to beach chairs at a nearby cabana on the beach (Esteban's about 5 minutes' walk - basically the hotel is at the corner of 13th and the beach is off 15th). You get the towels from the hotel itself. Umbrellas cost extra if you want them. You also get decent internet and coffee and tea in the lobby all day. 

Personnel was very nice, especially the young man who checked me in and again checked me out a couple of days later (didn't get his name but he was nice, helpful, and friendly). 

The hotel is small. ground floor + 2 levels up, the building itself is very pretty and well renovated, the lobby is nice and pleasant and when the weather is good, the restaurant also has tables outside on ocean drive. 

The bottom line: this is a real boutique hotel, not one of those 200 room places which call themselves boutique just to claim to be edgy. It is small, friendly, individual and has personality and a decor that makes a statement. It has the limitations of a small and relatively old hotel (so no swimming pool, no balconies, etc unlike the big modern buildings you find a bit further up the beach) but also the charm and friendliness that those big hotels often lack and it was beautiful, comfortable, and very well located. The free breakfast is a big bonus and I appreciated the empty mini fridge too. I'll surely be back!",A great South Beach boutique hotel

111876,HOTEL,Cavalier Hotel South Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1c/33/87/ac/cavalier-south-beach.jpg,[],101,$$$,$191 - $350,hotel,4.0,3.0,This property is classified according to Giata.,17867131749,"1320 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139-4210",reservations@cavaliersouthbeach.com,[],46,[],25.784355,-80.130196,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d111876-Reviews-Cavalier_Hotel_South_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,http://www.cavaliersouthbeach.com,#101 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,454,"This is a beautiful Art Deco Hotel on Ocean Drive. Very reasonably priced for the area and our price included the Resort Tax which gave us beach towels and sun loungers on the beach each day. The sun loungers have the option to add a parasol for $20 per day if you wish, but as we were there in October and the weather was 28°c we were okay with a parasol.
The hotel is 1930s in style and this must be taken into consideration, if you are expecting a modern 5* hotel, you will be disappointed, this hotel offers a 5* service and is very clean with spacious rooms. We would have loved a sea view room but these are limited, if we had paid more I'm sure a sea view would have been no issue. Breakfast was included in our price and although limited it was perfectly adequate for the price we paid. I enjoyed pancakes and adding bacon was not an issue. The breakfast team are friendly and attentive.
Eddie on the front desk is a star, such a polite and friendly young man. He told us about the many original features of the hotel and that the lift is original and of importance to the city of Miami.....he clearly enjoys his job and is proud of the building he works in.
All in all, we were impressed as we like small quirky hotels and try to avoid big corporate hotels, we will definitely be back.
I almost forgot, happy hour 5-7pm where reduced priced drinks and food is available, we had the drinks but not the food, however, we saw other tables getting food and it was a decent portion for the price.
It's also nextdoor but one from The Carlisle which was used in The Birdcage. Lovely area, lovely people, lovely hotel.","Good value for money, great location, art deco charm.... perfect for us."

Also, I wasn't a fan of the breakfast that is included as it is a shortened version of the paid breakfast menu and my first was cold and then microwaved to heat it, which pretty much ruined my eggs. 
I would definitely stay here again as the positives outweighed the negatives. 
Shout out to Nesrine at the front desk, who always greeted me with a smile and was open to help with any of my requests. A special shout-out and thanks to Eddie, also at the front desk. A lovely young man whose bright disposition and willingness to help at all times was a welcome to my entry and exit to the hotel whenever he was on shift. 
I also met who I think was either the manager or owner a couple of times who I found to be both welcoming and courteous. 
I'll see you again soon. Thank you for making my first, but not last visit to Sounthbeach such a wonderful experience. ",I will be back.

Everything at the hotel was top notch, from the staff, to the parking arrangements, to the view, the hotel room, the food, the ambiance. The hotel exuded class without being arrogance, and with attention to details. Contemporary, classy, but true to it's roots in culture.

We were treated extremely well, and the recommendations the hotel concierge made for us for day and night entertainment were top par. We were fashionably late for many of the events outside of the hotel because we were enjoying ourselves too much at the pool and at the bar. The hotel rooms were reinvigorating, and amazingly quiet for all the social activity going on outside in the hotel and beyond. And our fellow guests and even the staff members were amazing people to talk to, from the four corners of the world.

85177,HOTEL,Fontainebleau Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/6b/49/a9/chateau-hero-day.jpg,[],106,$$$$,$314 - $562,hotel,4.0,4.5,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 800-548-8886,"4441 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140-3227",info@fontainebleau.com,[],1504,[],25.817417,-80.12211,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d85177-Reviews-Fontainebleau_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://fontainebleau.com/,#106 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,19456,"I’ve been a regular visitor to this hotel over the past few years, but this latest trip confirms it has become a nouveau riche dumpster fire.

A large, obnoxious group of people has descended on the joint over spring break, and have allowed their disorderly children and tweens to joyride the elevators, loiter in the halls, and generally undermine the sophistication and magic this iconic hotel once possessed.

On account of this large group, it takes 20 minutes for the elevators to arrive. And we’ve been having to sardine ourselves into the elevators which seem to stop on every floor to pick up ever greater numbers of these deplorables, despite the elevators being filled to capacity. The fact that these people choose to force their way into the already crowded space is a testament to their disregard for others.

I can look past the vanity and narcissism of people sitting by the pool in Audemars Piguet watches and stacks of Cartier love bracelets — and I can definitely try my best to ignore the fact that everything is so eye-wateringly expensive.

But what really rubs me the wrong way is that the experience—for all the reasons I’ve just explained—simply isn’t worth the prices I’m being charged.

I can definitely pay more at places like The Edition, Faena, W, and Ritz Carlton and have a better experience.

But I could also pay less at places like The Eden Roc, Cadillac, or The Raleigh and very possibly have a better stay…

The real tragedy here is that this beautiful hotel is slowly destroying its reputation by choosing not to enforce basic tenets of decorum and allowing a certain element of its guests to ruin the experience for others.",A few rotten apples spoils the bag
85177,HOTEL,Fontainebleau Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/6b/49/a9/chateau-hero-day.jpg,[],106,$$$$,$314 - $562,hotel,4.0,4.5,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 800-548-8886,"4441 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140-3227",info@fontainebleau.com,[],1504,[],25.817417,-80.12211,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d85177-Reviews-Fontainebleau_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://fontainebleau.com/,#106 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,19456,"To say I’m disappointed is an understatement. I came to this hotel as a teen. As a mid-aged adult, I wanted to love it. But so much for in the way:
- Entitled obnoxious narcissistic clientele. Expect to claw and fight your way to get a coffee, get up the elevator, or check out. Fuggetabout it regarding getting a pool chair if you’re not up and out by 8:10am, kissing up to and greasing the pool attendants with serious cash. You’ll be sitting on the lawn in direct sunlight if you don’t tip upfront and tip well, almost create a contract with the attendant that they take care of you and your family for the trip- want to feel special or feel like a loser? Bring cash and lots cause no one wants to feel less than at The Fountainbleau. Bring your best designer sunglasses, flip flops, and designer hat. Rolex and diamonds by the pool. This is how they roll. 

Plan to wait 45 minutes for the elevator with your designer luggage. Check-in and out were a nightmare. Parking is $58/night. If you’re doing an owner’s unit, $175 plus tax for housecleaning. 

Lines for the coffee, lines for a sandwich.  Water $10.  Drinks by the pool- $31 then add tip and tax. 

So much seaweed on the beach. 

If you’re not in the first row on the beach, the other chairs and umbrellas block your view of the ocean. You might as well be in Brooklyn on the asphalt, listening to your rude relatives scream at each other. 

If you want to feel special, book a suite at a 5 star boutique hotel anywhere in the world. It’ll cost you less. 

And look at your bill before or after you check out. They tried to rip me off in creative ways by reversing credited charges or adding an extra parking fee. 

Oh, and the staff are miserable. Sad faces, unhappy employees. Housekeeping walks right by loads of piled up garbage in the halls. Stacks of dirty towels sitting outside rooms for days. 

Someone’s not making this place run right. It’s all a facade. Like so many of the clientele who have no class and charge up a storm to look like they’re something they’re not. Until they get the bill. Good luck getting what you paid for, or seeing that you’re charged for things you didn’t expect. 

This iconic hotel in a beautiful setting deserves to live up to its glamour and glitz but it is a dirty scoundrel. Somebody clean up this mess and restore it so it can shine and sparkle. It’s way too expensive to be just a dusty diamond, no longer worth its weight. An influx of workers who want to work and cater to clients, who can get the job done and done well is what’s needed so vacationers can get their cappuccinos right away and get their pool chairs easily, and not go hungry, and get to their rooms, and get what they need to make their vacations go right. Otherwise, it’s stress and frustration, which is why we  needed a vacation in the first place. Calvin, take me away. And if I’m taken to the Radisson across the street, it may be a better more relaxing time! Fountainbleau- adeux to you. Wish you were my style, but you failed me.","5 star dreams, 2 star reality."

85177,HOTEL,Fontainebleau Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/28/6b/49/a9/chateau-hero-day.jpg,[],106,$$$$,$314 - $562,hotel,4.0,4.5,This property is classified according to Giata.,+1 800-548-8886,"4441 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140-3227",info@fontainebleau.com,[],1504,[],25.817417,-80.12211,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d85177-Reviews-Fontainebleau_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://fontainebleau.com/,#106 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,19456,"The Fontainebleau Hotel is a very big hotel.  The largest I recall staying in.  Whatever you budget for your stay there add at least 50%  Once there, everything is very expensive.  You will never think, wow, that’s reasonable. I was on the beach each day, really never sat at the pool which was always packed. The beach.  The sun is beating down.  You want an umbrella. You will be charged $26 plus tax for each umbrella for 5 minutes or all day.  The food and beverage service experience depends on the server.  One day I had a Russian young lady.  She was awesome. Next day a Venezuelan young lady, she looked frazzled but did a great job.  Then had a day with a young man.  He was not good at all.  He certainly was not stressed and just wandered around.  He forgot about my order.  One day had the hamburger sliders. I could tell they cooked frozen patty’s —raw in the middle when served.  I could not eat much of them.  The hotdogs and chicken tenders were good.  Stick with them.  If you eat your hotdogs the Chicago way, with mustard, bring some from the restaurant.  I asked for mustard each time I ordered a hotdog and never got it.  They always dumped ketchup packets in the box—never mustard. Very expensive food.  
Breakfast inside is good.  Buffet is very good as is ordering off the menu.  There is an inside coffee shop with pastries and more.  Good stuff in there.  If you want to park a car at the Fontainebleau it will cost $67 plus tax each night. Room cleaning service is good.  When checking out allow extra time.  People have checkout shock and tend to review all the charges.  

The Fontainebleau does have guest trust issues.  Once at the restaurant they took my drivers license back to the kitchen to check out.  One day on the beach they (food and beverage service) held my room pass card until I left for the day.  Other days not.  Then there were times they wanted to see my room pass card going or coming to the beach or pool area.  None of this was consistent.  Sometimes a shake down including bag inspections, other times nothing.  Once I saw a man trying to get to the pool and could not show a room pass card.  I kept going without being asked.  I don’t know what happened to the the cardless guest.  

I liked the gym.  

Disclaimer. I am an old man.  Here’s the thing.  Everywhere I saw people enjoying themselves and having a good time.  I did not see anyone over the age of 5 that was unhappy.  Yes, some kids get cranky.  Given the enormous size of the Fontainebleau, I have to say they do a good job.  This is not the Fontainebleau pre 1970.  But if you can afford it and are OK with being in a busy hotel, then I can recommend the Fontainebleau.",An enjoyable and expensive hotel

7787044,HOTEL,Faena Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1d/78/a4/13/exterior-view.jpg,[],5,$$$$,"$729 - $1,426",hotel,4.5,0.0,,13055348800,"3201 Collins Ave Faena District, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4023",reservations-miamibeach@faena.com,[],179,[],25.807375,-80.12364,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d7787044-Reviews-Faena_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.faena.com/miami-beach,#5 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2123,"Faena is over-rated. 

It would be a 3 star review if it were a 4 star $500 a night type place. But given the price point (we paid $1600/night for our room) and 5 star rating, I am giving it 2. There are much better options for the price point and 5 star category in this location, in my experience (have stayed in miami beach multiple times). 

To start with the positive: The services is really good/attentive, the grounds (not rooms) and restaurants are cool/flashy/sceney, and the pool/grounds are solid (not the best in miami). It is popular for the restaurants and cool designs on the grounds and well trained staff. However overall I think there are much better luxury options in miami beach / south beach for an actual stay, if you care more about quality of rooms/actual property, location, and pool. 

Issues: 1) the rooms are not that nice. We booked a junior king suite partial ocean view room for $1600/night. The room felt like 4 star vegas with no view. Low ceilings, bones and finishing quality mediocre, cool design touches but overall not 5 star room bones. 2) the hotel is right next to another taller / bigger building that is pretty close, so 95% of the view was blocked/looking directly at that building. We were on the north side which is where half the rooms of the type we booked are, maybe the other side is better. We didnt feel like we were on the beach despite the price and description of the room, you could not see ocean unless standing at an extreme angle to the window. We asked for an upgrade because we thought the description was misleading; we were told this was normal / how the rooms were, and would have to pay significantly more to upgrade. 3) location: it isnt that close to nice restaurants other than the ones at the hotel, which are good, but there isnt much to do around the actual hotel. Options are stay on the grounds or get a 20 minute uber. Not walkable. 

Overall I would go here for dinner / drinks and stay somewhere else. One hotel (better all around, most similar from a luxury standpoint but better luxury IMO), Standard (better vibe, better pool, not as luxury, but cooler, and better location), and fountainebleau (better resort-like if that is what you want, faena is kind of resort like) are all better options in my experience. All have better views/pool, and the One and Standard are notably better locations (especially the standard; One is closer / more walkable. The FB is even further/worse location but if you dont want to leave it is better than Faena).  I think Faena gets the strong reviews more from the service (which is great and which does make people want to reciprocate with a good review) and the restaurants (they are cool but you dont need to stay here to eat here). And the unique designs/art. But actual rooms, views, location all mediocre, pool etc. fine but not standout. ",Overrated. There are better luxury options on miami beach / south beach

7787044,HOTEL,Faena Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1d/78/a4/13/exterior-view.jpg,[],5,$$$$,"$729 - $1,426",hotel,4.5,0.0,,13055348800,"3201 Collins Ave Faena District, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4023",reservations-miamibeach@faena.com,[],179,[],25.807375,-80.12364,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d7787044-Reviews-Faena_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.faena.com/miami-beach,#5 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2123,"This is a very good hotel.   But after the superlative reviews and at a rather breathtaking price, I honestly was expecting something perfect.  

The pluses: the staff, the staff, the staff.  Kind and genuinely wanting to be helpful.  Also the spa - exquisite and great treatment.   The decor is as special as you would expect from the pictures you have seen.  

The minuses: my room (415) was billed as an ocean view junior suite.  However, the ocean view from such a low floor isn’t much - and the room, right on top of the spa, looks much more directly onto an events/dining area - sitting on the balcony didn’t feel private or restful at all.  While some junior suites have desk areas, this one did not - a shame as I had to work.  I asked about moving but they were undersndably fully booked.  Of course no Virtuoso upgrade available. Also, there was a crib in my room ( not requested by me) when I checked in. I asked before dinner and after dinner to have it removed. After I got tired of waiting for someone to come to get it I just moved it into the hallway myself. Not a big deal but not perfect service either.  These things aren’t tragedies but at more than 2700/night w fees and taxes ….. you do want better. 

Minor quibbles with the room had to do with electricity: the outlet for the coffee maker was broken and although engineering was called, it wasn’t fixed. And the light switches could drive you crazy trying to get the lights to actually turn off.  Japanese toilet is a great touch though.

Food and beverage; dinner at Los Fuegos and breakfast were great service.   Nothing that memorable food wise but nothing was bad either.   The steak at Los Fuegos was good but the appetizer was bland - same w breakfast dishes.  The pool and beach food service is great but the food not that exciting. Go to the pool early if you want an umbrella. By 11:30 AM you could still get a lounger, but nothing shaded.

I will probably come back because of the service. I think I will book a lower room category that is less expensive , so I am less disappointed!",Very good  but not perfect

7787044,HOTEL,Faena Miami Beach,https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/1d/78/a4/13/exterior-view.jpg,[],5,$$$$,"$729 - $1,426",hotel,4.5,0.0,,13055348800,"3201 Collins Ave Faena District, Miami Beach, FL 33140-4023",reservations-miamibeach@faena.com,[],179,[],25.807375,-80.12364,https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g34439-d7787044-Reviews-Faena_Miami_Beach-Miami_Beach_Florida.html,https://www.faena.com/miami-beach,#5 of 235 hotels in Miami Beach,235,2123,"Maybe it was because of the four day Presidents weekend. Maybe it was because there was a massive boat show in town. Either way, we got suckered into paying $2,500/night for three nights at the Faena, so we we expected opulence.  What we got was a ripoff at a $400/night hotel. 
The location is excellent, right on a private beach. That’s the only positive of this review. Here’s the abundant negatives:
* it was a windy day at the beach, so we asked for a canopy. We were told they were all reserved. There were only six of them. For an entire hotel. So we instead sat on the windy beach and enjoyed a $20 pina colada in a pre-packaged coconut.
* so we went to the pool. You can’t just sit down, they find you a seat. But we were told all the lounges were reserved, even the empty ones that go with the cabanas, and the cabanas were all reserved. Come back in an hour, we were told.
* our room, which was exceedingly average, smelled like mildew. They sent housekeeping with some sprays. The room was also quite dark, and the lights didn’t go up any higher.
* as for Miami Beach, it’s nice. There’s a long walkway that I went on for a mile or so, seeing where it led. Turns out it didn’t lead anywhere. There’s not much to do here other than beach and restaurants. 
* there’s some fun art, including gold wooly mammoth bones. But the glass case is cracked, and, like the rest of this hotel, the display seems old and neglected.
And that, dear reader, all happened within 24 hours. Because after the pool fiasco, we up and left the Faena for greener pastures — the reliable Four Seasons in the Brickell section of Miami, which was wonderful (see my review of that wonderful hotel for details). The Faena was nice enough to cancel our second and third nights, and we paid less than half at a way better hotel. Do yourself a favor. Skip this aging monolith.",BEWARE: Do not overpay!
